1.verse: Prologue—Psalms 1–2 -Psalm 1 -True Happiness -Blessed is the manwho does not walk in the counsel of the wicked,nor stand in the way of sinners,nor sit in the company of scoffers.

2.verse: Rather, his delight is in the law of the Lord,and on that law he meditates day and night.

3.verse: He is like a tree planted near streams of water,which bears fruit in its season,and whose leaves never wither.In the same way,everything he does will prosper.

4.verse: This is not true of the wicked,for they are like chaff that the wind blows away.

5.verse: Therefore, the wicked will not stand firm at the judgment,nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.

6.verse: For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous,but the way of the wicked will perish.

1.verse: Psalm 2 -Universal Reign of the Messiah -Why do the nations rageand the peoples devise futile plots?

2.verse: The kings of the earth rise up,and the princes conspire togetheragainst the Lordand against his Anointed One:

3.verse: “Let us finally break their shacklesand cast away their chains from us.”

4.verse: The one who is enthroned in heaven laughs;the Lord mocks their plans.

5.verse: Then he rebukes them in his angerand terrifies them in his wrath, saying,

6.verse: “I myself have anointed my kingon Zion, my holy mountain.”

7.verse: I will proclaim the decree of the Lord:He said to me, “You are my son;this day I have begotten you.”

8.verse: Simply make the request of me,and I will give you the nations as your inheritance,and the ends of the earth as your possession.

9.verse: You will rule them with an iron scepter;you will shatter them like a potter’s vessel.

10.verse: Therefore, O kings, pay heed;take warning, O rulers of the earth.

11.verse: Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice before him;with trembling

12.verse: bow down in homagelest he become angryand you perish from the way,for his wrath can flare up in an instant.Blessed are all thosewho take refuge in him.

1.verse: Book I—Psalms 3–41 -Psalm 3 -Trust in God in Time of Danger -A psalm of David. When he was fleeing from his son Absalom.

2.verse: O Lord, how great is the number of my enemies,how many are those who rise up against me.

3.verse: How numerous are the ones who say of me,“He will not receive salvation from God.” Selah

4.verse: But you, O Lord, are a shield to protect me;you are my glory and the one who raises my head high.

5.verse: Whenever I cry aloud to the Lord,he answers me from his holy mountain. Selah

6.verse: I lie down and sleep;I awaken again, for the Lord sustains me.

7.verse: Thus, I will not fear the multitudeswho have surrounded me on every side.

8.verse: Rise up, O Lord!Rescue me, O my God!You will strike all my enemies across the faceand break the teeth of the wicked.

1.verse: Psalm 4 -Joyful Confidence in God -For the director. With stringed instruments. A psalm of David.

2.verse: When I call upon you, answer me, O God,you who uphold my rights.When I was in distress, you set me free;have pity on me and listen to my prayer.

3.verse: How long will you people turn my glory into shame,cherishing what is worthless and pursuing what is false? Selah

4.verse: Remember that the Lord wonderfully favors those who are faithful,and the Lord listens when I call out to him.

5.verse: When you are angry, be careful not to sin;reflect in silenceas you lie upon your beds. Selah

6.verse: Offer worthy sacrificesand place your trust in the Lord.

7.verse: Many exclaim, “Who will show us better times!Let the light of your face shine on us, O Lord!”

8.verse: You have granted my heart greater joythan others experience when grain and wine abound.

1.verse: Psalm 5 -Morning Prayer for Divine Help -For the director. With flutes. A psalm of David.

2.verse: Listen to my words, O Lord;pay heed to my sighs.

3.verse: Hear my cry for help,my King and my God;for to you I pray.

4.verse: O Lord, at daybreak you hear my voice;at daybreak I bring my petition before youand await your reply.

5.verse: For you are not a God who delights in wickedness;evil cannot remain in your presence.

6.verse: The arrogant shrink before your gaze;you hate all who do evil.

7.verse: You destroy all who tell lies;the Lord detests the violent and the deceitful.

8.verse: But I will enter your housebecause of your great kindness,and I will bow down in your holy temple,filled with awe of you.

9.verse: Lead me in your ways of righteousness, O Lord,for I am surrounded by enemies;make your path straight before me.

10.verse: For there is nothing trustworthy in their mouth;their heart devises treacherous schemes.Their throat is a wide open grave;with their tongue they utter flattery.

11.verse: Punish them, O God;may their intrigues result in their downfall.Cast them out because of their many transgressions,for they have rebelled against you.

12.verse: But may all who take refuge in you rejoice;may they shout for joy forever.Grant them your protectionso that those who love your name may rejoice in you.

1.verse: Psalm 6 -Evening Prayer for God’s Mercy -For the director. With stringed instruments. “Upon the eighth.” A psalm of David.

2.verse: O Lord, do not rebuke me in your angeror punish me in your wrath.

3.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am tottering;help me, O Lord, for my body is in agony.

4.verse: My soul is also filled with anguish.But you, O Lord—how long?

5.verse: Turn, O Lord, and deliver my soul;save me because of your kindness.

6.verse: For among the dead who remembers you?In the netherworld who sings your praises?

7.verse: I am exhausted from my sighing;every night I flood my bed with my tears,and I soak my couch with my weeping.

8.verse: My eyes grow dim because of my grief;they are worn out because of all my foes.

9.verse: Depart from me, all you evildoers,for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping.

10.verse: The Lord has listened to my pleas;the Lord has accepted my prayer.

1.verse: Psalm 7 -Appeal to the Divine Judge -A plaintive song of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning Cush, a Benjaminite.

2.verse: O Lord, my God, I take refuge in you;keep me safe from all my pursuers and deliver me,

3.verse: lest like a lion they tear me to piecesand carry me off, with no one to rescue me.

4.verse: O Lord, my God, if I have done this,if my hands are stained with guilt,

5.verse: if I have repaid a friend with treachery—I who spared the lives of those who without cause were my enemies—

6.verse: then let my foe pursue and overtake me;let him trample my life into the groundand leave my honor in the dust. Selah

7.verse: Rise up, O Lord, in your indignation;rise against the fury of my enemies.Rouse yourself for me,and fulfill the judgment you have decreed.

8.verse: Let the peoples assemble in your presenceas you sit above them enthroned on high.

9.verse: The Lord is the judge of the nations.Therefore, pass judgment on me, O Lord, according to my righteousness,according to my innocence, O Most High.

10.verse: Put an end to the malice of the wickedbut continue to sustain the righteous,O God of justice,you who search minds and hearts.

11.verse: God is a shield to me;he saves those who are upright of heart.

12.verse: God is a just judge,a God who expresses his indignation every day.

13.verse: When a sinner refuses to repent,God sharpens his sword,and he bends and aims his bow.

14.verse: He has prepared deadly weapons for himand made his arrows into fiery shafts.

15.verse: Behold, he who conceives iniquityand is pregnant with mischiefwill give birth to lies.

16.verse: He digs a pit and makes it deep,but he will fall into the trap he has made.

17.verse: His wickedness will recoil upon his own head,and his violence will fall back on his own crown.

1.verse: Psalm 8 -The Majesty of God and the Dignity of Human Beings -For the director. “Upon the gittith.” A psalm of David.

2.verse: O Lord, our Lord,how glorious is your name in all the earth!You have exalted your majesty above the heavens.

3.verse: Out of the mouths of newborn babes and infantsyou have brought forth praiseas a bulwark against your foes,to silence the enemy and the avenger.

4.verse: When I look up at your heavensthat have been formed by your fingers,the moon and the starsthat you set in place,

5.verse: what is man that you are mindful of him,the son of man that you care for him?

6.verse: You have made him a little less than the angelsand crowned him with glory and honor.

7.verse: You have given him dominion over the works of your handsand placed everything under his feet:

8.verse: all sheep and oxenas well as the beasts of the field,

9.verse: the birds of the air, the fish of the sea,and whatever swims in the paths of the sea.

1.verse: Psalms 9–10 -Psalm 9 -Thanksgiving for the Triumph of Justice -For the director. According to Muth Labben. A psalm of David.

2.verse: I will offer praise to you, O Lord,with my whole heart;I will recount all your wondrous deeds.

3.verse: I will rejoice and exult in you;I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.

4.verse: For my enemies have turned back;in your presence they stumble and perish.

5.verse: But you have upheld my just cause,you who are seated on your throne as a righteous judge.

6.verse: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked,erasing their name forever and ever.

7.verse: The enemies have suffered endless ruin;their cities have been utterly destroyed,and not even their memory remains.

8.verse: The Lord is enthroned forever;he has established his throne for judgment.

9.verse: He governs the world in righteousnessand judges the peoples with equity.

10.verse: The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed,a refuge in times of distress.

11.verse: Those who revere your name place their trust in you,for you never abandon those who seek you, O Lord.

12.verse: Sing praise to the Lord enthroned in Zion;proclaim to the nations his wondrous deeds.

13.verse: For the avenger of blood remembers them;he does not ignore the cry of the afflicted.

14.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord;behold how my enemies afflict me,you who save me from the gates of death.

15.verse: Then I will recount all your praisesand rejoice in your salvationat the gates of the Daughter of Zion.

16.verse: The nations have fallen into the pit they made;their feet have been caught in the snare they laid.

17.verse: The Lord has made himself known and rendered judgment;the wicked are ensnared in the work of their own hands. Higgaion, Selah

18.verse: The wicked will depart into the netherworld,all the nations that turned away from God.

19.verse: But the needy will not be forgotten forever,nor will the hope of the afflicted ever come to naught.

20.verse: Rise up, O Lord! Do not let man triumph;let the nations be judged before you.

1.verse: Psalm 10 -Prayer for Help against Oppressors -Why, O Lord, do you stand far off?Why do you remain hidden in times of trouble?

2.verse: In his arrogance the wicked hunts down the poor;let him be ensnared by the schemes he has devised.

3.verse: The wicked boasts of his wicked desires;he upholds the greedy and renounces the Lord.

4.verse: Filled with arrogance, he does not seek God,but thinks, “God does not exist.”

5.verse: The wicked always seems to prosper;your judgments are far from his mind,and he scoffs at all those who oppose him.

6.verse: He says in his heart, “I will not be swayed;I will never experience misfortune.”

7.verse: His mouth is filled with curses, deceit, and threats;his tongue breeds evil and malice.

8.verse: He lies in wait near the villages,and from ambush he slays the innocent;his eyes are on the watch for the helpless.

9.verse: He lies in wait like a lurking lion,ready to strike the helpless;he snares his victims,seizing them in his net.

10.verse: He crouches and lies low,and the poor are overwhelmed by his might.

11.verse: He thinks in his heart,“God has forgotten;he hides his face and will never see what is happening.”

12.verse: Arise, O Lord! Lift up your hand, O God!Do not forget the afflicted.

13.verse: Why should the wicked reject Godand say in his heart,“He will not call me to account”?

14.verse: But you note our troubles and our griefso that you may resolve our difficulties.The helpless entrusts himself to you;you are the recourse of the fatherless.

15.verse: Break the arms of the sinner and the evildoer;seek out the wickeduntil no more endure.

16.verse: The Lord is King forever and ever;the heathen will disappear from his land.

17.verse: You listen, O Lord, to the longings of the poor;you strengthen their courage and heed their prayers.

18.verse: You ensure justice for the fatherless and the oppressedso that no one on earth may fill them with terror.

1.verse: Psalm 11 -Unshakable Confidence in God -For the director. Of David.In the Lord I take refuge.How can you say to me,“Flee like a bird to your mountains!

2.verse: For behold, the wicked are bending their bowsas they fit their arrows to the stringso that from the shadowsthey can shoot at those who are upright.

3.verse: If the foundations are destroyed,what can be done by those who are righteous?”

4.verse: The Lord is in his holy temple;the Lord, whose throne is in heaven.His eyes are fixed on the world;his gaze examines everyone.

5.verse: The Lord tests the upright and the wicked;he detests the lover of violence.

6.verse: Upon the wicked he will rain downfiery coals and brimstone;a scorching wind will be their allotted portion.

7.verse: For the Lord is justand he loves righteous deeds;the upright will behold his face.

1.verse: Psalm 12 -Prayer against the Arrogance of Sinners -For the director. “Upon the eighth.” A psalm of David.

2.verse: Help, O Lord, for there are no godly left;the faithful have vanished from the human race.

3.verse: Neighbors utter lies to each other;they speak with flattering lips and deceitful hearts.

4.verse: May the Lord destroy all flattering lipsand every boastful tongue,

5.verse: those who say, “We will prevail by our tongues;with our lips as our ally,who can lord it over us?”

6.verse: “The poor have been oppressed,and those who are needy groan.Therefore, I will rise up now,” says the Lord;“I will grant them the safetyfor which they long.”

7.verse: And the promises of the Lord are certain;they are like silver refined in a furnaceand purified seven times.

8.verse: You, O Lord, will watch over usand preserve us from this generation forever.

1.verse: Psalm 13 -Prayer of One in Sorrow -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: How long, O Lord—will you forget me forever?How long will you hide your face from me?

3.verse: How long must I suffer anguish in my souland sorrow in my heart day and night?How long will my enemy lord it over me?

4.verse: Look upon me, O Lord, my God, and answer me;enlighten my eyes, lest I sleep in death,

5.verse: lest my enemy say, “I have defeated him,”and my foes exult in my collapse.

6.verse: As for me, I trust in your kindness;my heart rejoices in your salvation.

1.verse: Psalm 14 -Corruption and Punishment of the Godless -For the director. Of David.The fool says in his heart,“There is no God.”People are depraved and their deeds are vile;there is no one who does what is right.

2.verse: The Lord looks down from heavenupon the entire human race,to see if there are any who act with wisdom,if even a single one seeks God.

3.verse: But they have all left the right path;all alike are corrupt.There is no one who does what is right,not even one.

4.verse: Have all these evildoers no understanding?They devour my people as they eat bread,and they never call upon the Lord.

5.verse: But later they will be filled with terror,for God is on the side of the righteous.

6.verse: They sought to crush the hopes of the poor,but the Lord is their refuge.

7.verse: Who will accomplish the salvation of Israelthat is to come out of Zion?When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people,Jacob will rejoice and Israel will exult.

1.verse: Psalm 15 -The Righteous: Guests of God -A psalm of David.O Lord, who may dwell in your sanctuary?Who may abide on your holy mountain?

2.verse: The one who leads a blameless lifeand does what is right,who speaks the truth from the heart

3.verse: and does not slander anyone,who does not harm a friendand does not scorn a neighbor,

4.verse: who looks with disdain on the wickedbut honors those who fear the Lord,who abides by his oath,no matter what the cost,

5.verse: who does not charge interest on a loanand refuses to accept a bribe against the innocent.Whoever does these thingswill never fall.

1.verse: Psalm 16 -God the Supreme Good -A miktam of David.Protect me, O God,for in you I take refuge.

2.verse: I say to the Lord, “You are my Lord;I have no good apart from you.”

3.verse: As for the saints who are in the land,they are the noble ones,and in them there is all my delight.

4.verse: Those who chase after other godsonly multiply their sorrows.Never will I pour out libations of blood to them,nor will I take up their names on my lips.

5.verse: O Lord, you are my allotted portion and my cup;you have made my lot secure.

6.verse: The boundary lines have established a pleasant site for me;I have truly received a wonderful inheritance.

7.verse: I bless the Lord who offers me counsel;even during the night my heart instructs me.

8.verse: I keep the Lord always before me,for with him at my right handI will never fall.

9.verse: Therefore, my heart is gladand my soul rejoices;my body too is filled with confidence.

10.verse: For you will not abandon me to the netherworldor allow your Holy One to suffer corruption.

11.verse: You will show me the path to life;you will fill me with joy in your presenceand everlasting delights at your right hand.

1.verse: Psalm 17 -Prayer in Time of Persecution -A prayer of David.Hear, O Lord, my call for justice;give heed to my cry.Listen to the prayer of my lips,for they are free of deceit.

2.verse: Let my vindication issue forth from you;let your eyes discern what is right.

3.verse: You have probed my heartand examined me throughout the night.You have tested meand found no malice in me,for I have not sinned with my mouth.

4.verse: Despite what other people do,I have been guided by the word of your lipsand refrained from their acts of violence.

5.verse: My steps have held fast to your paths;my feet have not wavered.

6.verse: I call upon you, O God, for you will answer me.Incline your ear to me and listen to my plea.

7.verse: Show how wonderful is your kindness,you who save those who seek protectionby taking refuge at your right hand.

8.verse: Guard me as the apple of your eye;hide me in the shadow of your wings

9.verse: from the wicked who treat me with violence,from deadly enemies who surround me.

10.verse: There is no compassion in their hearts,and arrogance issues from their mouths.

11.verse: They track me down and begin to close in,watching for the chance to strike me down,

12.verse: like a lion primed to attack it prey,like a young lion lurking in hiding.

13.verse: Rise up, O Lord, confront them, and cast them down;deliver me from the wicked by your sword.

14.verse: With your hand, O Lord, snatch me from such people,from the worldly whose reward is in this life.You satisfy the hunger of those you cherish;their children have all they desireand leave their wealth to their little ones.

15.verse: But in my righteousness I will see your face;when I awaken, I will be blessed by beholding you.

1.verse: Psalm 18 -Thanksgiving for God’s Help -For the director. Of David, the servant of the Lord. He sang to the Lord the words of this song after the Lord had rescued him from the clutches of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.

2.verse: He said:I love you, O Lord, my strength,

3.verse: O Lord, my rock, my fortress, my deliverer.My God is my rock in whom I take refuge,my shield and the horn of my salvation,my stronghold.

4.verse: I call upon the Lord, who is worthy of all praise;and I am saved from my enemies.

5.verse: The cords of death encompassed me,and the torrents of destruction assailed me.

6.verse: The cords of the netherworld ensnared me,and the snares of death rose up before me.

7.verse: In my anguish I cried out to the Lordand called to my God for help.From his temple he heard my voice,and my cry to him reached his ears.

8.verse: The earth swayed and rocked;the foundations of the mountains shook,rocking because of his blazing anger.

9.verse: Smoke poured forth from his nostrils,while a scorching fire blazed out of his mouthand kindled coals into flame.

10.verse: He parted the heavens and came down;dark clouds lay under his feet.

11.verse: He rode upon a cherub,soaring swiftly on the wings of the wind.

12.verse: He used the darkness as his covering,and dense thunderclouds as his canopy.

13.verse: From the radiance before him thick clouds emerged,spewing hail and flashes of fire.

14.verse: The Lord thundered from the heavens,and the Most High let his voice be heard.

15.verse: He shot his arrows and scattered them,hurled his lightning bolts and routed them.

16.verse: Then the depths of the sea were exposed,and the earth’s foundations were laid bare,at the rebuke of the Lord,at the blast of wind from his nostrils.

17.verse: He reached down from on high and snatched me up;he drew me out of the watery depths.

18.verse: He delivered me from my powerful enemy,and from my foes, who were too strong for me.

19.verse: They assailed me in the day of my misfortune,but the Lord came forward to uphold me.

20.verse: He led me forth into the open field;he set me free because he was pleased with me.

21.verse: The Lord has dealt with me according to my righteousness;because my hands were pure, he has rewarded me.

22.verse: For I have kept the ways of the Lordand refused to turn away from my God.

23.verse: His laws are clearly known to me,and I have not failed to observe his decrees.

24.verse: I was blameless in his sight,and I kept myself free of sin.

25.verse: Therefore, the Lord has rewarded me according to my righteousness,because of the cleanness of my hands in his eyes.

26.verse: To the loyal, you show yourself to be loyal;to the blameless, you show yourself to be blameless;

27.verse: to the pure, you show yourself to be pure;but to the perverse, you show yourself to be shrewd.

28.verse: For you save the humble,but you bring down the haughty.

29.verse: You, O Lord, are light for my lamp;O my God, you make my darkness turn to light.

30.verse: With your help I can storm a rampart;with my God to aid me, I can scale any wall.

31.verse: The way of God is blameless,and the Lord’s promise proves true;he is a shield to allwho flee to him for safety.

32.verse: Indeed, who is God except the Lord?Who is the Rock besides our God?

33.verse: It is God who clothes me with strengthand makes my way blameless.

34.verse: He gives me the swift feet of a deerand places me securely on the heights.

35.verse: He trains my hands for warand my arms to bend a bow of bronze.

36.verse: You have given me the shield of your salvation;your right hand sustains me,and your goodness makes me great.

37.verse: You broadened the path beneath meso that my feet have never stumbled.

38.verse: I went after my enemies and overtook them;I did not turn back until they were defeated.

39.verse: When I knocked them down, they were unable to rise;they fell down at my feet.

40.verse: You clothed me with strength for the battleand cast down my adversaries beneath me.

41.verse: You made my enemies retreat before me,so that I could scatter those who hated me.

42.verse: They called for help, but there was no one to deliver them;they called to the Lord, but no answer came.

43.verse: I crushed them like fine dust before the wind;I trod on them like mud in the streets.

44.verse: You delivered me from a people in rebellion,and you placed me in charge of the nations;people I did not know have become my subjects.

45.verse: As soon as they heard me, they obeyed;foreigners groveled before me.

46.verse: Then they became disheartenedand came forth trembling from their strongholds.

47.verse: The Lord lives! Blessed be my Rock!Exalted be God, my Savior!

48.verse: O God, you obtained vindication for me,subjected nations under me,

49.verse: and freed me from my enemies.You exalted me over my adversariesand delivered me from the violent.

50.verse: For this, O Lord, I will praise you among the nationsand sing praise to your name.

1.verse: Psalm 19 -God’s Glory in Creation -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: The heavens proclaim the glory of God;the firmament shows forth the work of his hands.

3.verse: One day imparts that message to the next,and night conveys that knowledge to night.

4.verse: All this occurs without speech or utterance;no voice can be heard.

5.verse: Yet their message goes forth throughout the earth,and their words to the ends of the world.In the heavens he has placed a tent for the sun,

6.verse: which comes forth like a bridegroom from his wedding chamber,rejoicing like an athlete who runs his course.

7.verse: It rises from one end of the heavens,and its circuit is completed at the other;nothing can be hidden from its heat.

8.verse: The law of the Lord is perfect,affording refreshment to the soul.The decree of the Lord is worthy of trust,imparting wisdom to the simple.

9.verse: The precepts of the Lord are right,causing the heart to rejoice.The commands of the Lord are clear,giving light to the eyes.

10.verse: The fear of the Lord is pure,destined to endure forever.The ordinances of the Lord are true,and all of them are just.

11.verse: They are even more precious than gold,than an abundance of the purest gold;they are also sweeter than honeythat drips from the comb.

12.verse: By these your servant is instructed;obedience in following them will ensure a great reward.

13.verse: But who can fully recognize his shortcomings?Cleanse me of my hidden faults.

14.verse: From willful sins preserve your servant;never let them gain power over me.Then I will be blamelessand innocent of serious sin.

1.verse: Psalm 20 -Prayer in Praise of the Messiah King -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: May the Lord answer you in times of trouble;may the name of the God of Jacob protect you.

3.verse: May he send you help from the sanctuaryand grant you support from Zion.

4.verse: May he remember all your sacrificesand accept all your burnt offerings. Selah

5.verse: May he give you your heart’s desireand grant you success in all your plans.

6.verse: May we shout with joy over your victoryand lift up our banners in the name of our God.May the Lord grant your every request.

7.verse: Now I know that the Lord will grant victory to his anointed;he will answer him from his holy heaven,granting mighty victories with his right hand.

8.verse: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses,but we trust in the name of the Lord, our God.

9.verse: They will collapse and fall,but we will rise up and stand firm.

1.verse: Psalm 21 -Thanksgiving for Messianic Blessings -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: O Lord, the king rejoices in your strength;your victories fill him with great joy.

3.verse: You have granted him the desire of his heartand not withheld from him the request of his lips. Selah

4.verse: You welcomed him with choice blessingsand placed a crown of pure gold upon his head.

5.verse: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him,length of days forever and ever.

6.verse: He has achieved great glory through your victory;you have bestowed upon him splendor and majesty.

7.verse: You have conferred everlasting blessings on him;you gladdened him with the joy of your presence.

8.verse: For the king places his trust in the Lord;through the kindness of the Most High he will not fall.

9.verse: Your hand will lay hold of all your enemies;your right hand will overcome all your foes.

10.verse: On the day when you appear,you will cast them into a fiery furnace.The Lord’s anger will engulf them,and fire will consume them.

11.verse: You will blot out their descendants from the earthand rid the human race of their posterity.

12.verse: They have devised wicked schemes against you,but, plot though they may, they will not succeed.

13.verse: For you will force them to retreatwhen you aim your bows at them.

1.verse: Psalm 22 -Suffering and Triumph of the Messiah -For the director. According to “The Deer of the Dawn.” A psalm of David.

2.verse: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?Why have you paid no heed to my call for help,to my cries of anguish?

3.verse: O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer,by night, but I am afforded no relief.

4.verse: Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One;you are the praise of Israel.

5.verse: Our ancestors placed their trust in you;they trusted, and you gave them deliverance.

6.verse: They cried out to you and were saved,they trusted in you and were not put to shame.

7.verse: But I am a worm and not human,scorned by people and despised by my kinsmen.

8.verse: All who see me jeer at me;they sneer in mockery and toss their heads:

9.verse: “He relied on the Lord;let the Lord set him free.Let the Lord deliver him,if he loves him.”

10.verse: Yet you brought me out of the womband made me feel secureupon my mother’s breast.

11.verse: I was entrusted to your care at my birth;from my mother’s womb, you have been my God.

12.verse: Do not remain aloof from me,for trouble is nearand no one can help me.

13.verse: Many bulls are encircling me;fierce bulls of Bashan are closing in on me.

14.verse: They open wide their mouths against melike ravening and roaring lions.

15.verse: My strength is trickling away like water,and all my bones are dislocated.My heart has turned to waxand melts within me.

16.verse: My mouth is as dry as clayware,and my tongue sticks to my jaw;you have laid me down in the dust of death.

17.verse: A pack of dogs surrounds me;a band of evildoers is closing in on me.They have pierced my hands and my feet;

18.verse: I can count all my bones.They stare at me and gloat;

19.verse: they divide my garments among them,and for my clothing they cast lots.

20.verse: But you, O Lord, do not remain aloof from me.O my Strength, come quickly to my aid.

21.verse: Deliver my soul from the sword,my precious life from the grasp of the dogs.

22.verse: Save me from the lion’s mouthand from the horns of wild oxen.

23.verse: I will proclaim your name to my family;in the midst of the assembly I will praise you:

24.verse: “You who fear the Lord, praise him.All you descendants of Jacob, give him glory.Revere him, all you descendants of Israel.

25.verse: For he has not scorned or disregardedthe wretched man in his suffering;he has not hidden his face from himbut has heeded his call for help.”

26.verse: I will offer my praise to you in the great assembly;in the presence of those who fear him, I will fulfill my vows.

27.verse: The poor will eat and be filled;those who seek the Lord will praise him:“May your hearts live forever.”

28.verse: All the ends of the earthwill remember and turn to the Lord.All the families of the nationswill bow low before him.

29.verse: For kingly power belongs to the Lord;he is the ruler of all the nations.

30.verse: All those who prosper on the earth will bow down before him;all those who lie in the grave will kneel in homage.

31.verse: But I will live for the Lord,and my descendants will serve him.

1.verse: Psalm 23 -Prayer to the Good Shepherd -A psalm of David.The Lord is my shepherd;there is nothing I shall lack.

2.verse: He makes me lie down in green pastures;he leads me to tranquil streams.

3.verse: He restores my soul,guiding me in paths of righteousnessso that his name may be glorified.

4.verse: Even though I wanderthrough the valley of the shadow of death,I will fear no evil,for you are at my side,with your rod and your staffthat comfort me.

5.verse: You spread a table for mein the presence of my enemies.You anoint my head with oil;my cup overflows.

6.verse: Only goodness and kindness will follow meall the days of my life,and I will dwell in the house of the Lordforever and ever.

1.verse: Psalm 24 -The Lord’s Solemn Entry into Jerusalem -A psalm of David.The earth is the Lord’s and everything in it,the world and all who live in it.

2.verse: For he founded it on the seasand established it on the rivers.

3.verse: Who may ascend the mountain of the Lord?Who may stand in his holy place?

4.verse: One who has clean hands and a pure heart,who does not turn his mind to vanitiesor swear an oath in order to deceive.

5.verse: He will receive a blessing from the Lordand vindication from God, his Savior.

6.verse: This is the generation of those who seek him,who seek the face of the God of Jacob. Selah

7.verse: Lift up your arches, O gates;rise up, you ancient portals,so that the King of glory may come in.

8.verse: Who is this King of glory?The Lord, strong and mighty,the Lord, valiant in battle.

9.verse: Lift up your arches, O gates,rise up, you ancient portals,so that the King of glory may come in.

10.verse: Who is this King of glory?The Lord of hosts:he is the King of glory. Selah

1.verse: Psalm 25 -Prayer for Guidance and Help -Of David.To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul;

2.verse: in you, O my God, I trust.Do not let me be put to shame,or permit my enemies to gloat over me.

3.verse: No one who places his hope in youwill ever be put to shame,but shame will be the lot of allwho break faith without justification.

4.verse: Make your ways known to me, O Lord;teach me your paths.

5.verse: Guide me in your truth and instruct me,for you are God, my Savior,and in you I hope all the day long.

6.verse: Be mindful, O Lord, that mercy and kindnesshave been yours from of old.

7.verse: Remember not the sins of my youthor my many transgressions,but remember me in your kindness,for the sake of your goodness, O Lord.

8.verse: Good and upright is the Lord;therefore, he instructs sinners in his ways.

9.verse: He guides the humble in what is rightand teaches them the path to follow.

10.verse: The ways of the Lord are kindness and truthfor those who keep his covenant and his decrees.

11.verse: For the sake of your name, O Lord,pardon my iniquity, great though it be.

12.verse: Who, then, is the man that fears the Lord?He will be shown the path he should choose.

13.verse: He will enjoy lasting prosperity,and his descendants will inherit the land.

14.verse: The Lord manifests himself to those who fear him,and he makes his covenant known to them.

15.verse: My eyes are ever upon the Lord,for he alone can free my feet from the snare.

16.verse: Turn to me and have mercy on me,for I am alone and afflicted.

17.verse: Relieve the anguish of my heartand free me from my distress.

18.verse: Look upon my affliction and suffering,and forgive all my sins.

19.verse: Consider how numerous are my enemies,and how fierce is their hatred of me.

20.verse: Preserve my life and deliver me;do not let me be put to shame,for I seek refuge in you.

21.verse: Let integrity and virtue preserve me,for in you I place my hope.

22.verse: Redeem Israel, O God,from all its troubles.

1.verse: Psalm 26 -Prayer for the Righteous -Of David.O Lord, come to my defense,for I have lived a blameless life.I have placed my trust in the Lord,and never have I wavered in that regard.

2.verse: Test me, O Lord, and try me;probe my heart and my mind.

3.verse: For your kindness is before my eyes,and I am constantly guided by your truth.

4.verse: I do not sit in the company of deceivers,nor do I associate with hypocrites.

5.verse: I abhor the assembly of the wicked,and I refuse to associate with evildoers.

6.verse: I wash my hands in innocenceand join the procession around your altar, O Lord,

7.verse: giving voice to your praisesand proclaiming all your wondrous deeds.

8.verse: I love the house where you dwell, O Lord,the place where your glory resides.

9.verse: Do not sweep my soul away with sinners,nor my life with those who thirst for blood,

10.verse: whose hands carry out evil schemes,and whose right hands are full of bribes.

11.verse: Rather, I choose to walk in innocence;redeem me and be merciful to me.

12.verse: My feet stand on level ground;in the full assembly I will bless the Lord.

1.verse: Psalm 27 -Trust in God, Our Light and Salvation -Of David.The Lord is my light and my salvation;whom should I fear?The Lord is the stronghold of my life;of whom should I be afraid?

2.verse: When evildoers close in on meto devour my flesh,it is they, my adversaries and enemies,who stumble and fall.

3.verse: Even if an army encamps against me,my heart will not succumb to fear;even if war breaks out against me,I will not have my trust shaken.

4.verse: There is only one thing I ask of the Lord,just one thing I seek:to dwell in the house of the Lordall the days of my life,so that I may enjoy the beauty of the Lordand gaze on his temple.

5.verse: For he will hide me in his shelterin times of trouble.He will conceal me under the cover of his tentand place me high upon a rock.

6.verse: Even now my head is raised highabove my enemies who surround me.In his tent I will offer sacrifices with joyous shouts;I will sing and chant praise to the Lord.

7.verse: O Lord, hear my voice when I cry out;be merciful to me and answer me.

8.verse: My heart says of you,“Seek his face.”It is your face, O Lord, that I seek;

9.verse: do not hide your face from me.Do not turn away your servant in anger,you who have been my help.Do not reject or forsake me,O God, my Savior.

10.verse: Even if my father and mother abandon me,the Lord will gather me up.

11.verse: Teach me your way, O Lord,and lead me along a level pathbecause of my enemies.

12.verse: Do not abandon me to the will of my adversaries,for lying witnesses have risen against me,breathing forth violence in their malice.

13.verse: I am confident that I will behold the goodness of the Lordin the land of the living.

14.verse: Place your hope in the Lord:be strong and courageous in your heart,and place your hope in the Lord.

1.verse: Psalm 28 -Thanksgiving for Supplications Heard -Of David.To you I call out, O Lord, my Rock;do not turn a deaf ear to my cry.For if you remain silent,I will be like those who go down to the pit.

2.verse: Hear my voice in supplicationas I plead for your help,as I lift up my handstoward your Most Holy Place.

3.verse: Do not snatch me away with the wicked,with those whose deeds are evil,who talk of peace to their neighborswhile treachery is in their hearts.

4.verse: Repay them as their deeds deservein accordance with the evil they inflict;repay them for the works of their handsand heap upon them what they justly deserve.

5.verse: Since they have paid no heed to the deeds of the Lordor to the works of his hands,he will strike them downand refuse to restore them.

6.verse: Blessed be the Lord,for he has heard my cry of supplication.

7.verse: The Lord is my strength and my shield;my heart places its trust in him.He has helped me, and I exult;then with my song I praise him.

8.verse: The Lord is the strength of his people,the refuge where his anointed one finds salvation.

9.verse: Save your people and bless your heritage;be their shepherd and sustain them forever.

1.verse: Psalm 29 -God’s Majesty in the Storm -A psalm of David.Ascribe to the Lord, O mighty ones,ascribe to the Lord glory and might.

2.verse: Ascribe to the Lord the glory due to his name;worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness.

3.verse: The voice of the Lord echoes over the waters;the God of glory thunders,the Lord thunders over mighty waters.

4.verse: The voice of the Lord is powerful;the voice of the Lord is filled with majesty.

5.verse: The voice of the Lord shatters the cedars;the Lord shatters the cedars of Lebanon.

6.verse: He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,and Sirion like a young wild ox.

7.verse: The voice of the Lord flashes forthwith bolts of lightning.

8.verse: The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

9.verse: The voice of the Lord batters the oaksand strips the forests bare,while in his temple all cry out, “Glory!”

10.verse: The Lord sits enthroned above the flood;the Lord is enthroned as king forever.

11.verse: May the Lord grant strength to his people.May the Lord bless his people with peace.

1.verse: Psalm 30 -Thanksgiving for Deliverance from Death -A psalm. A song for the dedication of the temple. Of David.

2.verse: I will exalt you, O Lord,for you have raised me out of the depthsand have not let my enemies exult over me.

3.verse: O Lord, my God,I called to you and you healed me.

4.verse: O Lord, you lifted me up from the netherworld;you saved me from sinking into the pit.

5.verse: Sing praise to the Lord, O you his saints;give thanks to his holy name.

6.verse: For his anger lasts for only a moment,while his goodwill endures for a lifetime.Weeping may last throughout the night,but at daybreak there is rejoicing.

7.verse: In time of good fortune, I said,“Nothing can ever sway me.”

8.verse: O Lord, in your goodnessyou established me as an impregnable mountain;however, when you hid your face,I was filled with terror.

9.verse: To you, O Lord, I cried out,and I implored my God for mercy:

10.verse: “What advantage would my death provideif I descend into the pit?Can the dust praise you?Can it proclaim your faithfulness?

11.verse: Listen, O Lord, and have mercy on me;O Lord, be my helper.”

12.verse: You have turned my mourning into dancing;you have taken away my sackclothand clothed me with joy.

1.verse: Psalm 31 -Prayer of Trust and Thanksgiving -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: In you, O Lord, I have taken refuge;let me never be put to shame;in your righteousness deliver me.

3.verse: Turn your ear to me,and act quickly to save me.Be to me a rock of refuge,a strong fortress to save me.

4.verse: You are truly my rock and my fortress;for the sake of your name, lead and guide me.

5.verse: Deliver me from the snare that has been set for me,for you are my refuge.

6.verse: Into your hands I commend my spirit;you will redeem me, O Lord, God of truth.

7.verse: You hate those who cling to false idols,but I put my trust in the Lord.

8.verse: I will rejoice and exult in your kindnessbecause you have witnessed my afflictionand have taken note of my anguish.

9.verse: You have not abandoned me into the power of the enemy;rather, you have set my feet in the open.

10.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord,for I am in trouble.My weeping is laying waste to my eyesas well as my soul and my body.

11.verse: My life is consumed with sorrowand my years with sighing.My strength ebbs because of my misery,and my bones are wasting away.

12.verse: I am an object of scornto all my enemies,a loathsome sight to my neighbors,and an object of dread to my friends.When people catch sight of me outside,they quickly turn away.

13.verse: I have passed out of their mindslike someone who has died;I have become like a broken vessel.

14.verse: I have heard the hissing of many:“There is terror on every side,”as they conspire together against meand plot to end my life.

15.verse: But I place my trust in you, O Lord.I say, “You are my God.”

16.verse: My life is in your hands;deliver me from the power of my enemies,from the clutches of those who pursue me.

17.verse: Let your face shine upon your servant;save me in your kindness.

18.verse: Do not let me be put to shame, O Lord,for I have cried out to you.Let the wicked be put to shameand lie silent in the netherworld.

19.verse: Let their lying lips be struck dumb,lips that speak insolently against the righteouswith pride and contempt.

20.verse: How great is your goodness, O Lord,which you have stored up for those who fear youand which you bestow on those who take refuge in you,in the presence of all the people.

21.verse: You hide them in the safety of your presencefrom those who conspire against them;you keep them safe in your shelter,far away from contentious tongues.

22.verse: Blessed be the Lord,for he has manifested his wondrous kindness to mewhen I was under siege.

23.verse: I had cried out in terror,“I have been cut off from your sight.”But you heard my pleawhen I cried out to you for assistance.

24.verse: Love the Lord, all his saints.The Lord protects his loyal servants,but the arrogant he repays beyond measure.

1.verse: Psalm 32 -The Joy of Being Forgiven -Of David. A maskil.Blessed is the one whose offense is forgiven,whose sin is erased.

2.verse: Blessed is the one to whom the Lord charges no guiltand in whose spirit there is no guile.

3.verse: As long as I remained silent,my body wasted awayas the result of my groaning throughout the day.

4.verse: For day and nightyour hand was heavy upon me;my strength withered steadilyas though consumed by the summer heat. Selah

5.verse: Then I acknowledged my sin to you,and I made no attempt to conceal my guilt.I said, “I will confess my offenses to the Lord,”and you removed the guilt of my sin. Selah

6.verse: Therefore, let everyone who is faithful pray to youwhere you may be found.Even if great floods threaten,they will never reach him.

7.verse: You are a place of refuge for me;you preserve me from troubleand surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah

8.verse: I will instruct youand guide you in the way you should go;I will counsel youand keep my eyes upon you.

9.verse: Do not behave without understandinglike a horse or a mule;if its temper is not curbed with bit and bridle,it will not come near you.

10.verse: The wicked has a multitude of troubles,but the man who trusts in the Lordis surrounded by kindness.

11.verse: Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, you righteous;shout for joy, all you upright of heart.

1.verse: Psalm 33 -Praise of God’s Providence -Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous;it is fitting for the upright to praise him.

2.verse: Give thanks to the Lord on the harp;offer praise to him on the ten-stringed lyre.

3.verse: Sing to him a new song;play skillfully on the strings with joyful shouts.

4.verse: For the word of the Lord is true,and he is faithful in everything he does.

5.verse: The Lord loves righteousness and justice;the earth is filled with his kindness.

6.verse: The heavens were made by the word of the Lord,and all their host by the breath of his mouth.

7.verse: He gathers the waters of the sea as in a bowl;he places the deep in storehouses.

8.verse: Let all the earth fear the Lord;let all the inhabitants of the world revere him.

9.verse: For he spoke, and it came to be;he commanded, and it stood firm.

10.verse: The Lord thwarts the plans of nationsand frustrates the designs of peoples.

11.verse: But the plan of the Lord remains forever,the designs of his heart for all generations.

12.verse: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,the people whom he has chosen as his heritage.

13.verse: The Lord gazes down from heavenand beholds the entire human race.

14.verse: From his royal thronehe watches all who dwell on the earth.

15.verse: He who has fashioned the hearts of them allobserves everything they do.

16.verse: A king is not saved by a large army,nor is a warrior delivered by great strength.

17.verse: A horse offers false hope for victory;despite its power it cannot save.

18.verse: But the eyes of the Lord are on those who fear him,on those who trust in his kindness,

19.verse: to deliver them from deathand to preserve their lives in time of famine.

20.verse: Our soul waits in hope for the Lord;he is our help and our shield.

21.verse: Our hearts rejoice in himbecause we trust in his holy name.

22.verse: O Lord, let your kindness rest upon us,for we have placed our hope in you.

1.verse: Psalm 34 -Presence of God, Protector of the Righteous -Of David. When he pretended to be mad before Abimelech, who forced him to depart.

2.verse: I will bless the Lord at all times;his praise will be continually on my lips.

3.verse: My soul will glory in the Lord;let the lowly hear and be glad.

4.verse: Magnify the Lord with me;let us exalt his name together.

5.verse: I sought the Lord, and he answered me;he set me free from all my fears.

6.verse: Look to him and you will be radiant;your faces will never be covered with shame.

7.verse: In my anguish I cried out;the Lord heard my plea,and I was saved from all my troubles.

8.verse: The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear God,and he delivers them.

9.verse: Taste and see that the Lord is good;blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.

10.verse: Fear the Lord, you his saints;nothing is lacking for those who fear him.

11.verse: The powerful suffer want and go hungry,but those who seek the Lord want for no good thing.

12.verse: Come, my children, and listen to me;I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

13.verse: Who among you delights in lifeand desires many years to enjoy prosperity?

14.verse: Then keep your tongue from eviland your lips from telling lies.

15.verse: Shun evil and do good;seek peace and pursue it.

16.verse: The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,and his ears are open to their cry.

17.verse: The face of the Lord is turned against those who do evil,to erase all memory of them from the earth.

18.verse: The righteous call out, and the Lord hears them;he rescues them from all their troubles.

19.verse: The Lord remains close to the brokenhearted,and he saves those whose spirit is crushed.

20.verse: The misfortunes of the righteous man are many,but the Lord delivers him, from all of them.

21.verse: He watches with care over all his bones;not a single one will be broken.

22.verse: Evil will bring death to the wicked,and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.

1.verse: Psalm 35 -Appeal for Help against Injustice -Of David.Plead my cause, O Lord, with those who strive against me;fight against those who fight against me.

2.verse: Grasp your shield and bucklerand spring to my aid.

3.verse: Brandish your spear and battle-axagainst those who pursue me.Say to my soul,“I am your salvation.”

4.verse: May those who seek my lifesuffer shame and disgrace.May those who plan my downfallbe forced to retreat in disgrace.

5.verse: May they be like chaff flying in the wind,with the angel of the Lord scattering them.

6.verse: May their way be shadowy and slippery,with the angel of the Lord in pursuit.

7.verse: Without cause they laid a net to trap me;without cause they dug a pit to ensnare me.

8.verse: May ruin come upon them unawares;may the net they laid entrap them;may they topple into the pit they dug.

9.verse: Then my soul will rejoice in the Lordand exult in his salvation.

10.verse: My whole being will say,“O Lord, who is there like you?You deliver those who are weakfrom those who are too strong for them,and you protect the poor and needyfrom those who seek to exploit them.”

11.verse: False witnesses step forwardand question me about things I do not know.

12.verse: They give me back evil in place of goodand leave my soul in sorrow.

13.verse: Yet, when they were ill, I put on sackclothand afflicted myself with fasting,while I poured forth prayers from my heart.

14.verse: I went about as though in grief,as though for a friend or brother.I bowed down in sorrowas though lamenting for a mother.

15.verse: But when I stumbled, they rejoiced and came together;they came together and struck me unawares.They slandered me without letup.

16.verse: They mocked me with ever increasing furyas they gnashed their teeth at me.

17.verse: How long, O Lord, will you look on?Rescue me from these ravening beasts;preserve my precious life from these lions.

18.verse: I will offer you thanks in the great assembly;I will praise you amid the vast throng.

19.verse: Do not allow my treacherous enemiesto gloat over me;do not permit those who hate me without reasonto wink their eyes at me.

20.verse: For they do not speak words of peace,but they contrive deceitful wordsto lead astray the peaceful in the land.

21.verse: They open wide their mouths shouting, “Aha! Aha!We have seen it with our own eyes.”

22.verse: You have seen, O Lord; do not be silent.O Lord, do not be far from me.

23.verse: Awaken and be diligent in my defense;come to my aid, my God and my Lord.

24.verse: Defend me, O Lord, my God,according to your righteousness,and do not let them gloat over me.

25.verse: Do not let them think,“Aha! This is just what we wanted.”Do not let them say,“We have swallowed him up.”

26.verse: Let all those who rejoice at my downfallbe put to shame and dismayed.Let those who rise up arrogantly against mebe covered with shame and dishonor.

27.verse: But let those who desire my vindicationshout for joy and be glad.Let them cry out continually,“Exalted be the Lordwho delights to see his servant in peace.”

28.verse: Then my tongue shall proclaim your righteousnessand sing your praise all the day long.

1.verse: Psalm 36 -Human Weakness and Divine Goodness -For the director. Of David the servant of the Lord.

2.verse: Sin speaks to the wicked man in his heart;in his eyes there is no fear of God.

3.verse: He deludes himself with the ideathat his guilt will not be discovered and hated.

4.verse: The words his mouth utters are malicious and deceitful;he has ceased to be wise and act uprightly.

5.verse: Even when he lies on his bed,he is hatching evil plots.He commits himself to a wicked courseand refuses to reject evil.

6.verse: O Lord, your kindness extends to the heavens;your faithfulness, to the skies.

7.verse: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God;your judgments, like the mighty deep;you sustain both humans and beasts, O Lord.

8.verse: How precious, O God, is your kindness!People seek refuge in the shadow of your wings.

9.verse: They feast on the abundance of your house,and you give them to drink from your delightful streams.

10.verse: For with you is the fountain of life,and by your light we see light.

11.verse: Continue to bestow your kindness on those who know you,and your saving justice on the upright of heart.

12.verse: Let not the foot of the arrogant tread upon me,nor the hand of the wicked drive me out.

1.verse: Psalm 37 -Fate of the Wicked and Reward of the Righteous -Of David.Do not fume because of evildoersor envy those who do wrong.

2.verse: They will wither quickly like the grassand fade away like the green herb.

3.verse: Put your trust in the Lord and do good,that you may dwell in the land and be secure.

4.verse: Take delight in the Lord,and he will grant you what your heart desires.

5.verse: Commit your way to the Lord;place your trust in him, and he will act.

6.verse: He will make your righteousness shine like the dawn,and the justice of your cause, like the noonday.

7.verse: Wait quietly for the Lordand be patient until he comes.Do not fret over the man who prospersbecause of his evil schemes.

8.verse: Refrain from anger and turn away from wrath;do not fret—it does nothing but harm.

9.verse: For evildoers will be destroyed,but those who wait for the Lord will inherit the land.

10.verse: In a short while, the wicked will be no more;no matter how diligently you search, you will not be able to find him.

11.verse: But the meek will possess the landand enjoy an abundance of peace.

12.verse: The wicked man plots against the righteousand grinds his teeth at the sight of them.

13.verse: But the Lord laughs at them,knowing that their day is approaching.

14.verse: The wicked draw their swordsand string their bowsto bring down the poor and the needyand to slaughter those who are upright.

15.verse: Their swords will enter their own hearts,and their bows will be shattered.

16.verse: Preferable is the little that the righteous possessthan the great wealth of the wicked.

17.verse: For the power of the wicked will be overcome,but the Lord protects the righteous.

18.verse: The Lord looks after the lives of the upright,and their heritage will last forever.

19.verse: They will not be confounded in times of evil,and in days of famine they eat their fill.

20.verse: But the wicked will perish,all those who are enemies of the Lord.Like the beauty of the meadows they will wither away;like smoke they will disappear.

21.verse: The wicked man borrows but neglects to repay,whereas the righteous man is generous in giving.

22.verse: For those blessed by the Lord will possess the land,but those who are cursed will perish.

23.verse: The Lord makes a man’s steps securewhen he approves of his conduct.

24.verse: Even if he stumbles, he will never fall headlong,for the Lord holds him by the hand.

25.verse: From my youth until my present old age,I have never seen the righteous man abandonedor his children reduced to begging for bread.

26.verse: He is always compassionate and generous in lending,and his children will be blessed.

27.verse: If you shun evil and do good,you will dwell in the land forever.

28.verse: For the Lord loves the just,and he will not forsake his faithful ones.Those who follow evil paths will be destroyed,and the children of the wicked will be cut off,

29.verse: whereas the righteous will inherit the landand dwell in it forever.

30.verse: The mouth of the righteous man utters wisdom,and his tongue speaks what is right.

31.verse: The law of his God is in his heart,and his steps do not waver.

32.verse: The wicked man keeps close watch on the righteousand seeks an opportunity to kill him.

33.verse: But the Lord will not abandon the righteousto the power of the wicked,nor will he allow him to be condemnedwhen he is brought to trial.

34.verse: Wait for the Lordand follow the path he has laid out;then he will exalt you to inherit the land,and you will see the destruction of the wicked.

35.verse: I have seen a wicked man inflicting terrorand towering like a verdant tree.

36.verse: I passed by again, and he was gone;I searched for him, but he was not to be found.

37.verse: Pay attention to the innocent and behold the upright,for the man of peace will have a future.

38.verse: But the wicked will be completely destroyed,and their children will be cut off.

39.verse: The salvation of the righteous is from the Lord;he is their refuge in times of trouble.

40.verse: The Lord will help them and deliver them;he will rescue them from the wicked and save thembecause they flee to him for refuge.

1.verse: Psalm 38 -Prayer of a Sinner in Great Peril -A psalm of David. For remembrance.

2.verse: O Lord, do not punish me in your angeror chastise me in your wrath.

3.verse: For your arrows have pierced me deeply,and your hand has come down upon me.

4.verse: No portion of my body has been unscathedas a result of your anger;my bones have become weakas a result of my sins.

5.verse: My iniquities tower far above my head;they are a burden too heavy to bear.

6.verse: My wounds are fetid and festerbecause of my folly.

7.verse: I am bowed down and bent over,as I spend each day in sorrow.

8.verse: My loins are filled with searing pain;no part of my body is unafflicted.

9.verse: I am numb and completely crushed,and I groan in anguish of heart.

10.verse: O Lord, all my longing is known to you,and my sighs are not hidden from you.

11.verse: My heart throbs, and my strength is spent;even the light has faded from my eyes.

12.verse: My friends and companions stay away from my affliction,and my neighbors keep their distance.

13.verse: Those who seek my life set traps;those who wish me harm threaten violenceand plot treachery all day long.

14.verse: But I am like a man who cannot hear,like one who cannot open his mouth.

15.verse: I am like one who hears nothingand has no answer to offer.

16.verse: I place my hope in you, O Lord;you, O Lord, my God, will answer for me.

17.verse: For I prayed, “Never let them gloat over meor exult should my foot slip.”

18.verse: I am at the point of exhaustion,and my grief is with me constantly.

19.verse: I acknowledge my iniquity,and I sincerely grieve for my sin.

20.verse: Numerous and strong are my enemies without cause;many are those who hate me without good reason.

21.verse: Those who repay my good deeds with eviloppose me because I follow a path of righteousness.

22.verse: Do not abandon me, O Lord;my God, do not remain far from me.

1.verse: Psalm 39 -The Brevity and Vanity of Life -For the director. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

2.verse: I said, “I will be careful of my behaviorso as not to sin with my tongue.I will keep a muzzle on my mouthwhenever the wicked are in my presence.”

3.verse: I kept completely silentand refrained from speech,but my distress only increased.

4.verse: My heart smoldered within me,and, as I pondered, my mind was inflamed,and my tongue began to speak:

5.verse: “O Lord, let me know my endand the number of days left to me;show me how fleeting my life is.

6.verse: You have allotted me a short span of days;my life is as nothing in your sight;human existence is a mere breath. Selah

7.verse: Humans are nothing but a passing shadow;the riches they amass are a mere breath,and they do not know who will enjoy them.

8.verse: “So now, O Lord, what do I wait for?My hope is in you.

9.verse: Deliver me from all my sins;do not subject me to the taunts of fools.

10.verse: “I was silent and did not open my mouth,for it is you who have done it.

11.verse: Remove your scourge from me;I am crushed by the blows of your hand.

12.verse: You rebuke and punish people for their sins;like a moth you consume all their desires;human existence is a mere puff of wind. Selah

13.verse: “Hear my prayer, O Lord;do not be deaf to my cryor ignore my weeping.For I am a wayfarer before you,a nomad like all my ancestors.

1.verse: Psalm 40 -Thanksgiving and Prayer for Help -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: I waited patiently for the Lord;then he stooped down and heard my cry.

3.verse: He raised me up from the desolate pit,out of the mire of the swamp;he set my feet upon a rock,giving me a firm footing.

4.verse: He put a new song in my mouth,a hymn of praise to our God.Many will look on and be awestruck,and they will place their trust in the Lord.

5.verse: Blessed is the manwho places his trust in the Lord,who does not follow the arrogantor those who go astray after falsehoods.

6.verse: How innumerable, O Lord, my God,are the wonders you have worked;no one can compare with youin the plans you have made for us.I would proclaim them and recount them,but there are far too many to enumerate.

7.verse: Sacrifice and offering you did not desire,but you have made my ears receptive.Burnt offerings and sin offeringsyou did not demand.

8.verse: Then I said, “Behold I come;it is written of me in the scroll of the book.

9.verse: To do your will, O God, is my delight;your law is in my heart.”

10.verse: I have proclaimed your righteousness in the great assembly;I did not seal my lips,as you well know, O Lord.

11.verse: I have not concealed your righteousness within the depths of my heart;I have spoken of your faithfulness and salvation.I have not concealed your kindness and your truthin the great assembly.

12.verse: O Lord, do not withhold your mercy from me;may your kindness and your truth keep me safe forever.

13.verse: I am surrounded by evils without number;my sins have so engulfed me that I cannot see.They outnumber the hairs on my head,and my heart sinks within me.

14.verse: Be pleased, O Lord, to rescue meO Lord, come quickly to my aid.

15.verse: May all those who seek to take my lifeendure shame and confusion.May all those who desire my ruinbe turned back and humiliated.

16.verse: May those who cry out to me, “Aha, aha!”be overcome with shame and dismay.

17.verse: But may all who seek yourejoice in you and be jubilant.May those who love your salvationcry out forever, “The Lord be magnified.”

1.verse: Psalm 41 -Trust in God in Sickness and Misfortune -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: Blessed is he who has concern for the weak;in time of trouble the Lord will deliver him.

3.verse: The Lord will protect him and keep him alive;he will make him happy on earthand not abandon him to the will of his enemies.

4.verse: The Lord will sustain him on his sickbedand bring him back to health.

5.verse: Once I prayed, “O Lord, have mercy on me;heal me, for I have sinned against you.

6.verse: In their malice my enemies say of me,‘When will he die and his name be forgotten?’

7.verse: When someone comes to visit me,he utters words without sincerity;his heart harbors slander,and on departing he gives voice to it.

8.verse: “All my enemies whisper against meand conjure up the worst in my regard.

9.verse: ‘He has a fatal disease,’ they say;‘he will never rise up from his sickbed.’

10.verse: “Even my friend whom I trusted,the one who dined at my table,has risen up against me.

11.verse: But you, O Lord, be merciful to me;make me well so that I may pay them back.”

12.verse: By this I know that you are pleased with me—that my enemy fails to triumph over me.

13.verse: Because of my innocence you uphold meand let me stand in your presence forever.

1.verse: Book II—Psalms 42–72 -Psalm 42 -Prayer of Longing for God -For the director. A maskil of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: As a deer longs for running streams,so my soul longs for you, O God.

3.verse: My soul thirsts for God, the living God.When shall I come to behold the face of God?

4.verse: My tears have become my foodday and night,while people taunt me all day long, saying,“Where is your God?”

5.verse: As I pour out my soul,I recall those timeswhen I journeyed with the multitudeand led them in procession to the house of God,amid loud cries of joy and thanksgivingon the part of the crowd keeping festival.

6.verse: Why are you so disheartened, O my soul?Why do you sigh within me?Place your hope in God,for I will once again praise him,my Savior and my God.

7.verse: My soul is disheartened within me;therefore, I remember youfrom the land of Jordan and Hermon,from Mount Mizar.

8.verse: The depths of the sea resoundin the roar of your waterfalls;all your waves and your breakerssweep over me.

9.verse: During the day the Lord grants his kindness,and at night his praise is with me,a prayer to the living God.

10.verse: I say to God, my Rock,“Why have you forgotten me?Why must I go about in mourningwhile my enemy oppresses me?”

11.verse: It crushes my boneswhen my foes taunt me,jeering at me all day long,“Where is your God?”

1.verse: Psalm 43 -Prayer To Worship God Anew -Grant me your justice, O God,and plead my cause against a godless nation;rescue me from those who are deceitful and unjust.

2.verse: You, O God, are my refuge;why have you rejected me?Why must I go about in mourning,while my enemy oppresses me?

3.verse: Send forth your light and your truth;they will serve as my guide.Let them bring me to your holy mountain,to the place of your dwelling.

4.verse: Then I will go to the altar of God,to the God of my joy and delight,and I will praise you with the harp,O God, my God.

5.verse: Why are you so disheartened, O my soul?Why do you sigh within me?Place your hope in God;for I will once again praise him,my Savior and my God.

1.verse: Psalm 44 -Past Glory and Present Need of God’s People -For the director. A maskil of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: O God, we have heard with our ears,our ancestors have told us,of the deeds you performed in their days,in the days of old.

3.verse: To establish them in the land,you drove out the nations with your own hand;you crushed the peoplesso that our ancestors could flourish.

4.verse: It was not their own swords that won them the land,nor did their own arms make them victorious;rather, it was your right hand and your armand the light of your face,because you loved them.

5.verse: You are my King and my God,who bestowed victories upon Jacob.

6.verse: Through you we throw back our enemies;through your name we crush our assailants.

7.verse: It is not in my bow that I trust,nor can my sword ensure my victory.

8.verse: It is you who saved us from our enemies;you scattered in confusion those who hate us.

9.verse: In God we boast the whole day long,and we will praise your name forever. Selah

10.verse: But now you have rejected and humiliated us,and you no longer accompany our armies.

11.verse: You have forced us to retreat before the enemy;those who hate us plunder us unceasingly.

12.verse: You have handed us over like sheep to be slaughteredand scattered us among the nations.

13.verse: You have sold your people for nothing,receiving no gain from their sale.

14.verse: You have subjected us to the contempt of our neighbors,to the mockery and scorn of all who are near.

15.verse: You have made us a byword to the nations;the peoples shake their heads at us.

16.verse: All day long I am confronted by my disgrace,and my face is covered with shame

17.verse: as I hear the shouts of taunting and abuseand see the hateful enemy seeking revenge.

18.verse: All this has happened to useven though we have not forgotten youor been false to your covenant.

19.verse: Our hearts have not turned back,nor have our feet wandered from your path.

20.verse: Yet you have crushed us,forced us to live among the jackals,and covered us with darkness.

21.verse: If we had forgotten the name of our Godor lifted up our hands to a foreign god,

22.verse: would not God have discovered it,he who knows the secrets of the heart?

23.verse: For your sake we are put to death all day long;we are treated like sheep destined to be slaughtered.

24.verse: Awake, O Lord. Why do you sleep?Rise up, and do not abandon us forever.

25.verse: Why do you hide your faceand continue to ignore our misery and our sufferings?

26.verse: We have been brought down to the dust;our bodies cling to the ground.

1.verse: Psalm 45 -Nuptial Ode for the Messianic King -For the director. According to “Lilies.” A maskil of the sons of Korah. A love song.

2.verse: My heart is moved by a noble themeas I sing my poem to the king;my tongue is like the pen of a skillful scribe.

3.verse: You are the most handsome of men;grace has anointed your lips,for God has blessed you forever.

4.verse: Gird your sword upon your thigh, O warrior,and advance in splendor and majesty.

5.verse: Ride on triumphantly in truth, humility, and justice;may your right hand perform wondrous deeds.

6.verse: Your arrows are sharp;nations will lie beneath your feet;the enemies of the king will lose heart.

7.verse: Your throne, O God, will last forever and ever;the scepter of your kingdom will be a scepter of justice.

8.verse: You love righteousness and hate wickedness;therefore God, your God, has established you above your fellow kingsby anointing you with the oil of gladness.

9.verse: All your robes are fragrantwith myrrh and aloes and cassia;from palaces of ivorystringed instruments bring joy to your heart.

10.verse: Daughters of kings are among your women in waiting;at your right hand is your queenadorned in gold of Ophir.

11.verse: My daughter, listen carefully to my wordsand follow them diligently.Forget your people and your father’s house;

12.verse: then the king will desire your beauty.Since he is your lord,

13.verse: bow down before him.The Daughter of Tyre will bring you gifts,people of wealth will seek your favor.

14.verse: Within the palace the king’s daughter is adornedin robes threaded with gold.

15.verse: In embroidered garments she is led to the king,followed by her virgin companions,who are also led to you.,

16.verse: They are brought in with joy and gladnessas they enter the palace of the king.

17.verse: Your sons will take the place of your ancestors;you will make them princes in all the earth.

1.verse: Psalm 46 -God, Refuge of His People -For the director. A song of the sons of Korah. According to alamoth.

2.verse: God is our refuge and our strength,a well-proved help in times of trouble.

3.verse: Therefore, we will not be afraid, though the earth be shakenand the mountains tumble into the depths of the sea,

4.verse: though its waters rage and seetheand the mountains tremble at the upheaval.The Lord of hosts is with us;the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah

5.verse: There is a river whose streams bring joy to the city of God,the holy place where the Most High dwells.

6.verse: God is in her midst; she will not be overcome;God will help her at break of dawn.

7.verse: The nations are in tumult and kingdoms fall;when he raises his voice, the earth melts away.

8.verse: The Lord of hosts is with us;the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah

9.verse: Come and behold the works of the Lord,the astonishing deeds he has wrought on the earth.

10.verse: He puts an end to wars all over the earth;he breaks the bow and snaps the spear,and he burns the shields with flames.

11.verse: “Be still and acknowledge that I am God,exalted among the nations,exalted on the earth.”

1.verse: Psalm 47 -The Lord, King of All Nations -For the director. A psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: All you peoples, clap your hands,shout to God with cries of gladness.

3.verse: For the Lord, the Most High, is awesome;he is the great King over all the earth.

4.verse: He subdued nations under usand brought peoples under our feet.

5.verse: He chose our inheritance for us,the pride of Jacob, whom he loved. Selah

6.verse: God has ascended amid shouts of joy;the Lord, amid the sound of trumpets.

7.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises;sing praises to our King, sing praises.

8.verse: For God is the King of the entire earth;sing hymns of praise to him.

9.verse: God reigns over all the nations;God is seated on his holy throne.

1.verse: Psalm 48 -Thanksgiving for the Deliverance of God’s People -A psalm of the sons of Korah. A song.

2.verse: Great is the Lord and worthy of high praisein the city of our God.His holy mountain,

3.verse: towering in its beauty,is the joy of the entire earth.Mount Zion, the true heights of the north,is the city of the great King.

4.verse: God is in her citadelsand has revealed himself as her fortress.

5.verse: For the kings conspired togetherand came onward in unison.

6.verse: As soon as they beheld her, they were astounded;filled with panic, they fled.

7.verse: They were seized with trembling,with pains like those of a woman in labor,

8.verse: as though a wind from the eastwere breaking up the ships of Tarshish.

9.verse: What we had heard,we have now beheld for ourselvesin the city of the Lord of hosts,in the city of our Godthat he established to endure forever. Selah

10.verse: O God, as we stand in the midst of your temple,we will meditate on your kindness.

11.verse: Like your name, O God,your praise extends to the ends of the earth.Your right hand is filled with righteousness;

12.verse: let Mount Zion rejoice.Let the towns of Judah exultin your saving judgments.

13.verse: Walk around Zion; pass throughout her;count the number of her towers.

14.verse: Take careful note of her ramparts,walk through her citadels,so that you may recount for future generations

1.verse: Psalm 49 -Deceptive Riches -For the director. A psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: Hear this, all you peoples;listen carefully, all you inhabitants of the world,

3.verse: whether lowborn or highborn,rich and poor alike.

4.verse: My mouth will speak words of wisdom,and the utterance of my heart will give understanding.

5.verse: I will listen carefully to a proverb,and with the harp I will interpret my riddle.

6.verse: Why should I be afraid in evil timeswhen I am beset by the wickedness of my foes,

7.verse: those who place their trust in their wealthand boast of the abundance of their riches?

8.verse: For no one can ever redeem himselfor pay a ransom to God for his release.

9.verse: The price to ransom a life would be too costly;no one would ever have enough

10.verse: to enable him to live on foreverand avoid being consigned to the pit.

11.verse: For all can see that the wise die,just as the foolish and the stupid also pass away,and all leave their wealth to others.

12.verse: Their graves are their eternal homes,their dwelling places for all generations,even though they had named lands after themselves.

13.verse: Despite his riches,a man cannot escape death;he is like the beasts that perish.

14.verse: Such is the destiny of those who trust in themselves alone,the fate of those who are pleased with their lot. Selah

15.verse: Like sheep they are destined for the netherworld,with death as their shepherd.They descend straight to the gravewhere their bodies will waste away;the netherworld will be their home.

16.verse: But God will ransom me from the netherworld;he will take me to himself. Selah

17.verse: Do not be afraid when someone becomes richand the splendor of his house increases.

18.verse: When he dies, he will take nothing with him;his wealth will not accompany him below.

19.verse: Although during his lifetime he considered himself blessed:“They will praise me because I have done well,”

20.verse: he will end up joining the company of his ancestorswho will never again see the light.

1.verse: Psalm 50 -The Worship Acceptable to God -A psalm of Asaph.The Lord, the God of gods,has spoken and summoned the earthfrom the rising of the sun to its setting.

2.verse: From Zion, perfect in beauty,God shines forth.

3.verse: Our God is coming, and he will not be silent;he is preceded by a devouring fire,and a raging tempest surrounds him.

4.verse: He summons the heavens aboveand the earth to judge his people:

5.verse: “Gather before me my faithful servantswho made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”

6.verse: The heavens proclaim his saving justice,for God himself is the judge. Selah

7.verse: “Listen, my people, and I will speak.O Israel, I will testify against you.I am God, your God.

8.verse: I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices,for your burnt offerings are constantly before me.

9.verse: “I will not accept a young bull from your homesor goats from your folds.

10.verse: For all the living creatures of the forest are mine,animals by the thousands on my hills.

11.verse: I know every bird of the air,and whatever moves in the fields belongs to me.

12.verse: “If I were hungry, I would not tell you,for the world is mine, and all that it holds.

13.verse: Do I eat the flesh of bullsor drink the blood of goats?

14.verse: “Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgivingand fulfill your vows to the Most High.

15.verse: Then if you cry out to me in time of trouble,I will rescue you, and you will honor me.”

16.verse: But to the wicked God says:“How can you recite my statutesor profess my covenant on your lips?

17.verse: For you loathe my instructionand cast my words behind you.

18.verse: “When you meet a thief, you join him;you revel in the company of adulterers.

19.verse: You employ your mouth for evil,and your tongue frames deceit.

20.verse: “You willingly speak against your brotherand slander the child of your own mother.

21.verse: When you do such things, can I remain silent?Do you think that I am like you?I will correct youand set the charge before your face.

22.verse: “Remember this, you who forget God,lest I tear you to piecesand there be no one to rescue you.

23.verse: He who offers a sacrifice of thanksgiving honors me;to him who follows my wayI will show the salvation of God.”

1.verse: Psalm 51 -The “Miserere”: Repentance for Sin -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: When Nathan the prophet came to him after he had sinned with Bathsheba.

3.verse: Have mercy on me, O God,in accord with your kindness;in your abundant compassionwipe away my offenses.

4.verse: Wash me completely from my guilt,and cleanse me from my sin.

5.verse: For I am fully aware of my offense,and my sin is ever before me.

6.verse: Against you, you alone, have I sinned;I have done what is evil in your sight.Therefore, you are right in accusing meand just in passing judgment.
