7.verse: Indeed, I was born in iniquity,and in sin did my mother conceive me.

8.verse: But you desire sincerity of heart;and you endow my innermost being with wisdom.

9.verse: Sprinkle me with hyssop so that I may be cleansed;wash me until I am whiter than snow.

10.verse: Let me experience joy and gladness;let the bones you have crushed exult.

11.verse: Hide your face from my sins,and wipe out all my offenses.

12.verse: Create in me a clean heart, O God,and renew a resolute spirit within me.

13.verse: Do not cast me out from your presenceor take away from me your Holy Spirit.

14.verse: Restore to me the joy of being saved,and grant me the strength of a generous spirit.

15.verse: I will teach your ways to the wicked,and sinners will return to you.

16.verse: Deliver me from bloodguilt, O God,the God of my salvation,and I will proclaim your righteousness.

17.verse: O Lord, open my lips,and my mouth will proclaim your praise.

18.verse: For you take no delight in sacrifice;if I were to make a burnt offering,you would refuse to accept it.

19.verse: My sacrifice, O God, is a broken spirit;a contrite and humble heart, O God,you will not spurn.

1.verse: Psalm 52 -Prayer for Help against Calumniators -For the director. A maskil of David.

2.verse: When Doeg the Edomite went and told Saul, “David has gone to the house of Ahimelech.”

3.verse: Why do you boast of your evil deeds,you champion of malice?All day long

4.verse: you plot harm;your tongue is like a sharpened razor,you master of deceit.

5.verse: You love evil rather than good,and lies rather than truthful speech. Selah

6.verse: You wallow in destructive talk,you tongue of deceit.

7.verse: This is the reason why God will crush youand destroy you once and for all.He will snatch you from your tentand uproot you from the land of the living. Selah

8.verse: The righteous will see and be afraid;they will mock him:

9.verse: “This is the manwho refused to accept God as his refuge.Rather, he placed his trust in his abundant richesand gathered strength by his crimes.”

1.verse: Psalm 53 -Foolishness of the Wicked -For the director. According to Mahalath. A maskil of David.

2.verse: The fool says in his heart,“There is no God.”Such are depraved and their deeds are vile;there is no one who does what is right.

3.verse: God looks down from heavenupon the entire human race,to see if there are any who act with wisdom,if even a single one seeks God.

4.verse: But they have all turned aside;all alike are corrupt.There is no one who does what is right,not even one.

5.verse: Have all these evildoers no understanding?They devour my people as they eat bread,and they never call out to God.

6.verse: Later, they will be filled with terror,and with good reason,although now they do not fear.For God will scatter the bonesof those who attack you;they will be put to shame,for God has rejected them.

1.verse: Psalm 54 -Prayer in Time of Danger -For the director. On stringed instruments. A maskil of David.

2.verse: When the Ziphites came to Saul and said, “David is hiding among us.”

3.verse: O God, save me by your name;vindicate me by your power.

4.verse: Hear my prayer, O God;give ear to the words of my mouth.

5.verse: Strangers have risen against me;those who are ruthless seek my life,and they have no thought of God. Selah

6.verse: Surely God is my helper;the Lord is the one who sustains me.

7.verse: May their own evil recoil on my foes:you who are faithful, destroy them.

1.verse: Psalm 55 -Prayer in Time of Betrayal by a Friend -For the director. On stringed instruments. A maskil of David.

2.verse: Give ear to my prayer, O God,do not ignore my supplication.

3.verse: Listen to my cry and answer me,for my troubles afford me no peace.

4.verse: I am terrified by the shouts of the enemyand the uproar of the wicked.For they inflict troubles upon me,and in their anger they revile me.

5.verse: My heart is filled with anguish,and I am beset by the terrors of death.

6.verse: Fear and trembling overpower me;horror overwhelms me.

7.verse: I say, “If only I had wings like a doveso that I could fly away and be at rest!

8.verse: I would flee awayand seek shelter in the wilderness. Selah

9.verse: I would hurry to a place of refuge,far from the savage wind and tempest.”

10.verse: Restrain the wicked, O Lord, and confound their speech,for I see violence and strife in the city.

11.verse: Day and night they make their rounds on its walls,and within it are iniquity and malice.

12.verse: Destruction is also in its midst;oppression and treachery pervade its streets.

13.verse: If it was an enemy who reviled me,I could endure that.If a foe had treated me with contempt,I could manage to avoid him.

14.verse: But it was you, one like myself,a companion and a dear friend,

15.verse: with whom I engaged in pleasant conversationas we walked with the festive throngin the house of God.

16.verse: Let death strike my enemies by surprise;let them descend alive to the netherworld,for evil dwells in their homesand in the depths of their hearts.

17.verse: But I make my appeal to God,and the Lord will save me.

18.verse: Evening, morning, and noonI will cry out in my distress,and he will hear my voice.

19.verse: He will deliver me in peace and safetyfrom those who are arrayed against me,even though there are many of them.

20.verse: God will hear me and humiliate them,he who has been enthroned forever. SelahFor they neither change their waysnor have any fear of God.

21.verse: My companion treats his friends harshlyand breaks his covenant.

22.verse: His speech is smoother than butter,but war is in his heart.His words are more soothing than oil,yet in reality they are drawn swords.

23.verse: Entrust your cares to the Lord,and he will uphold you;he will never allow the righteous to waver.

1.verse: Psalm 56 -Boundless Trust in God -For the director. According to Yonath elem rehoqim. A miktam of David. When the Philistines seized him at Gath.

2.verse: Be merciful to me, O God,for people are trampling upon me;all day long they keep up their attack.

3.verse: My foes pursue me all day long,with their forces too many to number.

4.verse: When I am terrified,I place my trust in you.

5.verse: In God, whose word I praise,in God I place my trust and know no fear;what can people do to me?

6.verse: All day long they slander me;their one thought is to bring evil upon me.

7.verse: In groups they hide in ambushand spy on my every step,determined to take my life.

8.verse: Shall they escape in their iniquity?Strike down the nations, O God, in your anger.

9.verse: You have kept count of my wanderingsand stored my tears in your flask,recording all these in your book.

10.verse: My foes will turn backwhen I call out to you.Of this I am confident:that God is on my side.

11.verse: In God, whose word I praise—in the Lord, whose word I praise—

12.verse: in God I place my trust and know no fear;what can people do to me?

13.verse: I am bound, O God, by vows to you,and I will pay you my debt of gratitude.

1.verse: Psalm 57 -Trust in God amid Suffering -For the director. According to “Do not destroy.” A miktam of David. When he fled from Saul into the cave.

2.verse: Have mercy on me, O God,have mercy on me,for in you my soul takes refuge.I will seek shelter in the shadow of your wingsuntil the time of danger has passed.

3.verse: I call out to God Most High,to God who takes care of me.

4.verse: May he send his help from heaven to deliver meand put to shame those who trample upon me; Selahmay God send his kindness and his faithfulness.

5.verse: I lie prostrate in the midst of lionswho are hungrily seeking human prey.Their teeth are spears and arrows,and their tongues are razor-sharp swords.

6.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;let your glory shine over all the earth.

7.verse: They set a trap for my feet,and I was overcome with distress.They dug a pit in my path,but they themselves fell into it. Selah

8.verse: My heart is steadfast, O God,my heart is steadfast;I will sing and chant your praise;

9.verse: awake, my soul!Awake, lyre and harp!I will awaken the dawn.

10.verse: I will give thanks to you among the peoples, O Lord;I will sing your praises among the nations.

11.verse: For your kindness extends to the heavens;your faithfulness, to the skies.

1.verse: Psalm 58 -The Judge of Unjust Rulers -For the director. According to “Do not destroy.” A miktam of David.

2.verse: O you rulers, do you render justice?Do you judge your people impartially?

3.verse: No! You devise wickedness in your hearts,and your hands bring about violence on the earth.

4.verse: The wicked have gone astray right from the womb;from birth these liars have taken the wrong path.

5.verse: Their venom is like that of a serpent;they are as deaf as an asp that stops its ears

6.verse: so as not to hear the voice of the charmerno matter how skillful the spells he casts.

7.verse: O God, break the teeth in their mouths;tear out the fangs of these lions, O Lord.

8.verse: Cause them to vanish like water that drains off;make them wither like grass that is trampled.

9.verse: Let them melt like a snail that oozes into slimeor like a stillborn child that will never see the sun.

10.verse: Before they sprout thorns like brambles or thistles,may your whirlwind sweep them away.

11.verse: The righteous will rejoicewhen he sees that justice has been done,and he will bathe his feetin the blood of the wicked.

1.verse: Psalm 59 -Against Wicked Enemies -For the director. According to “Do not destroy.” A miktam of David. When Saul sent people to watch David’s house in order to kill him.

2.verse: Rescue me, O my God, from my enemies;defend me against those who rise up against me.

3.verse: Deliver me from those who do evil;save me from the violence of the bloodthirsty.

4.verse: They are lying in wait to take my life;the powerful gather together against me.For no offense or sin of mine, O Lord,

5.verse: for no guilt of mine,they stand ready to attack me.Rise up to help me, and look on my plight;

6.verse: you, Lord, God of hosts, are the God of Israel.Rouse yourself and punish all the nations;show no mercy to these wicked deceivers. Selah

7.verse: They return each evening,snarling like dogsas they prowl through the city.

8.verse: See what spews from their mouths—they spew forth from their lips,and they assert, “Who is there to hear us?”

9.verse: However, you laugh at them, O Lord;you show your disdain for all the nations.

10.verse: O my strength, I will keep watch for you,for you, O God, are my fortress,

11.verse: O God of mercy.May God go before meand allow me to have my way with my enemies.

12.verse: Do not put them to death,lest my people forget.Scatter them in your powerand bring them to their knees,O Lord, our shield.

13.verse: For the sins of their mouthsand the words of their lips,let them be trapped in their pride.For the curses and lies they speak,

14.verse: put an end to them in your wrath;put an end to them until they are no more.Then it will be known to the ends of the earththat God is the ruler over Jacob. Selah

15.verse: They return each evening,snarling like dogsas they prowl through the city.

16.verse: They roam about searching for food,and they growl if they do not have their fill.

17.verse: But I will sing of your strength;when morning dawns, I will proclaim your kindness.For you have been my fortress,my refuge in times of trouble.

1.verse: Psalm 60 -Prayer To End Wars -For the director. According to “The Lily of. . . .” A miktam of David (for teaching),

2.verse: when he fought against Aram-naharaim and Aram-zobah; and when Joab, coming back, slew twelve thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

3.verse: O God, you have turned away from usand left us defenseless.Although your anger was aroused,now come to our aid.

4.verse: You shook the earth and split it apart;repair its cracks, for it continues to shake.

5.verse: You have inflicted hardships on your people;you have given us wine that made us stagger.

6.verse: But for those who fear you,you have raised up a bannerto unfurl against the bow. Selah

7.verse: With your right hand come to our aid and answer usso that those you love may be delivered.

8.verse: God has promised from his sanctuary,“In triumph I will apportion Shechemand measure out the Valley of Succoth.

9.verse: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;Ephraim is my helmet,Judah is my scepter.

10.verse: Moab is my washbasin;upon Edom I will plant my sandal;over Philistia I will shout in triumph.”

11.verse: Who will lead me into the fortified city?Who will guide me into Edom?

12.verse: Is it not you, O God, who have rejected usand no longer go forth with our armies?

1.verse: Psalm 61 -Prayer of One in Exile -For the director. With stringed instruments. Of David.

2.verse: O God, hear my cryand listen to my prayer.

3.verse: From the ends of the earth I call to you,with a heart that is fainting away;set me high upon a rock.

4.verse: For you are my refuge,a tower of strength against the enemy.

5.verse: I will abide in your tent foreverand find refuge in the shelter of your wings. Selah

6.verse: For you, O God, have heard my vowsand granted me the heritage of those who fear your name.

7.verse: Add length of days to the life of the king;may his years be prolonged for many generations.

8.verse: May he be enthroned in God’s presence forever,and may your kindness and faithfulness watch over him.

1.verse: Psalm 62 -Trust in God Alone -For the director. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

2.verse: In God alone is my soul at rest;it is from him that my salvation comes.

3.verse: He alone is my rock and my salvation,my fortress, so that I stand ever unshaken.

4.verse: How long will you assault someone,and all of you beat him down,as if he were a leaning wallor a tottering fence?

5.verse: They devise plots to dislodge mefrom my place on highand delight in spreading lies about me.They bless with their lips,but they curse in their hearts. Selah

6.verse: In God alone be at rest, O my soul;it is from him that my hope comes.

7.verse: He alone is my rock and my salvation,my fortress, so that I stand unshaken.

8.verse: My deliverance and my glory depend on God;he is my mighty rock and my refuge.

9.verse: Trust in him at all times, my people,and pour out your heart before him,for God is our refuge. Selah

10.verse: Ordinary people are no more than a breath,and the great are no more than a delusion.When they are placed on scales all together,they are lighter than air.

11.verse: Do not place your trust in extortion,and set no vain hopes in stolen goods;no matter how greatly your wealth increases,do not set your heart on it.

12.verse: One thing God has revealed;two things have I heard:that power belongs to you, O God,

1.verse: Psalm 63 -Thirst for God -A psalm of David. When he was in the wilderness of Judah.

2.verse: O God, you are my God,for whom I have been searching earnestly.My soul yearns for youand my body thirsts for you,like the earth when it is parched,arid and without water.

3.verse: I have gazed upon you in the sanctuaryso that I may behold your power and your glory.

4.verse: Your kindness is a greater joy than life itself;thus my lips will speak your praise.

5.verse: I will bless you all my life;with uplifted hands I will call on your name.

6.verse: My soul will be satisfied as at a banquetand with rejoicing lips my mouth will praise you.

7.verse: I think of you while I lie upon my bed,and I meditate on you during the watches of the night.

8.verse: For you are my help,and in the shadow of your wings I rejoice.

9.verse: My soul clings tightly to you;your right hand holds me fast.

10.verse: Those who seek my life will incur ruin;they will sink down into the depths of the earth.

11.verse: They will be slain by the swordand their flesh will become food for jackals.

1.verse: Psalm 64 -Thanksgiving for Recovery from Illness -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: Listen, O God, to my cry of lament;from the dreaded enemy preserve my life.

3.verse: Protect me from the council of the wicked,from the band of those who do evil.

4.verse: They sharpen their tongues like swords,and they shoot forth their venomous words like arrows,

5.verse: while they attack the innocent from ambush,shooting suddenly and without fear.

6.verse: They agree on their evil plan,and they resolve to lay snares,saying, “Who will see us?”

7.verse: They plot evil schemesand devise shrewd plots;the thoughts of their hearts are hidden.

8.verse: However, God will shoot his arrows at them,and they will suddenly be struck down.

9.verse: Their own tongues will bring them down,and all who see them will wag their heads.

10.verse: Then everyone will be in awe,as they proclaim God’s mighty deedsand contemplate what he has done.

1.verse: Psalm 65 -Thanksgiving for Divine Blessings -For the director. A psalm of David. A song.

2.verse: It is fitting to offer praise to you,O God, in Zion.To you our vows must be fulfilled,

3.verse: for you answer our prayers.To you all flesh must come,

4.verse: burdened by its sinful deeds.Too heavy for us are our sins,and only you can blot them out.

5.verse: Blessed is the one whom you chooseand invite to dwell in your courts.We will be filled with the good things of your house,of your holy temple.

6.verse: Through your awesome deeds of righteousness,you respond to us, O God, our Savior;you are the hope of all the ends of the earthand of the far-off islands.

7.verse: Clothed in your great power,you hold the mountains in place.

8.verse: You quiet the roaring of the seas,the turbulence of their waves,and the turmoil of the nations.

9.verse: Those who dwell at the ends of the earthare awestruck by your wonders.You call forth songs of joyfrom sunrise and sunset.

10.verse: You care for the earth and water it,making it most fertile.The streams of God are filled with waterto provide grain for its people.Thus, you prepare the earth for growth:

11.verse: you water its furrowsand level its ridges;you soften it with showersand bless its yield.

12.verse: You crown the year with your bounty,and your tracks dispense fertility.

13.verse: The pastures of the wilderness overflow,and the hills are covered with rejoicing.

1.verse: Psalm 66 -Thanksgiving for God’s Deliverance -For the director. A song. A psalm.Shout joyfully to God, all the earth;

2.verse: sing to the glory of his name;offer to him glorious praise.

3.verse: Say to God: “How awesome are your deeds!Because of your great power,your enemies grovel before you.

4.verse: The whole earth bows down in worship before you,singing praises to you,singing praises to your name.” Selah

5.verse: Come and behold the works of God,the awesome deeds he has done for people.

6.verse: He changed the sea into dry land;they crossed the river on foot.There we rejoiced in him,

7.verse: for he rules forever by his power.His eyes keep watch over the nationsso that the rebellious not exalt themselves. Selah

8.verse: Bless our God, all you peoples;let the sound of his praise be heard.

9.verse: For he has preserved our livesand has kept our feet from stumbling.

10.verse: For you, O God, have put us to the test;you have purified us as silver is refined.

11.verse: You allowed us to be snared in the netand placed heavy burdens on our backs.

12.verse: You let our captors ride over our heads,and we went through fire and water,but now you have afforded us relief.

13.verse: I will enter your house with burnt offeringsand carry out my vows to you,

14.verse: the vows that my lips pronouncedand my mouth promised when I was in distress.

15.verse: I will offer burnt offerings of fat animalswith the smoke of burning rams;I will sacrifice to you bulls and goats. Selah

16.verse: Come and listen, all you who fear God,while I relate what he has done for me.

17.verse: I lifted up my voice in prayer to him;his praise was on my tongue.

18.verse: If I had harbored evil in my heart,the Lord would not have listened.

19.verse: But God truly did listen,and he was attentive to the words of my prayer.

20.verse: Blessed be God,because he did not reject my prayeror withhold his kindness from me.

1.verse: Psalm 67 -Prayer That All May Worship God -For the director. With stringed instruments. A psalm. A song.

2.verse: O God, be gracious to us and bless usand let your face shine upon us. Selah

3.verse: Then your ways will be known on earthand your salvation among all nations.

4.verse: Let the peoples praise you, O God;let all the peoples praise you.

5.verse: Let the nations rejoice and exult,for you judge the peoples fairlyand guide the nations upon the earth. Selah

6.verse: Let the peoples praise you, O God;let all the peoples praise you.

7.verse: The earth has yielded its harvest;God, our God, has blessed us.

1.verse: Psalm 68 -Song of Victory -For the director. A psalm of David. A song.

2.verse: May God rise up, and his enemies be scattered;may his foes flee before him.

3.verse: As smoke is blown away in the wind,so will they be blown away.As wax melts away before a flame,so will the wicked perish before God.

4.verse: But those who are righteous will rejoice;they will exult before God,crying out with great delight.

5.verse: Sing to God, sing praise to his name;exalt him who rides upon the clouds.Rejoice in the presence of this Godwhose name is the Lord.

6.verse: The Father of orphans and the defender of widows:such is God in his holy dwelling place.

7.verse: He gives a home to those who are forsakenand leads out prisoners amid chants of exultation,while rebels are forced to live in an arid land.

8.verse: O God, when you set out at the head of your people,when you went marching through the wilderness, Selah

9.verse: the earth quaked,and rain poured down from the heavens,at the presence of God, the One of Sinai,at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

10.verse: You poured down rain in abundance, O God,and revived your exhausted inheritance.

11.verse: It was there that your people settled;and in your great goodness, O God,you provided for those who were needy.

12.verse: The Lord issues the word,and a vast army proclaims good tidings:

13.verse: “Kings and their armies are beating a hasty retreat;even those who remained in camp are dividing up the spoils.

14.verse: “While you linger by the sheepfolds,the wings of the dove are covered with silver,its feathers brilliant with shining gold.”

15.verse: When the Almighty routed the kings there,it was like snow fallen upon Zalmon.

16.verse: The mountains of Bashan are God’s mountains;the mountains of Bashan are mighty peaks.

17.verse: Why, O rugged mountains, do you gaze enviouslyat the mountain that God has chosen as his abode,where the Lord himself will dwell forever?

18.verse: The chariots of God are myriad,thousands upon thousands;the Lord has come down from Sinaiand entered into the holy place.

19.verse: You ascended on high,leading captives in your train;you accepted slaves as tribute,so that even rebels might dwell with the Lord God.

20.verse: Blessed be the Lord, day after day,the God of our salvation, who carries our burden. Selah

21.verse: Our God is a God who saves;the Lord God delivers from death.

22.verse: God himself will smite the heads of his enemies,the hairy crowns of those who persist in their sins.

23.verse: The Lord has said:“I will bring them back even from Bashan,I will bring them back even from the depths of the sea,

24.verse: so that you may bathe your feet in the blood of your foesand the tongues of your dogs may have their share.”

25.verse: Your procession, O God, comes into view,the procession of my God and King into the sanctuary.

26.verse: The singers enter first,with musicians trailing behind them,while in their midst are the maidens playing tambourines.

27.verse: Bless God in the assembly;the Lord, the source of Israel.

28.verse: In the lead is Benjamin, the smallest in number,with the princes of Judah in a council,as well as the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.

29.verse: Marshal your power once again, O God,the power of God that you have often wielded for us.

30.verse: For to your temple in Jerusalemkings will come to you bearing gifts.

31.verse: Rebuke those wild beasts of the reeds,the herd of mighty bulls, the calves of nations,who bring bars of silver and prostrate themselves;rout the nations that delight in war.

32.verse: Envoys will come from Egypt;Ethiopia will stretch out its hands to God.

33.verse: Sing to God, all you kingdoms of the earth;sing the praises of the Lord, Selah

34.verse: who rides the ancient heavens aboveand speaks with his voice of thunder.

35.verse: Acknowledge the power of God,whose majesty is over Israeland whose power is in the skies.

1.verse: Psalm 69 -Cry of Anguish in Distress -For the director. According to “Lilies.” Of David.

2.verse: Save me, my God,for the waters have risen to my neck.

3.verse: I am sinking in muddy depthsand can find no foothold.I have fallen into deep waters,and the floods overwhelm me.

4.verse: I am exhausted from crying out;my throat is parched.My eyes have been worn outsearching for my God.

5.verse: More numerous than the hairs of my headare those who hate me for no reason.Many are those who seek to destroy me,and they are treacherous.How can I restorewhat I have not stolen?

6.verse: O God, you know how foolish I am;my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.

7.verse: Do not allow those who hope in youto be put to shame because of me,O Lord of hosts.Do not let those who seek yousuffer disgrace because of me,O God of Israel.

8.verse: It is for your sake that I endure reproachand that shame covers my face.

9.verse: I have become alienated from my brothers,a stranger to my mother’s sons.

10.verse: Zeal for your house consumes me,and the insults directed at you fall on me.

11.verse: When I mortified myself with fasting,I exposed myself to scorn.

12.verse: When I clothed myself in sackcloth,I became a laughingstock.

13.verse: Those who sit at the gate taunt me,and drunkards make me the target of their ditties.

14.verse: But I lift up my prayer to you, O Lord,in the time of your favor.In your great kindness, O God,respond to me with your certain help.

15.verse: Draw me out of the mire,and do not let me plunge any deeper.Deliver me from my enemiesand from the deep waters.

16.verse: Do not let the flood waters sweep over me,or the depths swallow me up,or the pit close its jaws around me.

17.verse: Answer me, O Lord, for your kindness is wonderful;in your great compassion turn toward me.

18.verse: Do not hide your face from your servant;answer me quickly, for I am in distress.

19.verse: Draw near to me and redeem me;deliver me from my enemies.

20.verse: You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor;all my oppressors are in your sight.

21.verse: Insults have so broken my heartthat I am near the end of my strength.I looked for compassion, but in vain,for some consolers, but I found none.

22.verse: They put gall in my food,and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

23.verse: Let their table become a trap for them;let their well-being become a snare.

24.verse: Let their eyes dim so that they cannot see,and let their limbs tremble constantly.

25.verse: Vent your wrath on them,and let your burning anger take hold of them.

26.verse: Let their camp be left desolate;let there be no one to dwell in their tents.

27.verse: For they pursue the one you struck downand tell of the pain of the one you hurt.

28.verse: Charge them with crime after crime;let them not share in your salvation.

29.verse: Blot them out from the book of the living;do not number them among the upright.

30.verse: But I am filled with pain and suffering;may your saving power, O God, raise me up.

31.verse: I will praise the name of God with a songand glorify him with a hymn of thanksgiving.

32.verse: This will gratify the Lord more than an oxor a young bull with horns and hoofs:

33.verse: “Let the poor see this and rejoice;let those who seek God take heart.

34.verse: For the Lord hears the needyand does not turn his back on captives.

35.verse: Let the heavens and the earth offer praise,the seas and everything that moves therein.”

36.verse: For God will deliver Zionand rebuild the cities of Judah.His people will live there and possess it;

1.verse: Psalm 70 -Insistent Prayer for Divine Assistance -For the director. Of David. For remembrance.

2.verse: Make haste, O God, to rescue me;O Lord, come quickly to my aid.

3.verse: May all those who seek to take my lifeendure shame and confusion.May all those who desire my ruinbe turned back and humiliated.

4.verse: May those who cry out to me, “Aha! Aha!”be forced to retreat in shame.

5.verse: But may all who seek yourejoice in you and be jubilant.May those who love your salvationcry out forever, “May God be magnified.”

1.verse: Psalm 71 -Prayer of the Righteous in Old Age -In you, O Lord, I have taken refuge;let me never be put to shame.

2.verse: In your righteousness rescue me and deliver me;hear my plea and save me.

3.verse: Be to me a rock of refugeto which I can always go;proclaim the order to save me,for you are my rock and my fortress.

4.verse: O my God, rescue me from the hands of the impious,from the grasp of cruel and ruthless foes.

5.verse: You, O Lord, are my hope,my confidence, O God, from my youth.

6.verse: I have relied upon you since birth,and you have been my strength from my mother’s womb;my praise rises unceasingly to you.

7.verse: I have become a portent to many,but you are my sure refuge.

8.verse: My mouth is filled with your praisesas I relate your glory all day long.

9.verse: Do not cast me off in my old age;do not forsake me when my strength is completely spent.

10.verse: For my enemies speak against me,and those who seek my life plot together.

11.verse: They say: “God has abandoned him;go after him and seize him,for no one will come to his rescue.”

12.verse: O God, do not remain aloof from me;come quickly to help me, O my God.

13.verse: Let those who accuse mebe put to shame and perish;let those who are determined to harm meincur contempt and disgrace.

14.verse: But I will hope in you continuallyand will render even more praise to you.

15.verse: My lips will proclaim your righteous deedsand your salvation all day long,though I do not know their extent.

16.verse: I will speak of your mighty deeds, O Lord God,and declare your righteousness, yours alone.

17.verse: O God, you have taught me from my youth,and to this day I proclaim your marvelous works.

18.verse: Now that I am old and my hair is gray,do not abandon me, O God,until I have extolled your mightto all the generations yet to come,your strength

19.verse: and your righteousness, O God,to the highest heavens.You have done great things;O God, who is there who is like you?

20.verse: You have shown me many afflictions and hardships,but you will once again revive me.From the depths of the earthyou will once again raise me up.

21.verse: You will restore my honorand console me once again.

22.verse: Then I will also praise you with the harpfor your faithfulness, O my God.I will sing praises to you with the lyre,O Holy One of Israel.

23.verse: When I sing to you, my lips will rejoice,and so will my soul, which you have redeemed.

24.verse: All day long my tonguewill relate your righteousness.For those who intended to do me harmwill suffer shame and disgrace.

1.verse: Psalm 72 -The Kingdom of the Messiah -Of Solomon.O God, endow the king with your judgment,the son of kings with your righteousness.

2.verse: He will govern your people fairlyand deal justly with your poor ones.

3.verse: The mountains will yield peace for the people,and the hills, righteousness.

4.verse: He will defend the afflicted among the people,save the children of the poor,and overwhelm the oppressor.

5.verse: He will reign as long as the sun,as long as the moon, through all generations.

6.verse: He will descend like rain on the meadow,like showers that water the earth.

7.verse: Justice will reign in his days,and peace will abounduntil the moon is no more.

8.verse: His rule will extend from sea to sea,and from the river to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: His foes will bow down before him,and his enemies will lick the dust.

10.verse: The kings of Tarshish and the Islandswill offer him tribute;the kings of Sheba and Sebawill present him with gifts.

11.verse: All kings will pay him homage,and all nations will serve him.

12.verse: For he will save the poor who cry outand the needy who have no one to help them.

13.verse: He will have pity on the lowly and the poor;the lives of the needy he will save.

14.verse: He will free them from oppression and violence,for their blood is precious in his sight.

15.verse: Long may he live!May the gold of Sheba be given to him.May people pray for him unceasinglyand invoke blessings on him all day long.

16.verse: May grain abound throughout the land,even growing abundantly on the mountain tops.May its crops be as plenteous as those of Lebanon,and may its people flourish like the grass of the field.

17.verse: May his name be blessed forever;may it endure as long as the sun.May all peoples be blessed in him;may all the nations proclaim his greatness.

18.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,who alone can perform such wondrous deeds.

19.verse: May his glorious name be blessed forever,and may the whole world be filled with his glory.Amen. Amen.

20.verse: The end of the psalms of David, son of Jesse.

1.verse: Book III—Psalms 73–89 -Psalm 73 -False Happiness of the Wicked -A psalm of Asaph.God is truly good to the upright,to those who are pure in heart.

2.verse: But as for me, I nearly lost my balance;I was almost at the point of stumbling.

3.verse: For I was filled with envy of the arrogantwhen I perceived how the wicked prosper.

4.verse: They endure no painful suffering;their bodies are healthy and well fed.

5.verse: They are not plagued with burdens common to all;the troubles of life do not afflict them.

6.verse: So they wear arrogance like a necklaceand don violence like a robe.

7.verse: Their callous hearts overflow with malice,and their minds are completely taken up with evil plans.

8.verse: They mock and pour forth their malevolence;in their haughtiness they threaten oppression.

9.verse: Their mouths rage against the heavenswhile their tongues are never stilled on the earth.

10.verse: So the people blindly follow themand find nothing offensive in their words.

11.verse: They say: “How does God know?Does the Most High notice anything?”

12.verse: Such are the wicked,as they pile up wealth, without any concerns.

13.verse: Is it in vain that I have kept my heart cleanand washed my hands in innocence?

14.verse: For I am stricken day after dayand punished every morning.

15.verse: If I had decided, “I will speak like them,”I would not have been true to your children.

16.verse: When I tried to understand all this,I found it too difficult for me,

17.verse: until I entered the sanctuary of Godand realized what their final end would be.

18.verse: Indeed, you set them on a slippery slopeand cast them headlong into utter ruin.

19.verse: How suddenly they are destroyed,completely wiped out by terrors!

20.verse: When you arise, O Lord,you will dismiss themas one discards a dream on awakening.

21.verse: When my heart was embitteredand my soul was deeply tormented,

22.verse: I was stupid and unable to comprehend—like a brute beast in your presence.

23.verse: Yet I am always with you;you grasp me by the right hand.

24.verse: You guide me with your counsel,and afterward you will receive me into glory.

25.verse: Whom do I have in heaven except you?And besides you there is nothing else I desire on earth.

26.verse: Even should my heart and my flesh fail,God is the rock of my heartand my portion forever.

27.verse: But all those who are far from you will perish;you destroy those who are unfaithful to you.

28.verse: As for me, my happiness is to be near God,and I have made the Lord God my refuge;I will proclaim all your worksat the gates of the Daughter of Zion.

1.verse: Psalm 74 -Prayer in Time of Calamity -A maskil of Asaph.Why, O God, have you cast us off forever?Why does your anger blaze forthagainst the sheep of your pasture?

2.verse: Remember the people that you purchased long ago,the tribe that you redeemed as your own possession,and Mount Zion that you chose as your dwelling.

3.verse: Direct now your steps to the endless ruins,toward the sanctuary destroyed by the enemy.

4.verse: Your foes exulted triumphantly in the place of your assemblyand set up their memorial emblems.

5.verse: They set upon it with their axesas if it were a thicket of trees.

6.verse: And then, with hatchets and hammers,they bludgeoned all the carved work.

7.verse: They set your sanctuary ablaze;they razed and defiled the dwelling place of your name.

8.verse: They said to themselves, “We will utterly crush them,”and they burned every shrine of God in the land.

9.verse: Now we see no signs,there are no longer any prophets,and none of us knows how long this will last.

10.verse: How long, O God, will the foe mock you?Will the enemy blaspheme your name forever?

11.verse: Why do you hold back your right hand?Take it out from your robe and destroy them.

12.verse: Yet you, O God, are my King from of old,working deeds of salvation throughout the earth.

13.verse: By your power you split the sea in twoand shattered the heads of the dragons in the waters.

14.verse: You crushed the heads of Leviathanand gave him as food for the wild beasts.

15.verse: You opened up springs and torrentsand turned flowing rivers into dry land.

16.verse: Yours is the day, and yours also is the night,for you set in place both sun and moon.

17.verse: You fixed all the boundaries of the earthand created both summer and winter.

18.verse: Remember, O Lord, how the enemy has mocked you,how a foolish people has blasphemed your name.

19.verse: Do not surrender the soul of your dove to wild beasts;do not forget forever the life of your poor.

20.verse: Have regard for your covenant!For the land is filled with darkness,and the pastures are haunts of violence.

21.verse: Do not let the oppressed turn back in shame;let the poor and needy bless your name.

22.verse: Rise up, O God, and defend your cause;remember how fools mock you all day long.

23.verse: Do not ignore the outbursts of your enemies,the unceasing tumult of your foes.

1.verse: Psalm 75 -God Is Judge of the World -For the director. According to “Do not destroy!” A psalm of Asaph. A song.

2.verse: We give thanks to you, O God,we give thanks to you.For your wondrous deedsdeclare that your name is near.

3.verse: You say, “When I receive the assembly,I will judge with equity.

4.verse: When the earth quakes, with all its inhabitants,it is I who will hold its pillars firm. Selah

5.verse: “I say to the arrogant, ‘Do not boast,’and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns.

6.verse: Do not rebel against heavenor speak with arrogance against the Rock.’ ”

7.verse: For judgment does not come from east or west,nor from the wilderness or the mountains.

8.verse: Rather, it is God who judges rightly,humbling one and exalting another.

9.verse: The Lord holds in his hand a cupfilled with foaming wine and richly spiced.When he pours it out,all the wicked of the earth must drink;they will drain it down to the dregs.

10.verse: As for me, I will proclaim this forever;I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

1.verse: Psalm 76 -God, Defender of Zion -For the director. With stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.

2.verse: God is renowned in Judah;his name is great in Israel.

3.verse: His tent has been established in Salem,his dwelling place in Zion.

4.verse: There he shattered the flashing arrows,shields and swords and weapons of war. Selah

5.verse: You are awesome and resplendent,more majestic than the everlasting mountains.

6.verse: The bold warriors lie plunderedand sleeping their last sleep.And not one of the men of warcan lift up his hands.

7.verse: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,both chariots and horses lie prostrate.

8.verse: You indeed are awesome;who can stand in your presence when your anger is aroused?

9.verse: You thundered your verdicts from the heavens;the earth in its terror was silent

10.verse: when you arose, O God, to judge,to rescue all the afflicted of the land. Selah

11.verse: Human wrath only serves to praise you;those who survive your anger will cling to you.

12.verse: Make vows to the Lord, your God, and keep them;let all the lands nearbybring gifts to the Awesome One,

1.verse: Psalm 77 -Lament and Consolation in Distress -For the director. For Jeduthun. A psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: I cry aloud to God,for when I cry out to God, he hears me.

3.verse: In the time of my distress I seek the Lord;at night I stretch out my hands unceasingly,and my soul refuses to be consoled.

4.verse: I groan as I think of God;my spirit grows faint as I meditate on him. Selah

5.verse: You keep my eyes from closing in sleep;I am much too distraught to speak.

6.verse: I reflect on the days of oldand recall the years long past.

7.verse: At night I meditate in my heart,and as I reflect, my spirit questions:

8.verse: “Will the Lord cast us off foreverand never again show us his favor?

9.verse: Has his kindness vanished forever?Has his promise ceased for all time?

10.verse: Has God forgotten how to be merciful?Has he shut up his compassion in anger?” Selah

11.verse: And I say: “This is my grief—that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”

12.verse: I will remember the works of the Lord;I will call to mind your wonders in the past.

13.verse: I will reflect on all your deedsand ponder your wondrous works.

14.verse: O God, your way is holy.What god is as great as our God?

15.verse: You are the God who works wonders;you have displayed your might to the nations.

16.verse: With your strong arm you redeemed your people,the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

17.verse: When the waters beheld you, O God,when the waters beheld you, they writhed;the very depths trembled.

18.verse: The clouds poured forth their water,the skies thundered,your arrows flashed back and forth.

19.verse: The crash of your thunder resounded in the heavens;your flashes of lightning lit up the world;the earth trembled and shook.

20.verse: Your path led through the sea,your way, through the mighty waters,though none could trace your footsteps.

1.verse: Psalm 78 -God’s Goodness in the Face of Ingratitude -A maskil of Asaph.Give ear, my people, to my teaching;pay attention to the words of my mouth.

2.verse: I will open my mouth in parablesand expound the mysteries of the past.

3.verse: These things we have heard and know,for our ancestors have related them to us.

4.verse: We will not conceal them from our children;we will relate them to the next generation,the glorious and powerful deeds of the Lordand the wonders he has performed.

5.verse: He instituted a decree in Jacoband established a law in Israel,which he commanded our ancestorsto make known to their descendants,

6.verse: so that they would be known to future generations,to children yet to be born.In turn they were to tell their children,

7.verse: so that they would place their trust in God,and never forget his worksbut keep his commandments.

8.verse: Nor were they to imitate their ancestors,a stubborn and rebellious generation,a generation whose heart was not steadfastand whose spirit was unfaithful to God.

9.verse: The Ephraimites, who were skilled archers,fled in terror on the day of battle.

10.verse: They failed to keep God’s covenantand refused to live in accord with his law.

11.verse: They forgot the works he had done,the wonders he had performed for them.

12.verse: He worked marvels in the sight of their ancestorsin the land of Egypt, in the Plain of Zoan.

13.verse: He divided the sea so that they could pass,heaping up the waters as a mound.

14.verse: He led them with a cloud by day,and with the light of a fire by night.

15.verse: He split open rocks in the wildernessand gave them water to drink from limitless depths.

16.verse: He brought forth streams from a rocky cragand caused water to flow down in torrents.

17.verse: But they still sinned against him,rebelling against the Most High in the wilderness.

18.verse: They tested God’s patienceby demanding the food they craved.

19.verse: They railed against God, saying:“Can God provide a banquet in the wilderness?

20.verse: Certainly when he struck the rock,water gushed forth and the streams overflowed.But can he also give us breador provide meat for his people?”

21.verse: When the Lord heard this, he was filled with anger;his fire blazed forth against Jacob,and his wrath mounted against Israel,

22.verse: because they had no faith in Godand put no trust in his saving might.

23.verse: Yet he issued a command to the skies aboveand opened the doors of the heavens.

24.verse: He rained down manna for them to eat,giving them the grain of heaven.

25.verse: Mere mortals ate the bread of angels;he sent them an abundance of provisions.

26.verse: He made the east wind blow in the heavensand brought forth the south wind in force.

27.verse: He rained down meat upon them like dust,winged birds like the sands on the seashore.

28.verse: He let them fall within the camp,all around their tents.

29.verse: They ate and were completely satisfied,for he had given them what they desired.

30.verse: But when they did not curb their cravings,even while the food was in their mouths,

31.verse: the anger of God blazed up against them;he slew their strongest warriorsand laid low the chosen of Israel.

32.verse: Despite this, they continued to sin;they put no faith in his wonders.

33.verse: So he brought their days to an abrupt endand cut off their years with sudden terror.

34.verse: When death afflicted them,they sought him;they searched eagerly for God.

35.verse: They remembered that God was their Rock,that God Most High was their Redeemer.

36.verse: However, while they flattered him with their mouthsand lied to him with their tongues,

37.verse: their hearts were not right with him,nor were they faithful to his covenant.

38.verse: Even so, he was compassionate toward them;he forgave their guiltand did not destroy them.Time after time he held back his anger,unwilling to stir up his rage.

39.verse: For he remembered that they were flesh,like a breath of wind that does not return.

40.verse: How often they rebelled against him in the wildernessand pained him in the wasteland.

41.verse: Again and again they tested God’s patience,provoking the Holy One of Israel.

42.verse: They did not keep in mind his poweror the day when he delivered them from their oppressor,

43.verse: when he manifested his wonders in Egyptand his portents in the Plain of Zoan.

44.verse: He turned their rivers into blood;they could not drink from their streams.

45.verse: He sent swarms of flies that devoured themand frogs that devastated them.

46.verse: He assigned their harvest to the caterpillarsand their produce to the locusts.

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hailand their sycamore trees with frost.

48.verse: He exposed their cattle to hailstonesand their flocks to bolts of lightning.

49.verse: He sent upon them his blazing anger,wrath, fury, and hostility,a band of destroying angels.

50.verse: He gave his anger free rein;he did not spare them from deathbut delivered their lives to the plague.

51.verse: He struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,the firstfruits of their manhood in the tents of Ham.

52.verse: Then he led forth his people like sheepand guided them through the wilderness like a flock.

53.verse: He led them in safety, and they were not afraid,while the sea engulfed their enemies.

54.verse: He brought them to his holy land,to the mountain his right hand had purchased.

55.verse: He drove out the nations before them,apportioning a heritage for each of themand settling the tribes of Israel in their tents.

56.verse: Even so, they put God to the testand rebelled against the Most High,refusing to observe his decrees.

57.verse: They turned away and were disloyal like their ancestors;they were as unreliable as a faulty bow.

58.verse: They angered him with their high placesand made him jealous with their idols.

59.verse: When God saw this, he became enragedand rejected Israel totally.

60.verse: He forsook his dwelling in Shiloh,the tent where he dwelt among mortals.

61.verse: He surrendered his might into captivityand his glory into the hands of the enemy.

62.verse: He abandoned his people to the swordand vented his wrath on his own heritage.

63.verse: Fire devoured their young men,and their maidens had no wedding song.

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword,and their widows sang no lamentation.

65.verse: Then the Lord awakened as from sleep,like a warrior flushed from the effects of wine.

66.verse: He struck his enemies and routed them,inflicting perpetual shame on them.

67.verse: He rejected the tent of Josephand did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.

68.verse: Rather, he chose the tribe of Judah,Mount Zion, which he loved.

69.verse: He built his sanctuary like the high heavens,and like the earth that he founded forever.

70.verse: He chose David to be his servantand took him from the sheepfolds.

71.verse: From tending sheep he brought himto be the shepherd of his people Jacob,of Israel, his heritage.

72.verse: He shepherded them with an unblemished heartand guided them with a knowing hand.

1.verse: Psalm 79 -Prayer for Restoration -A psalm of Asaph.O God, the nations have invaded your heritage;they have profaned your holy templeand turned Jerusalem into a heap of ruins.

2.verse: They have given the corpses of your servantsas food to the birds of the air,the flesh of your saintsto the beasts of the earth.

3.verse: They have poured out their blood like waterall around Jerusalem,and no one is left to bury them.

4.verse: We have become the scorn of our neighbors,mocked and derided by those around us.

5.verse: How long, O Lord? Will you be angry forever?How long will your rage continue to blaze like a fire?

6.verse: Pour out your wrath on the nationsthat refuse to acknowledge you,on the kingdomsthat fail to call on your name.

7.verse: For they have devoured Jacoband ravaged his homeland.

8.verse: Do not hold against us the sins of our ancestors;let your mercy come quickly to meet us,for we are in desperate straits.

9.verse: Help us, O God, our Savior,for the glory of your name;deliver us and wipe away our sinsfor your name’s sake.

10.verse: Why should the nations ask,“Where is their God?”Before our eyes make it clearly known among those nationsthat you avenge the blood of your servants.

11.verse: Let the groans of the captives come before you;through your great powersave those who have been sentenced to death.

12.verse: Repay our neighbors sevenfold in their breasts, O Lord,for the insults with which they taunted you.

13.verse: Then we, your people, the sheep of your pasture,will offer thanks to you forever;from generation to generationwe will proclaim your praise.

1.verse: Psalm 80 -Prayer for the Persecuted People -For the director. According to “Lilies.” Eduth. A psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: Listen to us, O shepherd of Israel,you who lead Joseph like a flock.As you sit enthroned upon the cherubim, shine forth

3.verse: over Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh.Stir up your powerand come to save us.

4.verse: Restore us, O Lord of hosts;let your face shine upon us,and we will be saved.

5.verse: O Lord of hosts,how long will you be angryat your people’s prayers?

6.verse: You have fed them with the bread of tearsand made them drink tears beyond measure.

7.verse: You have made us an object of contention to our neighbors,a source of mockery to our enemies.

8.verse: Restore us, O Lord of hosts;let your face shine upon us,and we will be saved.

9.verse: You brought a vine out of Egypt;you dispersed the nations and planted it.

10.verse: You prepared the ground for it;then it took root and filled the land.

11.verse: The mountains were covered with its shadeand the cedars of God with its shoots.

12.verse: It sent out its boughs as far as the Sea,its shoots as far as the river.

13.verse: Why have you broken down its wallsso that all who pass by pluck its grapes?

14.verse: The boars from the forest ravage it,and wild beasts of the field feed on it.

15.verse: Turn once again to us, O Lord of hosts;look down from heaven and see;take care of this vine,

16.verse: this shoot that your right hand has planted,the son that you yourself made strong.

17.verse: Let those who would burn it or cut it downperish when confronted by your rebuke.

18.verse: Let your hand rest upon the man at your right,the son of man that you yourself made strong.

19.verse: Then we will never again turn away from you;give us life and we will call upon your name.

1.verse: Psalm 81 -Exhortation To Worship Worthily -For the director. “Upon the gittith.” Of Asaph.

2.verse: Sing out your joy to God our strength;shout aloud to the God of Jacob.

3.verse: Raise the chant and sound the tambourine;play the pleasant harp and the lyre.

4.verse: Sound the trumpet at the new moon,and also at the full moon on the day of our Feast.

5.verse: For this is a law in Israel,a decree of the God of Jacob.

6.verse: He imposed this testimony on Josephwhen he departed from the land of Egypt.I now hear an unfamiliar voice:

7.verse: “I lifted the burden from their shoulders;their hands put aside the laborer’s basket.

8.verse: When you cried out to me in distress, I rescued you;from the thunderclouds I answered you;I tested you at the waters of Meribah: Selah

9.verse: “ ‘Listen to me, O my people, while I warn you.O Israel, if only you would listen to me!

10.verse: You must not accept a foreign god in your presence;you must not bow down to an alien deity.

11.verse: I am the Lord, your God,who brought you up from the land of Egypt;open your mouth wide so that I may fill it.’

12.verse: “But my people did not listen to my voice;Israel refused to obey me.

13.verse: So I abandoned them to their stubborn heartsand let them follow their own devices.

14.verse: “If only my people would listen to me,if only Israel would walk in my ways,

15.verse: I would quickly subdue their enemiesand raise my hand against their foes.

16.verse: “Then those who hate the Lord would tremble before him,for their doom would last forever.

1.verse: Psalm 82 -Judgment on Abuse of Authority -A psalm of Asaph.God takes his place in the divine council;in the midst of the gods he pronounces judgment:

2.verse: “How long will you issue unfair judgmentsand rule in favor of those who are wicked? Selah

3.verse: “Grant justice to the weak and the orphan;defend the rights of the lowly and the poor.

4.verse: Rescue the wretched and the needy;free them from the hand of the wicked.

5.verse: “They neither know nor understand;they wander around in darknesswhile all the foundations of the earth are crumbling.

6.verse: I declare, ‘Although you are gods,all of you sons of the Most High,

7.verse: you will die as all men do;like any ruler you will fall.’ ”

8.verse: Rise up, O God, and judge the earth,for all the nations belong to you.

1.verse: Psalm 83 -Against a Hostile Alliance -A song. A psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: O God, do not remain silent;do not be quiet and inactive, O God.

3.verse: Note how your enemies rage about,how your foes increase in arrogance.

4.verse: They formulate shrewd plans against your people,conspiring against those you love.

5.verse: They say, “Come, let us wipe them out as a nation;let the name of Israel be totally forgotten.”

6.verse: They conspire with a single mind,forming an alliance against you:

7.verse: the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,Moab and the Hagrites,

8.verse: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek,Philistia, and the inhabitants of Tyre;

9.verse: Assyria has also joined them as an ally,offering aid to the descendants of Lot. Selah

10.verse: Deal with them as you did with Midian,and with Sisera and Jabin at the brook of Kishon,

11.verse: who were destroyed at Endorand became manure for the ground.

12.verse: Make their chieftains like Oreb and Zeeb,and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

13.verse: who boasted, “Let us seize for ourselvesthe pastures of God.”

14.verse: O my God, treat them like tumbleweed,like chaff blown before the wind.

15.verse: As a fire rages through a forest,as a flame sets mountains ablaze,

16.verse: so hound them with your tempestsand terrify them with your stormwinds.

17.verse: Fill their faces with shameso that they will seek your name, O Lord.

18.verse: Let them be humiliated and terrified forever;let them be disgraced and perish.

1.verse: Psalm 84 -Longing for God’s Dwelling -For the director. “Upon the gittith.” A psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: How lovely is your dwelling place,O Lord of hosts.

3.verse: My soul yearns and is filled with longingfor the courts of the Lord.My heart and my flesh cry outfor the living God.

4.verse: Just as the sparrow searches for a homeand the swallow builds a nest for herselfwhere she may place her young,so do I seek your altars,O Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

5.verse: Blessed are those who dwell in your house;they offer continuous praise to you. Selah

6.verse: Blessed are those who find strength in you,who set their hearts upon your ways.

7.verse: As they pass through the Valley of Baca,they turn it into a region of springs,and the early rain covers it with pools.

8.verse: They move forward with increasing strengthas they behold the God of gods in Zion.

9.verse: O Lord of hosts, hear my prayer;listen to my pleas, O God of Jacob. Selah

10.verse: O God, look upon our shieldbehold the face of your anointed one.

11.verse: It is better to spend one day in your courtsthan a thousand elsewhere.I would rather be a doorkeeper in God’s housethan dwell inside the tents of the wicked.

12.verse: The Lord God serves as our sun and our shield;the Lord showers us with grace and glory.He does not withhold any good thingfrom those who walk in integrity.

1.verse: Psalm 85 -Prayer for the People’s Salvation -For the director. A psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: O Lord, you showed favor to your land;you restored the good fortune of Jacob.

3.verse: You forgave the iniquity of your people;you canceled all their sins. Selah

4.verse: You cast aside all your wrath;you put an end to your great anger.

5.verse: Restore us once again, O God, our Savior,and cease your displeasure toward us.

6.verse: Will you remain angry with us forever?Will you hold onto your wrath for all generations?

7.verse: Will you not once again give us lifeso that your people may exult in you?

8.verse: Show us, O Lord, your kindnessand grant us your salvation.

9.verse: I will listen for God’s response;surely the Lord will proclaim peace to his people, his saints,to those who turn to him with their whole heart.

10.verse: His salvation is indeed near for those who fear him;his glory will dwell in our land.

11.verse: Kindness and faithfulness will meet;righteousness and peace will embrace.

12.verse: Faithfulness will spring forth from the earth,and righteousness will look down from heaven.

13.verse: The Lord will grant us prosperity,and our land will yield its harvest.

1.verse: Psalm 86 -Prayer in Suffering and Distress -A prayer of David.Incline your ear, O Lord, and answer me,for I am poor and needy.

2.verse: Preserve my life, for I am faithful to you;save your servant who puts his trust in you.

3.verse: You are my God; have pity on me, O Lord,for to you I cry out all day long.

4.verse: Give joy to the soul of your servant,for to you, O Lord,I lift up my soul.

5.verse: O Lord, you are kind and forgiving,filled with kindness for all who cry to you.

6.verse: Hear my prayer, O Lord,and listen to my voice in supplication.

7.verse: In the time of trouble I call to you,for you will answer me.

8.verse: There is no one among the gods like you, O Lord,nor can any deeds compare with yours.

9.verse: All the nations you have madewill come and bow down before you, O Lord,and glorify your name.

10.verse: For you are great and you do marvelous deeds;you alone are God.

11.verse: Teach me your ways, O Lord,so that I may walk in your truth;let me worship your namewith an undivided heart.

12.verse: I will praise you with all my heart,O Lord, my God,and I will glorify your name forever.

13.verse: Your kindness toward me is great;you have rescued me from the depths of the netherworld.

14.verse: Arrogant men are rising up against me, O God;a violent mob seeks my life;they do not keep you before their eyes.

15.verse: But you, O Lord, are a merciful and compassionate God,slow to anger and abounding in kindness and faithfulness.

16.verse: Turn to me and grant me your gracious favor;endow your servant with strengthand rescue the child of your handmaid.

17.verse: Grant me a sign of your favor,so that those who hate memay see it and be put to shame,because you, O Lord,have helped and comforted me.

1.verse: Psalm 87 -Zion, Home of All Nations -A psalm of the sons of Korah. A song.The Lord has founded a cityon the holy mountains.

2.verse: He loves the gates of Zionmore than any dwelling in Jacob.

3.verse: Glorious things are said of you,O city of God. Selah

4.verse: “I number Rahab and Babylonamong those who acknowledge the Lord,as well as Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia;concerning them it can be said,‘This one was born there.’ ” Selah

5.verse: However, of Zion it will be said,“They were all born there,for the Most High himself establishes her.”

6.verse: The Lord records in the register of the peoples,“This one was born there.” Selah

7.verse: And as they play, they all sing,“In you are all my fountains.”

1.verse: Psalm 88 -Prayer in Affliction -A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the director. According to Mahalath. For singing. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.

2.verse: O Lord, the God of my salvation,day and night I cry out to you.

3.verse: Let my prayer come before you;give ear to my cry for help.

4.verse: For my soul is filled with misery,and my life draws near to the netherworld.

5.verse: I am numbered among those who go down to the pit;all strength has failed me.

6.verse: I have been abandoned among the dead,like the slain who lie in the grave,like those whom you remember no longerand whom your hand has abandoned.

7.verse: You have lowered me into the depths of the pit,into the darkest regions of the abyss.

8.verse: Your wrath lies heavy upon me;all your waves engulf me. Selah

9.verse: You have caused my closest friends to shun meand made me hateful in their sight.I am shut in with no means of escape,

10.verse: and my eyes grow dim with my suffering.Every day I call out to you, O Lord,and spread out my hands to you.

11.verse: Do you perform wonders for the dead?Do the shades rise up and give you praise? Selah

12.verse: Is your kindness celebrated in the grave,or your faithfulness in the tomb?

13.verse: Are your wonders known in the region of darkness,or your righteous deeds in the land of oblivion?

14.verse: But for my part, I cry out to you, O Lord;in the morning my prayer rises before you.

15.verse: Why do you cast me away, O Lord?Why do you hide your face from me?

16.verse: Since infancy I have been wretched and close to death;I have borne your terrorsand have now reached the point of exhaustion.

17.verse: Your wrath has weighed down upon me;your terrors have destroyed me.

18.verse: All day long they surround me like a flood;they encircle me completely.

1.verse: Psalm 89 -Prayer for the Fulfillment of God’s Promise -A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

2.verse: I will sing forever of the Lord’s kindness;with my lips I will proclaim your faithfulnessthroughout the generations.

3.verse: You said, “My kindness lasts forever;my faithfulness is as firmly established as the heavens.

4.verse: “I have made a covenant with my chosen one;I have sworn to my servant David:

5.verse: ‘I will establish your descendants foreverand allow your throne to endure for all generations.’ ” Selah

6.verse: Let the heavens praise your wonders, O Lord,your faithfulness in the assembly of your holy ones.

7.verse: For who in the skies can be compared to the Lord?Is there any heavenly being who is like the Lord,

8.verse: a God who is feared in the council of the holy ones,greater and more awesome than any who stand in his presence?

9.verse: O Lord, God of hosts, who is like you?Almighty Lord, your faithfulness is never absent.

10.verse: You control the raging sea,calming its surging waves.

11.verse: You crushed Rahab with a deadly blow;you scattered your foes with your mighty arm.

12.verse: Yours are the heavens and yours is the earth;you founded the world and all that is in it.

13.verse: You created the north and the south;Tabor and Hermon joyously praise your name.

14.verse: Mighty is your arm and strong is your hand;your right hand is forever raised high.

15.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;kindness and faithfulness go before your face.

16.verse: Blessed are the people who know how to acclaim you, O Lord,who walk in the light of your countenance.

17.verse: In your name they rejoice all day long,and they exult in your righteousness.

18.verse: You are the strength in which they glory,and by your kindness our horn is exalted.

19.verse: For the Lord is our shield,the Holy One of Israel, our King.

20.verse: On one occasion you spoke in a visionand said to your faithful servants:“I have appointed as leader one who is mighty;I have exalted one chosen from the people.

21.verse: I have found David, my servant,and with my holy oil I have anointed him.

22.verse: “My hand will sustain him;my arm will make him strong.

23.verse: No enemy will overcome him;no one who is wicked will oppress him.

24.verse: “I will crush his foes before himand strike down those who hate him.

25.verse: My faithfulness and my kindness will be with him;through my name his horn will be exalted.

26.verse: “I will stretch his hand as far as the seaand his right hand as far as the rivers.

27.verse: He will cry to me, ‘You are my Father,my God, the Rock of my salvation.’

28.verse: “I will designate him as my firstborn,the highest of all earthly kings.

29.verse: Forever I will maintain my kindness for him,and my covenant with him will never end.

30.verse: I will establish his dynasty foreverand his throne as long as the heavens.

31.verse: “If his descendants forsake my lawand refuse to conform to my decrees,

32.verse: if they break my statutesand do not keep my precepts,

33.verse: I will punish their disobedience with the rodand their iniquity with scourges.

34.verse: “But I will not deprive him of my kindnessor fail to observe my faithfulness.

35.verse: I will not violate my covenantor alter the promise I have spoken.

36.verse: “By my holiness I have sworn once and for all:never will I break faith with David.

37.verse: His dynasty will last forever,and his throne will endure before me like the sun.

38.verse: It will endure forever like the moon,a faithful witness in the sky.” Selah

39.verse: But now you have spurned and rejected him,you have become filled with wrath against your anointed one.

40.verse: You have repudiated your covenant with your servantand dishonored his crown in the dust.

41.verse: You have breached all his wallsand turned his strongholds into ruins.

42.verse: Every passer-by has despoiled him;he has become a laughingstock to his neighbors.

43.verse: You have exalted the right hand of his foesand caused all his enemies to rejoice.

44.verse: You have driven back his drawn swordand left him to fight without your support.

45.verse: You have put an end to his gloryand toppled his throne to the ground.

46.verse: You have curtailed the time of his youthand enveloped him in shame. Selah

47.verse: How long, O Lord? Will you remain hidden forever?How long will your wrath blaze like a fire?

48.verse: Remember how brief is my span of lifeand how weak you have made all mortals.

49.verse: Who can live and never experience death?Who can save himself from the power of the netherworld? Selah

50.verse: Where is your kindness of old, O Lord,which you swore to David in your faithfulness?

51.verse: Remember, O Lord, the insults hurled at your servant;recall how I have borne in my heart the slanders of all the peoples.

52.verse: Your enemies have leveled insults at us, O Lord;they have taunted the footsteps of your anointed one.

1.verse: Book IV—Psalms 90–106 -Psalm 90 -Prayer To Use Time Wisely -A prayer of Moses, the man of God.Lord, you have been our refugefrom generation to generation.

2.verse: Before the mountains were brought forthor the earth and the world came into existence,from everlasting to everlasting you are God.

3.verse: You turn men back to dust,saying, “Return, you children of men.”

4.verse: For to you a thousand yearsare like a yesterday that has passedor one of the watches of the night.

5.verse: You snatch them away like a dream;they are like the grass of the field,

6.verse: which at dawn flourishes and is greenbut by nightfall is withered and dry.

7.verse: We have been brought low by your angerand overwhelmed with terror by your wrath.

8.verse: You have not forgotten our iniquities;our secret sins are clearly visible in your sight.

9.verse: All our days pass away under your wrath;our years are consumed like a sigh.

10.verse: The span of our life numbers seventy years,or perhaps eighty, if we have enough strength.Most of them are marked by toil and emptiness;they pass swiftly, and then we fly away.

11.verse: Who understands the might of your angerand rightly fears the power of your wrath?

12.verse: Teach us to comprehend how few our days areso that our hearts may be filled with wisdom.

13.verse: Return, O Lord. How long must we wait?Show compassion to your servants.

14.verse: Fill us with your kindness in the morningso that we may exult and be glad all our days.

15.verse: Grant us joy for as many days as you have afflicted usand for as many years as we have known misfortune.

16.verse: Manifest your works to your servantsand your glory to their children.

17.verse: May the favor of the Lord, our God, rest upon us.And may the work of our hands prosper—indeed, may the work of our hands prosper.

1.verse: Psalm 91 -Security under God’s Protection -You who abide in the shelter of the Most High,who rest in the shadow of the Almighty,

2.verse: say to the Lord, “You are my refuge and my fortress,my God in whom I place my trust.”

3.verse: He will rescue you from the snare of the fowlerand from virulent pestilence.

4.verse: With his feathers he will shelter you,and you will take refuge under his wings;his faithfulness serves as a protective shield.

5.verse: You will not fear the terror by nightnor the arrow that flies by day,

6.verse: nor the pestilence that stalks in darkness,nor the plague that lays waste at midday.

7.verse: Even though a thousand may fall at your side,ten thousand at your right hand,such evils will not afflict you.

8.verse: Rather, your own eyes will beholdthe punishment inflicted on the wicked.

9.verse: You have made the Lord your refugeand chosen the Most High to be your dwelling.

10.verse: Therefore, no evil will threaten you,no calamity will come near your dwelling.

11.verse: For he will command his angels about you—to guard you wherever you go.

12.verse: They will lift you up with their hands,lest you dash your foot against a stone.

13.verse: You will tread upon the asp and the viper;you will trample the lion and the dragon.

14.verse: “Because he loves me, I will deliver him,I will raise high the one who acknowledges my name.

15.verse: When he calls to me, I will answer,and I will be with him in time of distress;I will rescue him and cause him to be honored.

16.verse: I will reward him with a long lifeand show him my salvation.”

1.verse: Psalm 92 -Praise of God’s Just Rule -A psalm. A song. For the Sabbath.

2.verse: It is good to give thanks to the Lord,to sing praise to your name, O Most High,

3.verse: to proclaim your kindness in the morningand your faithfulness during the night,

4.verse: with the ten-stringed harp,to the melody of the lyre.

5.verse: Your deeds, O Lord, have caused me to exult;at the works of your hands I shout for joy:

6.verse: How great are your deeds, O Lord!How profound are your thoughts!

7.verse: A senseless person cannot grasp this;a fool is unable to comprehend it.

8.verse: Even though the wicked may sprout like grassand all evildoers may prosper,they are doomed to eternal destruction,

9.verse: whereas you, O Lord, are exalted forever.

10.verse: Surely your enemies, O Lord,surely your enemies will perish,and all evildoers will be scattered.

11.verse: You have given me the strength of a wild bulland anointed me with fresh oil.

12.verse: My eyes have witnessed the downfall of my enemies;my ears have heard the rout of my wicked foes.

13.verse: The righteous will flourish like the palm tree;they will grow like a cedar of Lebanon.

14.verse: They are planted in the house of the Lordand will flourish in the courts of our God.

15.verse: They still will bear fruit, in their old age,and they will remain fresh and green,

1.verse: Psalm 93 -Glory of the Lord’s Kingdom -The Lord is King, adorned in splendor;the Lord has clothed and girded himself with strength.He has made the world firm,never to be moved.

2.verse: Your throne has stood firm from the beginning;you have existed throughout eternity, O Lord.

3.verse: The waters have lifted up, O Lord;the waters have lifted up their voice;the waters have lifted up their roar.

4.verse: More powerful than the roar of mighty waters,more powerful than the crashing waves of the sea,mighty on high is the Lord.

5.verse: Your decrees are firmly established;holiness adorns your house,O Lord, throughout the ages.

1.verse: Psalm 94 -God, Judge, and Avenger -O Lord, you are an avenging God;shine forth, O God of vengeance.

2.verse: Rise up, O judge of the earth;repay the arrogant as they deserve.

3.verse: O Lord, how long will the wicked,how long will the wicked be triumphant?

4.verse: Their mouths pour forth their arrogant wordsas these evildoers never cease to boast.

5.verse: They crush your people, O Lord,and they oppress your heritage.

6.verse: They slay the widow and the foreignerand put the orphan to death.

7.verse: They say, “The Lord does not see;the God of Jacob pays no attention.”

8.verse: Try to comprehend, you senseless people.You fools, when will you gain some wisdom?

9.verse: Does the one who made the ear not hear?Does the one who fashioned the eye not see?

10.verse: Does the one who guides the nations not punish?Does the one who instructs people lack knowledge?

11.verse: The Lord is well aware of our thoughtsand how foolish they are.

12.verse: Blessed is the man you admonish, O Lord,the man you teach by means of your law,

13.verse: giving him respite in times of misfortuneuntil a pit is dug for the wicked.

14.verse: For the Lord will not abandon his peopleor forsake his heritage.

15.verse: Judgment will again be based on righteousness,and all the upright in heart will uphold it.

16.verse: Who will stand up for me against the wicked?Who will defend me against evildoers?

17.verse: If the Lord had not come to my aid,I would long ago have been consigned to the kingdom of silence.

18.verse: When I realized that my foot was slipping,your kindness, O Lord, raised me up.

19.verse: When my anxious thoughts multiplied,your comfort filled my soul with joy.

20.verse: Can evil rulers have you as an ally,those who make use of the law to oppress the helpless?

21.verse: They conspire against the righteousand condemn the innocent to death.

22.verse: But the Lord has been my stronghold,my God, the rock in whom I find refuge.

23.verse: He will repay the wicked for their iniquityand destroy them for their evil deeds;the Lord, our God, will destroy them.

1.verse: Psalm 95 -A Call To Praise and Obey God -Come, let us sing with jubilation to the Lord;let us cry out to the Rock of our salvation.

2.verse: Let us come before him with thanksgivingand extol him with our songs.

3.verse: For the Lord is the great God,the King who surpasses all other gods.

4.verse: In his hands are the depths of the earth,and the peaks of the mountains are his.

5.verse: To him belongs the sea, for he created it,and also the dry land that his hands have molded.

6.verse: Come forth! Let us bow down to worship him;let us kneel before the Lord, our Maker.

7.verse: For he is our God,and we are the people he shepherds,the flock he protects.If only you would listen to his voice today:

8.verse: “Harden not your hearts as you did at Meribah,as on the day of Massah in the wilderness.

9.verse: It was there that your ancestors sought to tempt me;they put me to the testeven though they had witnessed my works.

10.verse: “For forty years I loathed that generation;I said, ‘They are a people whose hearts go astray,and they do not know my ways.’

11.verse: Therefore, in my anger I swore,‘They will never enter my rest.’ ”

1.verse: Psalm 96 -God, Sovereign and Judge of the Universe -Sing to the Lord a new song;sing to the Lord, all the earth.

2.verse: Sing to the Lord and bless his name;proclaim his salvation day after day.

3.verse: Declare his glory among the nations,his wondrous deeds to every people.

4.verse: For great is the Lord and worthy of all praise;he is more to be feared than all other gods.

5.verse: The gods of the nations are merely idols,but it was the Lord who made the heavens.

6.verse: Majesty and splendor surround him;power and beauty are in his sanctuary.

7.verse: Render to the Lord, you families of nations,render to the Lord glory and power.

8.verse: Render to the Lord the glory due to his name;bring an offering and enter his courts.

9.verse: Worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness;tremble before him, all the earth.

10.verse: Say among the nations, “The Lord is King.The world is firmly established, never to be moved.He will judge the peoples fairly.”

11.verse: Let the heavens exult and the earth be glad;let the sea resound and all that fills it.

12.verse: Let the fields rejoice and all that is in them;let all the trees of the forest shout for joy

13.verse: before the Lord, for he is coming,coming to judge the earth.He will judge the world with justiceand the nations with equity.

1.verse: Psalm 97 -Divine King and Universal Judge -The Lord is King; let the earth exult;let the distant isles rejoice.

2.verse: Clouds and darkness surround him;righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

3.verse: Fire precedes him,consuming his enemies on every side.

4.verse: His flashes of lightnwing illumine the world;the earth sees this and trembles.

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax before the Lord,before the Lord of all the earth.

6.verse: The heavens proclaim his righteousness,and all the nations behold his glory.

7.verse: All who worship images are put to shame,those who boast of their worthless idols;bow down before him, all you gods.

8.verse: Zion hears and rejoices,and the cities of Judah exultbecause of your judgments, O Lord.

9.verse: For you, O Lord, are the Most High over all the earth;you are exalted far above all gods.

10.verse: Let those who love the Lord hate evil,for he protects the souls of his faithful onesand rescues them from the hand of the wicked.

11.verse: Light dawns for the righteous,and joy for the upright in heart.
