12.verse: Rejoice in the Lord, you who are righteous,and give thanks to his holy name.

1.verse: Psalm 98 -Praise of the Lord, King and Judge -A psalm.Sing to the Lord a new song,for he has accomplished marvelous deeds.His right hand and his holy armhave made him victorious.

2.verse: The Lord has made known his salvation;he has manifested his righteousness for all the nations to see.

3.verse: He has remembered his kindness and his fidelityto the house of Israel.The farthest ends of the earth have witnessedthe salvation of our God.

4.verse: Sing joyfully to the Lord, all the earth;raise your voices in songs of praise.

5.verse: Sing praise to the Lord with the harp,with the harp and melodious singing.

6.verse: With trumpets and the sound of the hornsing joyfully to the King, the Lord.

7.verse: Let the sea resound and everything in it,the world and all its inhabitants.

8.verse: Let the rivers clap their handsand the mountains shout for joy.

9.verse: Let them sing before the Lord, who is coming,coming to judge the earth.He will judge the world with justiceand the nations with fairness.

1.verse: Psalm 99 -God, King of Justice and Holiness -The Lord is King;let the nations tremble.He sits enthroned on the cherubim;let the earth quake.

2.verse: The Lord is great in Zion;he is exalted above all the peoples.

3.verse: Let them praise your great and awesome name:holy is he!

4.verse: Mighty King, you love justice,and you have established fairness;in Jacob you have brought aboutwhat is just and right.

5.verse: Exalt the Lord, our God,and worship at his footstool;holy is he!

6.verse: Moses and Aaron were among his priests,and Samuel was among those who invoked his name;they cried out to the Lord,and he answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud;they obeyed his decrees and the law he gave them.

8.verse: O Lord, our God,you answered them;you were a forgiving God to them,but you punished their wrongdoings.

9.verse: Exalt the Lord, our God,and worship at his holy mountain,for the Lord, our God, is holy.

1.verse: Psalm 100 -Processional Entrance Hymn -A psalm of thanksgiving.Acclaim the Lord with joy, all the earth;

2.verse: serve the Lord with gladness;enter his presence with songs of joy.

3.verse: Proclaim that the Lord is God.He made us and we are his possession;we are his people, the flock he shepherds.

4.verse: Offer thanksgiving as you enter his gates,sing hymns of praise as you approach his courts;give thanks to him and bless his name,

5.verse: for the Lord is good.His kindness endures forever,and his faithfulness is constant to all generations.

1.verse: Psalm 101 -Norm of Life for a Good Ruler -A psalm of David.I will sing of kindness and justice;to you, O Lord, I will offer praise in song.

2.verse: I will walk in the path of blamelessness;when will you come to me?Within my house I will actwith integrity of heart.

3.verse: I will not allow any shameful actto be done before my eyes.I will refuse to associatewith people who do evil.

4.verse: Let the perverse of heart remain far from me;I will not tolerate the wicked.

5.verse: Anyone who secretly slanders a neighborI will reduce to silence.Anyone with haughty glances and an arrogant heartI cannot endure.

6.verse: The faithful in the land are the oneswhom I will choose to be my companions.Only the one who follows the path of integritywill be allowed to be my servant.

7.verse: No one who practices deceitwill be permitted to remain in my house.No one who utters lieswill be numbered among my companions.

8.verse: Morning after morning I will banishall the wicked from the land,removing all evildoers from the city of the Lord.

1.verse: Psalm 102 -Prayer of an Exile -The prayer of one afflicted. When he is wasting away and pours out his anguish before the Lord.

2.verse: O Lord, give heed to my prayer;let my plea for help reach you.

3.verse: Do not conceal your face from my sightin the time of my distress.Incline your ear to me;on the day when I call out to you, answer me speedily.

4.verse: For my days are fading away like smoke,and my bones are burning like live coals.

5.verse: My heart is stricken, withered like grass;I am too exhausted to eat my bread.

6.verse: As a result of my incessant groaning,I am now nothing more than skin and bones.

7.verse: I am like a pelican of the wilderness,like an owl among the ruins.

8.verse: I am sleepless and I moanlike a lone sparrow on a rooftop.

9.verse: All day long my enemies revile me;those who rage against me use my name as a curse.

10.verse: I eat ashes as though they were bread,and I mingle tears with my drink.

11.verse: Because of your indignation and wrath,you have raised me up only to cast me down.

12.verse: My days are like a lengthening shadow,and I am withering away like grass.

13.verse: But, you, O Lord, are enthroned forever,and your renown will endure for all generations.

14.verse: You will arise and show mercy to Zion,for it is time for you to have pity on her;the appointed time has come.

15.verse: For her stones are precious to your servants,and her dust causes them to weep.

16.verse: The nations will revere your name, O Lord,and all the kings of the earth will sing of your glory.

17.verse: For the Lord will rebuild Zionand reveal himself in all his glory.

18.verse: He will answer the prayer of the destitute,and he will not ignore their petition.

19.verse: Let this be written for future generationsso that a people yet unborn may praise the Lord:

20.verse: “The Lord looked down from his sanctuary on highand gazed on the earth from heaven,

21.verse: to hear the sighs of the prisonersand to set free those under sentence of death.”

22.verse: Then the name of the Lord will be proclaimed in Zion,and his praise in Jerusalem

23.verse: when all peoples and kingdoms come togetherto worship the Lord.

24.verse: He has taken away my strength on my life’s journey;he has cut short my days.

25.verse: So I said: “Do not carry me off, O my God,before half my days are done,for your years endure from age to age.

26.verse: “Long ago you laid the foundations of the earth,and the heavens are the work of your hands.

27.verse: They will pass away but you endure;they will all wear out like a garment.You will change them like clothing,and they will perish.

28.verse: “However, you remain always the same,and your years will have no end.

1.verse: Psalm 103 -Praise of God’s Providence -Of David.Bless the Lord, O my soul;my entire being, bless his holy name.

2.verse: Bless the Lord, O my soul,and do not forget all his benefits.

3.verse: He forgives all your sinsand heals all your diseases.

4.verse: He redeems your life from the pitand crowns you with kindness and mercy.

5.verse: He satisfies your years with good thingsand renews your youth like an eagle’s.

6.verse: The Lord performs acts of righteousnessand administers justice for all who are oppressed.

7.verse: He made known his ways to Moses,his wondrous deeds to the people of Israel.

8.verse: The Lord is merciful and gracious,slow to anger and abounding in kindness.

9.verse: He will not always rebuke,nor will he remain angry forever.

10.verse: He does not treat us as our sins deserveor repay us according to our offenses.

11.verse: As high as the heavens are above the earth,so great is his kindness toward those who fear him.

12.verse: As far as the east is from the west,so far has he removed our transgressions from us.

13.verse: As a father has compassion for his children,so the Lord has compassion for those who fear him.

14.verse: For he knows how we were formed;he remembers that we are only dust.

15.verse: The days of mortal man are like grass;he flourishes like a flower of the field.

16.verse: The wind sweeps over him, and he is gone,and his place never sees him again.

17.verse: But from everlasting to everlastingthe kindness of the Lord is with those who fear him,and his righteousness with their children’s children,

18.verse: with those who keep his covenantand diligently observe his commandments.

19.verse: The Lord has established his throne in heaven,and his kingdom rules over all.

20.verse: Bless the Lord, O you his angels,you mighty in strength who do his bidding,who obey his spoken word.

21.verse: Bless the Lord, O you his hosts,his ministers who do his will.

22.verse: Bless the Lord, all his works,everywhere in his domain.Bless the Lord, O my soul.

1.verse: Psalm 104 -Praise of God the Creator -Bless the Lord, O my soul.O Lord, my God, you are indeed very great.You are clothed in majesty and splendor,

2.verse: wrapped in light as in a robe.You have stretched out the heavens like a tent;

3.verse: you have established your palace upon the waters.You make the clouds serve as your chariot;you ride forth on the wings of the wind.

4.verse: You have appointed the winds as your messengersand flames of fire as your ministers.

5.verse: You established the earth on its foundationsso that it will remain unshaken forever.

6.verse: You covered it with the deep like a cloak;the waters rose above the mountains.

7.verse: At your rebuke the waters took to flight;at the sound of your thunder they fled in terror.

8.verse: They rose up to the mountainsand flowed down to the valleys,to the place that you had designated for them.

9.verse: You established a boundary that they were not to crossso that they would never again cover the earth.

10.verse: You made springs gush forth in the valleysand flow between the mountains.

11.verse: They supply water to every beast of the field,and from them the wild asses quench their thirst.

12.verse: On the banks the birds of the air build nestsand sing among the branches.

13.verse: From your dwelling you water the mountains,enriching the earth with the fruit of your labor.

14.verse: You provide grass for the cattle,and the plants for man to cultivate.You bring forth food from the earth

15.verse: and wine to gladden the heart of man,oil to make his face shineand bread to strengthen his body.

16.verse: The trees of the Lord have fruit in abundance,the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.

17.verse: In them the birds build their nests;in the fir trees the stork makes its home.

18.verse: The high mountains are inhabited by the wild goats;in the rocky crags the badgers find refuge.

19.verse: You created the moon that marks the seasonsand the sun that knows its time for setting.

20.verse: You bring on darkness, and it is night,when all the beasts of the forests go on the prowl.

21.verse: The young lions roar for their prey,seeking their food from God.

22.verse: When the sun rises, they steal awayand return to their lairs to rest.

23.verse: People go forth to their workand to their labor until darkness descends.

24.verse: How countless are your works, O Lord;by your wisdom you have made them all;the earth abounds with your creatures.

25.verse: There is the sea, vast and broad,filled with numberless species,living creatures both great and small.

26.verse: There the ships sail forth,and the Leviathan that you formed to play therein.

27.verse: All of them look to youto give them their food at the appropriate time.

28.verse: When you provide it for them,they gather it up;when you open your hand,they are filled with good things.

29.verse: When you turn away your face,they are dismayed;when you take away their breath,they die and return to the dust.

30.verse: When you send forth your Spirit,they are created,and you renew the face of the earth.

31.verse: May the glory of the Lord abide forever,and may the Lord rejoice in his works.

32.verse: When he looks at the earth, it quakes;when he touches the mountains, they smoke.

33.verse: I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;I will sing praise to my God while I have life.

34.verse: May my meditation be pleasing to him,for I find my joy in the Lord.

35.verse: May sinners be banished from the earth,and may the wicked no longer exist.Bless the Lord, O my soul.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 105 -God’s Faithfulness to the Covenant -Give thanks to the Lord, invoke his name;proclaim his deeds among the peoples.

2.verse: Offer him honor with songs of praise;recount all his marvelous deeds.

3.verse: Glory in his holy name;let the hearts of those who seek the Lord exult.

4.verse: Reflect on the Lord and his strength;seek his face continually.

5.verse: Remember the marvels he has wrought,his portents, and the judgments he has set forth.

6.verse: You are the offspring of his servant Abraham,the children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

7.verse: He is the Lord, our God;his judgments prevail all over the earth.

8.verse: He is mindful of his covenant forever,the promise he laid down for a thousand generations,

9.verse: the covenant he made with Abrahamand the oath he swore to Isaac.

10.verse: He established it as a decree for Jacob,and as an everlasting covenant for Israel,

11.verse: saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaanas the portion of your heritage.”

12.verse: When they were few in number,an insignificant group of strangers in it,

13.verse: they wandered from nation to nation,from one kingdom to another.

14.verse: He permitted no one to oppress them,and in their regard he warned kings:

15.verse: “Do not touch my anointed ones;do no harm to my prophets.”

16.verse: Then he invoked a famine on the landand destroyed their supply of bread.

17.verse: But he had sent a man ahead of them,Joseph, who had been sold as a slave.

18.verse: They shackled his feet with fettersand clamped an iron collar around his neck,

19.verse: until what he had prophesied was fulfilledand the word of the Lord proved him true.

20.verse: The king ordered that he be released;the ruler of the peoples set him free.

21.verse: He appointed him as master of his householdand as ruler of all his possessions.

22.verse: He was to instruct his princes as he deemed fitand to impart wisdom to his elders.

23.verse: Then Israel went down into Egypt;Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.

24.verse: God greatly increased the number of his peopleand made them too strong for their foes,

25.verse: whose hearts he then turned to hate his peopleand to conspire against his servants.

26.verse: He sent his servant Moses,and Aaron whom he had chosen.

27.verse: They performed his signs among themand worked wonders in the land of Ham.

28.verse: He sent darkness that enveloped the land,but they rebelled against his warnings.

29.verse: He turned their waters into blood,and all their fish were destroyed.

30.verse: Their land was saturated with frogs,even in the royal chambers.

31.verse: At his command there came hordes of fliesand gnats throughout their country.

32.verse: He sent them hail instead of rain,and flashes of lightning in all their land.

33.verse: He struck down their vines and their fig treesand demolished the trees of their country.

34.verse: At his word the locusts came,as well as grasshoppers beyond all count.

35.verse: They gobbled up every green plant in the landand devoured the produce of the soil.

36.verse: He struck down all the firstborn of the land,the firstfruits of their manhood.

37.verse: Then he led out his people with silver and gold,and there was not one among their tribes who stumbled.

38.verse: Egypt was glad when they departed,for dread of Israel had overwhelmed them.

39.verse: He spread a cloud over his people as a coverand a fire to give light by night.

40.verse: At their request he supplied them with quail,and he filled them with bread from heaven.

41.verse: He split open a rock and water gushed forth,flowing through the wilderness like a river.

42.verse: For he remembered the sacred promisethat he had made to Abraham, his servant.

43.verse: He led forth his people with rejoicing,his chosen ones with exultation.

44.verse: He gave them the lands of the nations,and they inherited the fruit of other people’s toil,

45.verse: so that they might keep his decreesand observe his laws.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 106 -Israel’s Confession of Sin and God’s Mercy -Alleluia.Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;his kindness endures forever.

2.verse: Who can possibly recount the mighty acts of the Lordand fully proclaim his praise?

3.verse: Blessed are those who do what is rightand practice justice constantly.

4.verse: Remember me, O Lord, out of the love you have for your people;come to me with your salvation.

5.verse: Let me delight in the success of your chosen ones,share in the joy of your nation,and glory in your heritage.

6.verse: Like our ancestors, we have sinned;we have gone astray and done evil.

7.verse: When our ancestors were in Egypt,they failed to be mindful of your wonders;they did not remember your many kindnessesand rebelled against the Most High at the Red Sea.

8.verse: Yet he saved them for his name’s sakeso that he might make known his mighty power.

9.verse: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up;he led them through the depths as through a wilderness.

10.verse: He saved them from those who hated them;from the hand of the enemy he delivered them.

11.verse: The waters closed over their adversaries;not a single one of them survived.

12.verse: Then they believed his wordsand sang his praises.

13.verse: But they soon forgot what he had doneand had no confidence in his plan.

14.verse: In the wilderness they yielded to their cravings;in the wasteland they put God to the test.

15.verse: He gave them everything they wantedbut struck them with a consuming disease.

16.verse: In the camp they grew envious of Mosesand of Aaron, who was consecrated to the Lord.

17.verse: The earth parted and swallowed Dathanand closed over the company of Abiram.

18.verse: Fire blazed all through them,and the wicked were consumed in flames.

19.verse: They constructed a calf at Horeband worshiped this molten image.

20.verse: They exchanged their Gloryfor an image of a bull that eats grass.

21.verse: They forgot the God who had saved them,who had done great things in Egypt,

22.verse: wonders in the land of Ham,and awesome deeds at the Red Sea.

23.verse: He was contemplating their destruction,but Moses, his chosen one,stood in the breach before himto keep his wrath from destroying them.

24.verse: Then they derided the land of delights,for they had no faith in his word.

25.verse: They grumbled in their tentsand refused to obey the voice of the Lord.

26.verse: Therefore, he swore with uplifted handto strike them down in the wilderness

27.verse: and disperse their descendants among the nations,scattering them in foreign lands.

28.verse: They joined in worshiping Baal of Peorand ate food sacrificed to lifeless gods.

29.verse: They provoked the Lord to anger by their evil deeds,and a plague broke out among them.

30.verse: Then Phinehas stood up and executed judgment,and the plague came to an end.

31.verse: This was credited to him as righteousnessfor all the generations to come.

32.verse: At the waters of Meribah they angered the Lord,and Moses endured difficulties because of them.

33.verse: For they rebelled against the Spirit of God,and rash words issued from Moses’ lips.

34.verse: They did not exterminate the peoplesas the Lord had commanded them to do.

35.verse: Rather, they mingled with the nationsand adopted their practices.

36.verse: They worshiped their idols,which became a snare to them.

37.verse: They sacrificed to false godstheir sons and their daughters.

38.verse: They shed innocent blood,the blood of their sons and daughters,whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,polluting the land with their blood.

39.verse: Thus, they defiled themselves by their actionsand prostituted themselves by their conduct.

40.verse: Then the anger of the Lord flared up against his people,and he abhorred his own heritage.

41.verse: He handed them over to the nations,and their foes became their rulers.

42.verse: Their enemies oppressed themand kept them in subjection to their power.

43.verse: Time and again he came to their rescue,but they rebelled against his counseland sank low because of their sin.

44.verse: Even so, he took pity on their distresswhen he heard their cries.

45.verse: He called to mind his covenant with them,and he relented because of his great mercy.

46.verse: He aroused compassion for themon the part of all their captors.

47.verse: Save us, O Lord, our God,and gather us from among the nations,so that we may give thanks to your holy nameand glory in praising you.

48.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,from everlasting to everlasting.Let all the people say, “Amen.”Alleluia.

1.verse: Book V—Psalms 107–150 -Psalm 107 -God, Savior of Those in Distress -“Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;his kindness endures forever.”

2.verse: Let this be the prayer of the redeemed of the Lord,those he redeemed from the hand of the foe

3.verse: and gathered together from the lands,from east and west, north and south.

4.verse: Some wandered in a barren wilderness,unable to discover a path to an inhabited city.

5.verse: They were hungry and thirsty,and their life was wasting away.

6.verse: Then they cried out to the Lord in their anguish,and he saved them from their distress.

7.verse: He led them by a direct routeto a city in which they could dwell.

8.verse: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his kindnessand for the wonders he does for people.

9.verse: He has satisfied the thirstyand filled the hungry with good things.

10.verse: Some sat in darkness and the shadow of death,bound in misery and in chains,

11.verse: because they had rebelled against the words of Godand spurned the plan of the Most High.

12.verse: He humbled their hearts with hard labor;when they stumbled, no one was there to offer help.

13.verse: Then they cried out to the Lord in their need,and he rescued them from their distress.

14.verse: He brought them forth from darkness and the shadow of deathand tore their chains to pieces.

15.verse: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his kindnessand for the wonders he does for people.

16.verse: He has broken down gates of bronzeand cut through iron bars.

17.verse: Some were made foolish by their wicked waysand were afflicted because of their iniquities.

18.verse: All types of food became loathsome to them,and they were nearing the gates of death.

19.verse: Then they cried out to the Lord in their anguish,and he rescued them from their distress.

20.verse: He sent forth his word and healed them,saving them from the grave.

21.verse: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his kindnessand for the wonders he does for people.

22.verse: Let them offer sacrifices in thanksgivingand recount his deeds with jubilation.

23.verse: Some went down to the sea in shipsand engaged in commerce on the mighty waters.

24.verse: They beheld the works of the Lordand his wonders in the deep.

25.verse: He spoke and raised up a storm windthat stirred up the waves of the sea.

26.verse: They were lifted up to the heavens, then cast down to the depths;their courage melted away in their plight.

27.verse: They reeled and staggered like drunkards,and they were at their wits’ end.

28.verse: They cried out to the Lord in their anguish,and he delivered them from their distress.

29.verse: He reduced the storm to a whisper,and the waves of the sea were hushed.

30.verse: They rejoiced because of the calm,and he guided them to the port they sought.

31.verse: Let them give thanks to the Lord for his kindnessand for the wonders he does for people.

32.verse: Let them exalt him in the assembly of the peopleand praise him in the council of the elders.

33.verse: He turns rivers into wasteland,springs of water into parched ground,

34.verse: and fertile land into a salt waste,because of the wickedness of those who live there.

35.verse: He turns the wasteland into pools of waterand the parched ground into bubbling springs.

36.verse: There he provides the hungry with a home,and they build a city where they can settle.

37.verse: They sow fields and plant vineyardsthat yield crops for the harvest.

38.verse: He blesses them and they greatly increase in number,and he does not let their cattle decrease.

39.verse: Eventually their numbers diminish and they are humbledbecause of oppression, adversity, and affliction;

40.verse: he who pours forth his contempt on princesmakes them wander in trackless wastes,

41.verse: while he raises the needy from their miseryand increases their families like flocks.

42.verse: The upright see and exult,while the wicked are reduced to silence.

43.verse: Let whoever is wise reflect on these thingsand understand the merciful love of the Lord.

1.verse: Psalm 108 -Prayer for Divine Assistance against Enemies -A song. A psalm of David.

2.verse: My heart is steadfast, O God,my heart is steadfast.I will sing and chant your praise;awake, my soul!

3.verse: Awake, lyre and harp!I will awaken the dawn.

4.verse: I will give thanks to you among the peoples, O Lord;I will sing your praises among the nations.

5.verse: For your kindness extends above the heavens;your faithfulness, to the skies.

6.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens,and let your glory shine over all the earth.

7.verse: With your right hand come to our aidso that those you love may be delivered.

8.verse: God has promised from his sanctuary,“In triumph I will apportion Shechemand measure out the Valley of Succoth.

9.verse: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;Ephraim is my helmet,Judah is my scepter.

10.verse: Moab is my washbasin;upon Edom I will plant my sandal;over Philistia I will shout in triumph.”

11.verse: Who will lead me into the fortified city?Who will guide me into Edom?

12.verse: Is it not you, O God, who have rejected usand no longer go forth with our armies?

13.verse: Grant us your help against our enemies,for any human assistance is worthless.

1.verse: Psalm 109 -Prayer for One Falsely Accused -For the director. A psalm of David.O God, whom I praise,do not remain silent.

2.verse: Wicked and deceitful menhave opened their mouths against me;they have spoken against me with lying tongues.

3.verse: They confront me with words of hatredand assail me without cause.

4.verse: In return for my love they denounce meeven as I offer up prayers for them.

5.verse: They give me back evil in exchange for goodand hatred in place of my love.

6.verse: They say:“Choose a wicked man to oppose him,an accuser to stand on his right.

7.verse: At his judgment, let him be found guilty,with even his prayers deemed sinful.

8.verse: “May his remaining days be few,with someone else appointed to take his office.

9.verse: May his children become fatherlessand his wife become widowed.

10.verse: “May his children be vagrants and beggars,driven from the ruins they use for shelter.

11.verse: May the creditor seize all he has,and strangers abscond with his life savings.

12.verse: “May no one extend mercy to himor take pity on his fatherless children.

13.verse: May his posterity be doomed to extinctionand his name be blotted out within a generation.

14.verse: “May the iniquity of his ancestors be remembered by the Lord,and the sin of his mother never be wiped out.

15.verse: May their guilt be continually before the Lord,and may he banish all remembrance of them from the earth.

16.verse: “For he never thought of showing mercy;rather, he hounded to deaththe poor and the needy and the brokenhearted.

17.verse: He loved to level curses at others;may they recoil on him.He took no pleasure in blessing;may no blessing be his.

18.verse: “He clothed himself with cursing as his garment;it seeped into his body like waterand into his bones like oil.

19.verse: May it be like the robe that envelops him,like the belt that encircles him every day.”

20.verse: May these evils my accusers wish for mebe inflicted upon them by the Lord.

21.verse: But you, O Lord, my God,treat me kindly for your name’s sake;deliver me because of your overwhelming kindness.

22.verse: For I am poor and needy,and my heart is pierced within me.

23.verse: I am fading away like an evening shadow;I am shaken off like a locust.

24.verse: My knees are weak from fasting;my flesh is wasting away.

25.verse: I have become an object of ridicule to my accusers;upon seeing me, they toss their heads.

26.verse: Come to my aid, O Lord, my God;save me because of your kindness.

27.verse: Let them know that your hand has done this,that you, O Lord, have accomplished it.

28.verse: When they curse, you will bless;when they attack, they will be put to shame,and your servant will rejoice.

29.verse: My accusers will be clothed in disgrace,wrapped in their shame as in a cloak.

30.verse: I will thank the Lord with my lips,and before all the people I will praise him.

31.verse: For he stands at the right hand of the poorto save him from his accusers who pass judgment on him.

1.verse: Psalm 110 -The Messiah—King, Prophet, and Conqueror -A psalm of David.The Lord says to my Lord:“Sit at my right handuntil I have made your enemies a footstool for you.”

2.verse: The Lord will stretch forth from Zionyour scepter of power.The Lord says:“Rule in the midst of your enemies!

3.verse: Yours is royal dignity in the day of your birth;in holy splendor, before the daystar,like the dew, I have begotten you.”

4.verse: The Lord has sworn,and he will not retract his oath:“You are a priest foreveraccording to the order of Melchizedek.”

5.verse: The Lord stands forth at your right hand;he will crush kings on the day of his wrath.

6.verse: He will judge the nations,filling their land with corpsesand crushing rulers throughout the earth.

7.verse: He will drink from the stream on his journey,and then he will lift up his head in triumph.

1.verse: Psalm 111 -Praise of God for His Wondrous Works -Alleluia.I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heartin the council of the upright and in the assembly.

2.verse: Great are the works of the Lord;they are pondered by all who delight in them.

3.verse: His deeds show forth majesty and splendor,and his righteousness endures forever.

4.verse: He has won renown for his wonders;gracious and compassionate is the Lord.

5.verse: He provides food for those who fear him,and is forever mindful of his covenant.

6.verse: He has manifested the power of his works to his peopleby giving them the lands of the nations.

7.verse: The works of his hands are faithful and right,and all his commandments are trustworthy.

8.verse: They are established forever and everto be observed in fidelity and truthfulness.

9.verse: He has granted deliverance to his peopleand established his covenant forever;holy and awe-inspiring is his name.

10.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom;those who are guided by it will grow in understanding.His praise will last forever.

1.verse: Psalm 112 -The Blessings of the Righteous -Alleluia.Blessed is the man who fears the Lord,who greatly delights in his precepts.

2.verse: His descendants will be powerful upon the earth;the generation of the upright will be blessed.

3.verse: His house will be filled with wealth and riches,and his righteousness will endure forever.

4.verse: He shines as a light for the upright in the darkness;kindness, mercy, and justice are his hallmarks.

5.verse: The future bodes well for himwho is generous in helping those in needand who conducts his affairs with justice.

6.verse: He will never be swayed;the righteous man will be remembered forever.

7.verse: He has no fear of bad news,for his heart remains steadfast, trusting in the Lord.

8.verse: Since his heart is tranquil, he will not be afraid,and he will witness the downfall of his enemies.

9.verse: He bestows gifts lavishly on the poor;his righteousness will endure forever,and his horn will be exalted in glory.

10.verse: The wicked will be furious when he sees this,gnashing his teeth and pining away;the desires of the wicked will be fruitless.

1.verse: The Egyptian Hallel—Pss 113–118 -Psalm 113 -Praise of the Lord for His Care of the Lowly -Alleluia.Praise, you servants of the Lord,praise the name of the Lord.

2.verse: Blessed be the name of the Lordnow and forevermore.

3.verse: From the rising of the sun to its settingthe name of the Lord is to be praised.

4.verse: High is the Lord over all the nations,and supreme over the heavens is his glory.

5.verse: Who is like the Lord, our God,the one who is enthroned on highand who stoops down to look

6.verse: on the heavens and the earth?

7.verse: He raises the poor from the dustand lifts the needy from the rubbish heap,

8.verse: seating them with princes,with the princes of his people.

9.verse: He settles the barren woman in a homeand makes her the joyful mother of children.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 114 -The Lord’s Wonders at the Exodus -When Israel came out of Egypt,the house of Jacob from a people of alien tongue,

2.verse: Judah became God’s sanctuaryand Israel his domain.

3.verse: The sea fled at the sight;the Jordan turned back.

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams,the hills like lambs of the flock.

5.verse: What causes you to flee, O sea?Why, O Jordan, do you turn back?

6.verse: Why do you skip like rams, O mountains,and like lambs of the flock, O hills?

7.verse: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,at the presence of the God of Jacob,

8.verse: who turns the rock into a pool of water,and flint into a flowing spring.

1.verse: Psalm 115 -Hymn to the Lord, the One God -Not to us, O Lord, not to us,but to your name give glorybecause of your kindness and faithfulness.

2.verse: Why should the nations ask,“Where is their God?”

3.verse: Our God is in heaven;he does whatever he pleases.

4.verse: Their idols are merely silver and gold,the work of human hands.

5.verse: They have mouths but they cannot speak;they have eyes but they cannot see.

6.verse: They have ears but they cannot hear;they have noses but they cannot smell.

7.verse: They have hands but they cannot feel;they have feet but they cannot walk;their throats can emit no sound.

8.verse: Those who make them end up like them,as do all who place their trust in them.

9.verse: The house of Israel trusts in the Lord;he is their help and their shield.

10.verse: The house of Aaron trusts in the Lord;he is their help and their shield.

11.verse: Those who fear the Lord trust in the Lord;he is their help and their shield.

12.verse: The Lord will be mindful of us and bless us;he will bless the house of Israel;he will bless the house of Aaron.

13.verse: He will bless those who fear the Lord,the small no less than the great.

14.verse: May the Lord cause you to increase,both you and your children.

15.verse: May you be blessed by the Lord,the Maker of heaven and earth.

16.verse: The heavens belong to the Lord,but he has given the earth to humanity.

17.verse: It is not the dead who praise the Lord,those who sink into silence.

18.verse: It is we who bless the Lordfrom this time forward and forevermore.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 116 -Thanksgiving to God for Help Received -I love the Lord because he has heard my voiceand listened to my cry for mercy,

2.verse: because he has inclined his ear to meon the day when I called out to him.

3.verse: The bonds of death encompassed me;the snares of the netherworld held me tightly.I was seized by distress and sorrow.

4.verse: Then I cried out in the name of the Lord:“O Lord, I entreat you to preserve my life.”

5.verse: Gracious is the Lord and righteous;our God is merciful.

6.verse: The Lord watches over his little ones;when I was brought low, he saved me.

7.verse: Be at peace once again, O my soul,for the Lord has shown mercy to you.

8.verse: He has delivered my soul from death,my eyes from tears,and my feet from stumbling.

9.verse: I will walk in the presence of the Lordin the land of the living.

10.verse: I believed; therefore, I said,“I am greatly afflicted.”

11.verse: In my dismay I cried out,“All men are liars.”

12.verse: How can I repay the Lordfor all the good he has done for me?

13.verse: I will lift up the cup of salvationand call on the name of the Lord.

14.verse: I will fulfill my vows to the Lordin the presence of his people.

15.verse: Precious in the eyes of the Lordis the death of his faithful ones.

16.verse: O Lord, I am your servant.I am your servant, the child of your handmaid;you have loosed my bonds.

17.verse: I will offer you a sacrifice of thanksgivingand call on the name of the Lord.

18.verse: I will fulfill my vows to the Lordin the presence of all his people,

19.verse: in the courts of the house of the Lord,in your midst, O Jerusalem.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 117 -Universal Praise of God -Glorify the Lord, all you nations;praise him, all you peoples.

2.verse: For his kindness toward us is constant,and the faithfulness of the Lord will endure forever.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 118 -Thanksgiving for Salvation -Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;his kindness endures forever.

2.verse: Let Israel say,“His kindness endures forever.”

3.verse: Let the house of Aaron say,“His kindness endures forever.”

4.verse: Let those who fear the Lord say,“His kindness endures forever.”

5.verse: In my distress I called out to the Lord;he answered by setting me free.

6.verse: With the Lord to protect me I am not afraid.What can mortals do to me?

7.verse: The Lord is at my side to offer me help;I will look down upon my enemies.

8.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lordthan to place your trust in mortals.

9.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lordthan to place your trust in princes.

10.verse: All the nations surrounded me;in the name of the Lord I overcame them.

11.verse: They surrounded me on every side;in the name of the Lord I overcame them.

12.verse: They swarmed around me like bees;they blazed like a fire in the midst of thorns;in the name of the Lord I overcame them.

13.verse: I was hard pressed and close to falling,but the Lord came to my aid.

14.verse: The Lord is my strength and my song,and he has become my salvation.

15.verse: Joyful shouts of triumphring out in the tents of the righteous:“The right hand of the Lord has done wondrous deeds;

16.verse: the right hand of the Lord is exalted;the right hand of the Lord has done wondrous deeds.”

17.verse: I shall not die; rather I shall liveand recount the works of the Lord.

18.verse: Even though the Lord punished me harshly,he did not hand me over to death.

19.verse: Open to me the gates of righteousnessso that I may enter them and praise the Lord.

20.verse: This is the gate of the Lordthrough which the righteous enter.

21.verse: I thank you for having answered me;you have become my salvation.

22.verse: The stone that the builders rejectedhas become the cornerstone.

23.verse: This is the Lord’s doing,and it is marvelous in our eyes.

24.verse: This is the day that the Lord has made;let us exult and rejoice in it.

25.verse: O Lord, grant us salvation.O Lord, grant us success.

26.verse: Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.We bless you from the house of the Lord.

27.verse: The Lord is God,and he has given us light.Holding leafy branches, join in the festal processionup to the horns of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I will offer thanks to you;you are my God, and I will extol you.

29.verse: Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;his kindness endures forever.Psalm 119 -Praise of God’s Law -Aleph

1.verse: Blessed are those whose way is blameless,who walk in accord with the law of the Lord.

2.verse: Blessed are those who observe his statutesand seek him with their whole heart.

3.verse: They do nothing wrong;they walk in his ways.

4.verse: You have ordainedthat your commands be diligently observed.

5.verse: May my ways be steadfastin the observance of your decrees.

6.verse: Then I will never be put to shamewhen I take note of all your precepts.

7.verse: I will praise you in sincerity of heartas I ponder your righteous judgments.

8.verse: I will observe your decrees;do not forsake me completely.Beth

9.verse: How can a young man lead a spotless life?By living according to your word.

10.verse: I seek you with all my heart;do not let me stray from your precepts.

11.verse: I treasure your word in my heartfor fear that I may sin against you.

12.verse: Blessed are you, O Lord;teach me your decrees.

13.verse: With my lips I reciteall the judgments you have announced.

14.verse: I rejoice in following your statutesmore than I would rejoice in endless riches.

15.verse: I will meditate on your commandsand respect your ways.

16.verse: I find my delight in your decrees;I will never forget your word.Gimel

17.verse: Be good to your servantso that I may live and keep your word.

18.verse: Open my eyes so that I may clearly seethe wonders to be found in your law.

19.verse: I am only a wayfarer on earth,but do not hide your precepts from me.

20.verse: My soul is ever consumedwith longing for your judgments.

21.verse: You rebuke the arrogant, the accursed,who stray from your precepts.

22.verse: Set me free from scorn and contempt,for I have observed your statutes.

23.verse: Even though princes assemble and slander me,your servant meditates on your decrees.

24.verse: Your statutes are my delight,for they offer me counsel.Daleth

25.verse: My soul lies prostrate in the dust;revive me in accordance with your word.

26.verse: I proclaim my ways and you answer me;teach me your decrees.

27.verse: Help me to understand the way of your commandments,and I will meditate on your wonders.

28.verse: My soul is wasting away in sorrow;renew my strength in accordance with your word.

29.verse: Keep me from the way of falsehood,and let me live according to your law.

30.verse: I have chosen the way of faithfulness;I have set your judgments before me.

31.verse: I cling to your statutes, O Lord;do not allow me to be put to shame.

32.verse: I run in the way of your precepts,for you have set my heart free.He

33.verse: Teach me, O Lord, the way of your decrees,and I will follow it to the end.

34.verse: Give me understanding, and I will observe your lawand obey it with all my heart.

35.verse: Guide me in the way of your precepts,for in them is my delight.

36.verse: Dispose my heart to follow your statutesand to flee selfish gain.

37.verse: Turn my eyes away from what is unimportant,and let me live in your way.

38.verse: Fulfill your word to your servant,so that you may be feared.

39.verse: Let me escape the disgrace that I dread,for your judgments are good.

40.verse: See, I long for your commandments;in your righteousness preserve my life.Waw

41.verse: Let your kindness descend on me, O Lord,your salvation in accord with your promise.

42.verse: Then I will respond to those who insult me,because I trust in your word.

43.verse: Do not remove from my mouth the word of truth,for I place my hope in your judgment.

44.verse: I will keep your law continually,forever and ever.

45.verse: I will walk in complete freedombecause I have sought your commands.

46.verse: I will speak of your statutes in the presence of kingsand will not be ashamed.

47.verse: Your precepts fill me with delightbecause I love them.

48.verse: I lift up my hands to your precepts, which I love,and I meditate on your decrees.Zayin

49.verse: Remember the word you gave to your servantby which you have given me hope.

50.verse: This is my consolation in my distress:your word gives me life.

51.verse: The arrogant overwhelm me with scorn,but I refuse to turn away from your law.

52.verse: I recall your judgments of old, O Lord,and I am greatly comforted.

53.verse: I am filled with fury against the wicked,those who forsake your law.

54.verse: Your decrees have become my songswherever I make my dwelling.

55.verse: Even during the night I remember your nameand observe your teaching, O Lord.

56.verse: This is my practice:I obey your commandments.Heth

57.verse: My portion, I have said, O Lord,is to observe your words.

58.verse: With all my heart I seek your favor;fulfill your word and be gracious to me.

59.verse: I have reflected on my waysand resolved to follow your statutes.

60.verse: I will make haste and not delayto observe your precepts.

61.verse: Though the nets of the wicked entrap me,I do not forget your law.

62.verse: At midnight I rise to offer praise to youfor the righteousness of your judgments.

63.verse: I am a friend to all who fear you,all who observe your commands.

64.verse: The earth overflows with your kindness, O Lord;teach me your decrees.Teth

65.verse: You have dealt kindly with your servantin accord with your word, O Lord.

66.verse: Grant me good judgment and knowledge,for I place my trust in your precepts.

67.verse: Before I was afflicted I went astray,but now I observe your word.

68.verse: You are good, and what you do is good;teach me your decrees.

69.verse: The arrogant spread lies about me,but with all my heart I observe your commands.

70.verse: Their hearts are gross and insensitive,but I find my delight in your law.

71.verse: It was a blessing for me to be afflicted,so that I might learn your decrees.

72.verse: The law from your mouth is more precious to methan thousands of gold and silver pieces.Yodh

73.verse: Your hands have created and formed me;grant me understanding so that I may learn your precepts.

74.verse: Those who fear you will rejoice when they see mebecause I place my hope in your word.

75.verse: I know, O Lord, that your judgments are righteousand in your fidelity you have humbled me.

76.verse: May your kindness bring consolation to meas you have promised your servant.

77.verse: Grant me your compassion so that I may live,for your law is my delight.

78.verse: May the arrogant who oppress me without cause be put to shame;I will meditate on your commands.

79.verse: May those turn to me who fear you,those who understand your statutes.

80.verse: May my heart be without blame toward your decreesso that I may not be put to shame.Kaph

81.verse: My soul pines for your salvation without ceasing;I place my hope in your word.

82.verse: My eyes fail, looking for your word,and I cry out, “When will you comfort me?”

83.verse: I am shriveled like a smoke-filled wineskin,but I do not forget your decrees.

84.verse: How long must your servant wait?When will you pass judgment on my persecutors?

85.verse: The arrogant dig pits to entrap me,which is not in keeping with your law.

86.verse: All of your precepts are true;come to my aid, for I am persecuted unjustly.

87.verse: My enemies almost took away my life,but I have not forsaken your commands.

88.verse: In your kindness spare my life,and I will obey the statutes of your mouth.Lamedh

89.verse: Your word, O Lord, is everlasting;it is firmly fixed in the heavens.

90.verse: Your faithfulness lasts through all generations;you established the earth, and it endures.

91.verse: By your judgments all creatures continue to exist,for they are all your servants.

92.verse: If your law had not been my delight,I would have already perished in my misery.

93.verse: Never will I forget your commands,for through them you have given me life.

94.verse: I am yours; save me,for I seek your commandments.

95.verse: The wicked lie in wait to destroy me,but I continue to ponder your decrees.

96.verse: I have seen that every perfection is limited,but your precept is unlimited.Mem

97.verse: I truly love your law.It is my meditation throughout the day.

98.verse: Your precept has given me greater wisdom than my enemies,for it is mine forever.

99.verse: I am wiser than all my teachersbecause I meditate on your commands.

100.verse: I have greater insight than the elders,because I keep your commandments.

101.verse: I point my feet away from evil pathsso that I might observe your word.

102.verse: I refuse to ignore your judgments,for it is you yourself who have taught me.

103.verse: Your words are sweet to my palate,even sweeter to my tongue than honey.

104.verse: Through your commandments I achieve wisdom;therefore, I hate every way that is false.Nun

105.verse: Your word is a lamp for my feetand a light to my path.

106.verse: With a solemn vow I have swornto obey the judgments of your righteousness.

107.verse: I have been afflicted beyond measure;O Lord, let me live in accord with your word.

108.verse: Receive, O Lord, the homage my lips offer you,and instruct me about your judgments.

109.verse: Even though I continually take my life in my hands,I do not neglect your law.

110.verse: The wicked seek to entrap me,but I have not strayed from your commands.

111.verse: Your statutes are my everlasting heritage;they are the very joy of my heart.

112.verse: I have set my heart on keeping your decrees,even to the end.Samekh

113.verse: I detest those who are hypocritical,but I love your law.

114.verse: You are my refuge and my shield;I put my hope in your word.

115.verse: Depart from my presence, you evildoers,so that I may observe the precepts of my God.

116.verse: Sustain me according to your promise, and I will live;do not delude me in my hope.

117.verse: Uphold me, and I will be savedand will remain completely focused on your decrees.

118.verse: You cast away all those who swerve from your decrees;their cunning is futile.

119.verse: You discard all the wicked of the earth like dross;therefore, I love your teachings.

120.verse: My flesh trembles before you in terror;your judgments fill me with awe.Ayin

121.verse: Since my conduct has been just and upright,do not abandon me to those who oppress me.

122.verse: Guarantee the well-being of your servant;do not allow the arrogant to oppress me.

123.verse: My eyes fail as I long for your salvationand for the promise of your justice.

124.verse: Deal with your servant in accordance with your kindness,and teach me your decrees.

125.verse: I am your servant; grant me discernmentso that I may understand your statutes.

126.verse: It is time, O Lord, for you to take action;your law has been broken.

127.verse: That is why I love your preceptsmore than gold, even the purest gold.

128.verse: That is why I regard all your commandments as rightand despise every way that is false.Pe

129.verse: Wonderful are your statutes;therefore, I willingly observe them.

130.verse: The explanation of your words gives lightand imparts understanding to the simple.

131.verse: I open wide my mouth and sigh,longing eagerly for your precepts.

132.verse: Turn and have mercy on me,as you always do to those who love your name.

133.verse: Guide my steps in accord with your wordand never let evil triumph over me.

134.verse: Rescue me from the oppression of menso that I may observe your commandments.

135.verse: Allow your face to shine upon your servantand teach me your decrees.

136.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyesbecause your law is disregarded.Sadhe

137.verse: You are righteous, O Lord,and your judgments are right.

138.verse: You have set down your statutes as righteousand as completely faithful.

139.verse: Zeal has consumed mebecause my adversaries ignore your words.

140.verse: Your word has been tested through and through,and your servant cherishes it.

141.verse: Although I am despised and unimportant,I do not forget your commands.

142.verse: Your righteousness is everlasting,and your law is forever true.

143.verse: I am afflicted by anguish and distress,but your precepts are my delight.

144.verse: Your statutes are forever righteous;grant me understanding and I will live.Qoph

145.verse: I call out to you with my whole heart;answer me, O Lord, so that I may observe your decrees.

146.verse: I cry out to you;save me so that I may obey your statutes.

147.verse: I arise before dawn and cry out for help;I place my hope in your word.

148.verse: My eyes are awake before each watch of the nightso that I may meditate on your word.

149.verse: In accordance with your kindness hear my voice, O Lord;grant me life in accordance with your judgments.

150.verse: Those who plot wickedness draw near me,but they are far from your law.

151.verse: Yet you, O Lord, are near,and all your precepts are true.

152.verse: Long have I known your decreesand that you have established them forever.Resh

153.verse: See my suffering and deliver me,for I have not forgotten your law.

154.verse: Defend my cause and redeem me;let me live in accord with your word.

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wickedbecause they do not consider your decrees.

156.verse: Great is your compassion, O Lord;let me live in accord with your judgments.

157.verse: My persecutors and my enemies are many,but I do not cast aside your statutes.

158.verse: I regard the faithless with indignationbecause they do not observe your word.

159.verse: Consider how I love your precepts, O Lord;let me live in accord with your kindness.

160.verse: Every word you utter is true,and all your righteous judgments are everlasting.Shin

161.verse: The powerful persecute me without cause,but it is your word that awes my heart.

162.verse: I rejoice in your wordlike one who discovers a great treasure.

163.verse: Falsehood I abhor and detest,but I love your law.

164.verse: Seven times a day I praise youfor your righteous judgments.

165.verse: Those who love your law have great peace;they encounter no stumbling blocks.

166.verse: I await your salvation, O Lord,and I carry out your precepts.

167.verse: I obey your statutes,for I love them dearly.

168.verse: I obey your commands and your statutes;indeed, all my ways are known to you.Taw

169.verse: May my cry come before you, O Lord;grant me understanding according to your word.

170.verse: May my supplication come before you;deliver me according to your word.

171.verse: May my lips proclaim your praisebecause you teach me your decrees.

172.verse: May my tongue sing of your word,for all of your precepts are upright.

173.verse: May your hand be ready to help me,for I have chosen your commandments.

174.verse: I long for your salvation, O Lord,and your law is my delight.

175.verse: Give life to my soul that I may praise you,and let your judgments sustain me.

176.verse: I have wandered away like a lost sheep;seek out your servant,for I have not forgotten your precepts.

1.verse: The Songs of Ascents and Great Hallel—Pss 120–136 -Psalm 120 -A Complaint against Treacherous Tongues -A song of ascents.Whenever I am in distress,I cry out to the Lord and he answers me.

2.verse: Deliver me, O Lord, from lying lipsand from deceitful tongues.

3.verse: What will he inflict upon you,and what more will he add to it,O deceitful tongue?

4.verse: He has prepared a warrior’s sharp arrowsand red-hot coals of the broom tree.

5.verse: Why have I been doomed as an exile in Meshechand forced to dwell among the tents of Kedar?

6.verse: Far too long have I livedamong people who despise peace.

7.verse: When I proclaim peace,they shout for war.

1.verse: Psalm 121 -God, Guardian of His People -A song of ascents.I lift up my eyes to the mountains;from where will I receive help?

2.verse: My help comes from the Lord,the Maker of heaven and earth.

3.verse: He will not permit your foot to stumble;he who guards you will not fall asleep.

4.verse: Indeed, the one who guards Israelnever slumbers, never sleeps.

5.verse: The Lord serves as your guardian;he is at your right hand to serve as your shade.

6.verse: The sun will not strike you during the day,nor the moon during the night.

7.verse: The Lord will protect you against all evil;he will watch over your life.

8.verse: The Lord will watch over your coming and your goingboth now and forevermore.

1.verse: Psalm 122 -The Pilgrim’s Greeting to the Holy City -A song of ascents. Of David.I rejoiced when they said to me,“Let us go to the house of the Lord.”

2.verse: And finally our feet are standingat your gates, O Jerusalem.

3.verse: Jerusalem is built as a citythat is firmly bound together in unity.

4.verse: There the tribes go up,the tribes of the Lord,as it was decreed for Israelto celebrate the name of the Lord.

5.verse: For there the thrones of judgment were established,the thrones of the house of David.

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:“May those who love you rest secure.

7.verse: May there be peace within your wallsand security in your palaces.”

8.verse: Out of love for my relatives and friends,I will say, “May peace be within you.”

9.verse: Out of love for the house of the Lord, our God,I will pray for your well-being.

1.verse: Psalm 123 -Prayer in Time of Spiritual Need -A song of ascents.I lift up my eyes to you,to you who are enthroned in heaven.

2.verse: Behold, as the eyes of servantsare on the hand of their master,or as the eyes of a maidfocus on the hand of her mistress,so our eyes are on the Lord, our God,as we wait for him to show us his mercy.

3.verse: Show us your mercy, O Lord, show us your mercy,for we have suffered more than our share of contempt.

4.verse: We have had to suffer far too longthe insults of the haughtyand the contempt of the arrogant.

1.verse: Psalm 124 -Thanksgiving for the Lord’s Help -A song of ascents. Of David.If the Lord had not been on our side—let Israel now proclaim—

2.verse: if the Lord had not been on our sidewhen our enemies attacked us,

3.verse: then they would have swallowed us aliveas their wrath was kindled against us.

4.verse: The waters would have washed us away,the torrent would have swept over us,

5.verse: and we would have drownedin the raging waters.

6.verse: Blessed be the Lord,who did not give us as prey to their teeth.

7.verse: We have escaped like a birdfrom the snare of the fowlers;the snare was broken,and we escaped.

8.verse: Our help is in the name of the Lord,the Maker of heaven and earth.

1.verse: Psalm 125 -God, Protector of His People -A song of ascents.Those who put their trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion,which cannot be shaken but stands fast forever.

2.verse: As the mountains surround Jerusalem,so the Lord surrounds his peopleboth now and forevermore.

3.verse: The scepter of the wicked will not prevailover the land allotted to the righteous,so that the righteous will not be temptedto turn their hands to evil.

4.verse: Do good, O Lord, to those who are good,to those who are upright of heart.

5.verse: But the Lord will assign to the ranks of the evildoersthose who turn their hearts to wickedness.May peace be granted to Israel.

1.verse: Psalm 126 -God, Our Joy and Our Hope -A song of ascents.When the Lord brought home the captives to Zion,we seemed to be dreaming.

2.verse: Our mouths were filled with laughterand our tongues with songs of joy.Then it was said among the nations,“The Lord has done great things for them.”

3.verse: The Lord has indeed done great deeds for us,and we are overflowing with joy.

4.verse: Once again restore our fortunes, O Lord,as you did for the streams in the Negeb.

5.verse: Those who sow in tearswill reap with songs of joy.

6.verse: Those who go forth weeping,carrying the seeds to be sown,will return with shouts of joy,carrying their sheaves.

1.verse: Psalm 127 -Need of Divine Assistance -A song of ascents. Of Solomon.If the Lord does not build the house,those who construct it labor in vain.If the Lord does not guard the city,those who keep watch over it do so in vain.

2.verse: It is useless for you to rise earlierand delay taking your rest at night,toiling relentlessly for the bread you eat;for while those he loves sleep,he provides all of this for them.

3.verse: Behold, children are a gift from the Lord,a reward of the fruit of the womb.

4.verse: Like arrows in the hands of a warriorare the children born in one’s youth.

5.verse: Blessed is the manwho has filled his quiver with them.He will never be forced to retreatwhen he is confronted by his enemies at the city gate.

1.verse: Psalm 128 -Happy Home of the Righteous -A song of ascents.Blessed are all those who fear the Lordand walk in his ways.

2.verse: You will eat the fruit of your labors;you will enjoy both blessings and prosperity.

3.verse: Your wife will be like a fruitful vinewithin your house;your sons will be like shoots of an olive treearound your table.

4.verse: Such are the blessings that will be bestowedon the man who fears the Lord.

5.verse: May the Lord bless you from Zionall the days of your life.May you rejoice in the prosperity of Jerusalem

6.verse: and live to see your children’s children.Peace be upon Israel.

1.verse: Psalm 129 -Prayer in Time of Persecution -A song of ascents.They have greatly oppressed me from my youth—let Israel say—

2.verse: they have greatly oppressed me from my youth,but never have my enemies prevailed against me.

3.verse: The plowers plowed upon my back,making deep furrows.

4.verse: However, the Lord is righteous,freeing me from the bonds of the wicked.

5.verse: May all those who hate Zionbe thrown back in shame and confusion.

6.verse: May they be like grass on the rooftopsthat withers before it can be plucked,

7.verse: so that it can never fill the hands of the reapersor the arms of the binders of sheaves.

8.verse: May those who pass by never cry out,“The blessing of the Lord be upon you!We bless you in the name of the Lord.”

1.verse: Psalm 130 -Prayer for Pardon and Peace -A song of ascents.Out of the depths I cry to you, O Lord;

2.verse: O Lord, hear my voice.Let your ears be attentiveto my cries of supplication.

3.verse: If you, O Lord, kept a record of our sins,O Lord, who could stand upright?

4.verse: But with you there is forgivenessso that you may be revered.

5.verse: I wait for the Lord in anxious expectation;I place my hope in his word.

6.verse: My soul waits for the Lordmore than watchmen wait for the dawn.More than watchmen wait for the dawn

7.verse: let Israel wait for the Lord.For with the Lord there is kindness,as well as plenteous redemption.

8.verse: He alone will redeem Israelfrom all its sins.

1.verse: Psalm 131 -Childlike Trust in God -A song of ascents. Of David.O Lord, my heart is not proud,nor are my eyes raised too high.I do not concern myself with great affairsor with things too sublime for me.

2.verse: Rather, I have stilled and calmed my soul,hushed it like a weaned child.Like a weaned child held in its mother’s arms,so is my soul within me.

3.verse: O Israel, put your hope in the Lordboth now and forevermore.

1.verse: Psalm 132 -The Divine Promises Made to David -A song of ascents.Remember, O Lord, for David’s sake,all the difficulties he endured.

2.verse: He swore an oath to the Lordand vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

3.verse: “I will not enter the house I live inor lie down on the bed where I sleep,

4.verse: neither will I allow myself to fall asleepor even to close my eyes,

5.verse: until I find a home for the Lord,a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

6.verse: We heard of it in Ephrathah;we came upon it in the fields of Jaar.

7.verse: Let us enter his dwelling place,let us worship at his footstool.

8.verse: Arise, O Lord, and go up to your resting place,you and the Ark of your might.

9.verse: Let your priests clothe themselves with righteousness,and let your saints shout for joy.

10.verse: For the sake of your servant David,do not reject your anointed one.

11.verse: The Lord swore this oath to David,an oath that he will not renounce:“One of your own descendantsI will place on your throne.

12.verse: If your sons keep my covenantand the statutes that I will teach them,their sons will also ruleon your throne from age to age.”

13.verse: For the Lord has chosen Zion;he has designated it for his home:

14.verse: “This will be my resting place forever;here I will reside, for such is my wish.

15.verse: “I will bless it with abundant provisionsand satisfy its poor with their fill of bread.

16.verse: I will clothe its priests with salvation,and its saints will shout for joy.

17.verse: “There I will raise up a horn for Davidand prepare a lamp for my anointed one.

18.verse: I will clothe his enemies with shame,but on his head there will be a resplendent crown.”

1.verse: Psalm 133 -The Blessings of Brotherly Accord -A song of ascents. Of David.How wonderful and delightful it isfor brothers to live together in unity.

2.verse: It is like fragrant ointment poured on the head,running down upon the beard,running down upon the beard of Aaron,and flowing on the collar of his robes.

3.verse: It is like the dew of Hermonfalling upon the mountains of Zion.For there the Lord has bestowed his blessing,life forevermore.

1.verse: Psalm 134 -Invitation to Night Prayer -A song of ascents.Come forth to bless the Lord,all you servants of the Lord,who minister throughout the nightin the house of the Lord.

2.verse: Lift up your hands toward the sanctuaryand bless the Lord.

3.verse: May the Lord, the Maker of heaven and earth,bless you from Zion.

1.verse: Psalm 135 -Praise of God, Benefactor of His People -Alleluia.Praise the name of the Lord;offer him praise, you servants of the Lord,

2.verse: you who minister in the house of the Lord,in the courts of the house of our God.

3.verse: Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;sing to honor his name, for he is gracious.

4.verse: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself,Israel as his treasured possession.

5.verse: I know that the Lord is great,that our Lord is superior to all gods.

6.verse: The Lord does whatever he pleasesin heaven and on earth,in the seas and in all their depths.

7.verse: He causes clouds to risefrom the ends of the earth;he sends lightning with the rainand brings forth the wind from his storehouses.

8.verse: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,those of humans as well as of animals.

9.verse: He sent signs and portents into your midst, O Egypt,against Pharaoh and all his servants.

10.verse: He struck down many nationsand slew mighty kings:

11.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites,Og, king of Bashan,and all the kings of Canaan.

12.verse: He then gave their lands as a heritage,a heritage to his people Israel.

13.verse: Your name, O Lord, endures forever,your renown, O Lord, lasts throughout the ages.

14.verse: For the Lord will vindicate his peopleand show compassion to his servants.

15.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold,the work of human hands.

16.verse: They have mouths but they cannot speak;they have eyes but they cannot see.

17.verse: They have ears but they cannot hear,and there is no breath in their mouths.

18.verse: Those who make them end up like them,as do all who place their trust in them.

19.verse: O house of Israel, bless the Lord!O house of Aaron, bless the Lord!

20.verse: O house of Levi, bless the Lord!You who fear the Lord, bless the Lord!

21.verse: Blessed from Zion be the Lord,he who dwells in Jerusalem.Alleluia.

1.verse: Psalm 136 -Thanksgiving for the Creation and Redemption -Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,for his love endures forever.

2.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods,for his love endures forever.

3.verse: Give thanks to the Lord of lords,for his love endures forever.

4.verse: He alone works great wonders,for his love endures forever.

5.verse: In his wisdom he made the heavens,for his love endures forever.

6.verse: He spread out the earth upon the waters,for his love endures forever.

7.verse: He made the great lights,for his love endures forever.

8.verse: He made the sun to rule over the day,for his love endures forever.

9.verse: He made the moon and stars to rule the night,for his love endures forever.

10.verse: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,for his love endures forever.

11.verse: He led forth Israel from among them,for his love endures forever.

12.verse: He did so with a strong hand and outstretched arm,for his love endures forever.

13.verse: He divided the Red Sea in two,for his love endures forever.

14.verse: Then he led Israel through its midst,for his love endures forever.

15.verse: But he swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea,for his love endures forever.

16.verse: Then he led his people through the wilderness,for his love endures forever.

17.verse: He struck down great kings,for his love endures forever.

18.verse: He slew powerful kings,for his love endures forever.

19.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites,for his love endures forever.

20.verse: Og, king of Bashan,for his love endures forever.

21.verse: He gave their land as a heritage,for his love endures forever.

22.verse: The heritage was for his servant Israel,for his love endures forever.

23.verse: The Lord remembered us in our wretched state,for his love endures forever.

24.verse: He rescued us from our enemies,for his love endures forever.

25.verse: He provides food to every creature,for his love endures forever.

26.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven,for his love endures forever.

1.verse: Psalm 137 -The Exiles’ Remembrance of Zion -By the rivers of Babylonwe sat down and weptwhen we remembered Zion.

2.verse: There on the poplarswe hung up our harps.

3.verse: For it was there that our captorsasked us to sing them a song,and, tormenting us, demanded a joyful song:“Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”

4.verse: But how could we sing songs of the Lordwhile living in a foreign land?

5.verse: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,may my right hand fail me.

6.verse: May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouthif I do not remember you,if I do not regard Jerusalemas the greatest of my joys.

7.verse: Remember, O Lord, the cruelty of the Edomiteson the day when Jerusalem fell,how they shouted, “Tear it down!Tear it down to its very foundations!”

8.verse: O Daughter of Babylon, you destroyer,happy will he be who repays youfor the suffering you inflicted upon us!

9.verse: Happy will he be who seizes your babiesand smashes them against a rock!

1.verse: Psalm 138 -Thanksgiving for God’s Favor -Of David.I offer you thanks, O Lord, with all my heart;before the “gods” I sing your praise.

2.verse: I bow down toward your holy templeand I praise your namefor your kindness and your faithfulness,for you have exalted above all thingsyour name and your word.

3.verse: On the day I cried out, you answered meand granted strength to my spirit.

4.verse: All the kings of the earth will praise you, O Lord,when they hear the words of your mouth.

5.verse: They will sing of the ways of the Lord:“How great is the Lord’s glory!”

6.verse: For though the Lord is exalted, he cares for the lowly,but he remains far distant from the proud.

7.verse: Although I walk in the midst of hostility,you preserve my life.You stretch out your hand against the wrath of my enemies,and with your right hand you deliver me.

8.verse: The Lord will fulfill his plan for me.Your kindness, O Lord, endures forever;do not forsake the work of your hands.

1.verse: Psalm 139 -God’s Infinite Knowledge and Universal Power -For the director. A psalm of David.O Lord, you have examined meand you know me.

2.verse: You know when I sit and when I stand;you perceive my thoughts from a distance.

3.verse: You mark when I go out and when I lie down;all my ways are open to you.

4.verse: A word is not even on my tongueand you, O Lord, are completely aware of it.

5.verse: You enfold me from in front and from behind,and you place your hand upon me.

6.verse: Your knowledge is beyond my comprehension,far too sublime for me to attain.

7.verse: Where can I go to hide from your spirit?Where can I flee from your presence?

8.verse: If I ascend to the heavens, you are there;if I take my rest in the netherworld, you are also there.

9.verse: If I rise on the wings of the dawnand settle at the farthest limits of the sea,

10.verse: even there your hand will guide me,and your right hand will hold me fast.

11.verse: If I say, “Surely the darkness will conceal meand the day around me will turn to night,”

12.verse: even the darkness is not dark to you;the night is as bright as the day,for to you darkness and light are the same.

13.verse: You created my inmost being;you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

14.verse: I praise you because I am wonderfully made;awesome are your works,as I know very well.

15.verse: My body was not hidden from youwhen I was being made in secret.When I was woven together in the depths of the earth,you saw me in the womb.

16.verse: The sum total of my dayswere all recorded in your book.My life was fashionedbefore it had come into being.

17.verse: How precious to me are your designs, O God!How vast in number they are!

18.verse: If I were to attempt to count them,they would outnumber the grains of sand.When I awake,I am still with you.

19.verse: If only you would slay the wicked, O God,and the bloodthirsty would leave me!

20.verse: They blaspheme your nameand treacherously rise up against you.

21.verse: Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord,and loathe those who rise up against you?

22.verse: My hatred for them is unlimited;I regard them as my personal enemies.

23.verse: Examine me, O God, and know my heart;test me and understand my thoughts.

24.verse: See if I follow an evil way,and guide me on the way to eternity.

1.verse: Psalm 140 -Prayer for Deliverance from the Snares of the Wicked -For the director. A psalm of David.

2.verse: Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers;protect me from those who are violent,

3.verse: who plan evil schemes in their heartsand stir up strife continually.

4.verse: Their tongues are as sharp as those of a serpent,while the venom of vipers is on their lips. Selah

5.verse: Guard me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked;protect me from those who are violent,who are determined to cause my downfall.

6.verse: The arrogant have set a hidden trap for me;they have spread out cords as a net,laying snares for me along the way. Selah

7.verse: I say to the Lord, “You are my God.Listen, O Lord, to the voice of my supplications.”

8.verse: O Lord, my God, my strong deliverer,you shield my head on the day of battle.

9.verse: Do not grant the desires of the wicked, O Lord;do not permit their evil plots to succeed,or they will become proud. Selah

10.verse: Those who surround me raise up their heads;let them be overwhelmed by the malice they threaten.

11.verse: May burning coals rain down on them;may they be flung down into the miry depths,never again to rise.

12.verse: Do not permit slanderers to find rest in the land;may evil hunt the violent to their death.

13.verse: I know that the Lord secures justice for the poorand upholds the cause of the needy.

1.verse: Psalm 141 -Prayer for Protection against Evildoers -A psalm of David.O Lord, I call to you; come quickly to my aid;listen to my plea when I call out to you.

2.verse: May my prayer be like incense before you,the lifting up of my hands like the evening sacrifice.

3.verse: Set a guard over my mouth, O Lord;keep watch over the door of my lips.

4.verse: Do not permit my heart to be drawn to evil,or to the pursuit of wicked deedsin the company of those who do evil;let me not share in their corruption.

5.verse: If a righteous man strikes me, I regard it as kindness;if he rebukes me, it is oil on my head.But never let the oil of the wicked anoint my head,for my prayer is always opposed to their evil deeds.

6.verse: When their leaders are flung down in stony places,they will learn that my prayers were heard.

7.verse: As the soil is shattered when the ground is plowed,so our bones are scattered at the mouth of the netherworld.

8.verse: But my eyes are turned to you, O Lord God;in you I seek refuge;do not take my life away.

9.verse: Keep me safe from the traps they have laid for me,from the snares of evildoers.

10.verse: Let the wicked tumble into their own nets all togetherwhile I pass by unharmed.

1.verse: Psalm 142 -Prayer in Time of Abandonment -A maskil of David. When he was in the cave. A prayer.

2.verse: I cry out to the Lord with my plea;I entreat the Lord to grant me mercy.

3.verse: Before him I pour out my complaintand tell my troubles in his presence.

4.verse: No matter how faint my spirit is within me,you are there to guide my steps.Along the path on which I travelthey have hidden a trap for me.

5.verse: I look to my right,but there is no friend who knows me.There is no refuge available to me;no one cares whether I live or perish.

6.verse: I cry out to you, O Lord;I say, “You are my refuge,my portion in the land of the living.”

7.verse: Listen to my plea for help,for I am in desperate straits.Rescue me from those who seek to persecute me,for they are too strong for me.

1.verse: Psalm 143 -Prayer of a Penitent in Distress -A psalm of David.O Lord, hear my prayer,incline your ear to my supplications.In your faithfulness respond to mewith your righteousness.

2.verse: Do not subject your servant to your judgment,for no one living is righteous before you.

3.verse: An enemy has stalked me unrelentinglyand crushed me into the ground;he has left me to live in darknesslike those long dead.

4.verse: My spirit is faint within me,and my heart has succumbed to fear.

5.verse: I remember the days of old,reflecting on all your actionsand meditating on the works of your hands.

6.verse: I stretch out my hands to you;my soul thirsts for you like a parched land. Selah

7.verse: Answer me quickly, O Lord,for my spirit grows faint.Do not hide your face from meor I will be like those who go down to the pit.

8.verse: At dawn let me experience your kindness,for in you I place my trust.Show me the path I must walk,for to you I lift up my soul.

9.verse: Deliver me from my enemies, O Lord,for in you I seek refuge.

10.verse: Teach me to do your will,for you are my God.Let your gracious Spirit lead mealong a level path.

11.verse: For your name’s sake, O Lord, preserve my life;in your righteousness deliver me from distress.

12.verse: In your kindness, destroy my enemies,and annihilate all those who oppress me,for I am your servant.

1.verse: Psalm 144 -Prayer for Victory and Peace -Of David.Blessed be the Lord, my Rock,who trains my hands for warand my fingers for battle.

2.verse: You are my safeguard and my fortress,my stronghold and my deliverer,my shield in whom I take refuge,the one who subdues nations under me.

3.verse: O Lord, what is man that you care for him,or the son of man that you think of him?

4.verse: Man is nothing more than a breath;his days are like a fleeting shadow.

5.verse: Part the heavens, O Lord, and descend;touch the mountains so that they smoke.

6.verse: Flash forth lightning bolts and scatter my foes;rout them with your arrows.

7.verse: Reach forth your hand from on high;deliver me and rescue mefrom the mighty watersand from the power of foreign foes

8.verse: whose mouths utter liesand whose right hands are raised to swear to untruths.

9.verse: I will sing a new song to you, my God;on a ten-stringed lyre I will play music for you.

10.verse: You grant victory to kingsand deliverance to your servant David from the cruel sword.

11.verse: Deliver me and rescue mefrom the hands of foreign foeswhose mouths utter liesand whose right hands are raised to swear to untruths.

12.verse: May our sons in their youthbe like carefully nurtured plants,and may our daughters be like pillarsdesigned to adorn a palace.

13.verse: May our barns be filledwith every kind of crop.May our sheep increase by thousands,by tens of thousands in our fields,

14.verse: and may our cattle be well fed.May there be no breach in our walls,no going into exile,no cries of distress in our streets.

15.verse: Blessed are the people for whom this is true;blessed are the people whose God is the Lord.

1.verse: Psalm 145 -Praise of the Divine Majesty -Praise. Of David.I will extol you, my God and King;I will bless your name forever and ever.

2.verse: Every day I will bless youand praise your name forever and ever.

3.verse: Great is the Lord and worthy of the highest praise;no one can even begin to comprehend his greatness.

4.verse: Each generation will praise your works to the nextand proclaim your mighty deeds.
